Summary Heading: Great place to stay and go to the parks or convention center
Summary: Rooms were recently remodeled , Great staff and always a good time  Love it there . Easy walk to parks, staff always willing to help. Restaurants near by and convention center. clean, great heated pool and hot tubs ...
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your fantastic review! We are so happy to hear you had a great stay with us, and we hope to see you on the next one!

Summary: We stay at Dolphins Cove every time we come to Anaheim.  They have clean rooms which have been recently redone.  Hardwood floors and new carpets in the bedrooms. The outdoor plants and lawns are beautiful and well-kept.  We had a small maintenance problem and in a few minutes Jonathan came to help us.    We did not use the pool as it was quite cool.  Oh  yes, the restaurant Dennys is right next door- a great place to eat.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your fantastic review! We are so happy to hear you had a great stay with us, and we hope to see you on the next one!

Summary: This place has everything necessary to make your stay perfect!!  Friendly staff, quick responses and beautiful and spacious rooms. Loved the bed. Everything was great. Even though our room, was right on the street, it was very quiet.
Manager Response: We're so happy to hear you enjoyed your visit! Thank you for sharing your review and we hope to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: I wanted a place near Disneyland with a full kitchen and this fit the bill. Because of snow and illness back home we had to delay our flight. The property was fully booked so I was grateful that they held our room for us (paid of course) for 2 days.   It’s a simple Wyndham condo with basic amenities including a pool, coffee in the little lobby, clubhouse and a little game room with paid games. We did the kids holiday crafts which was nice, and I saw they had a complimentary wine tasting the next afternoon. Dennys is right next door if you don’t feel like making breakfast. Warm staff, easy check-in and check-out.  We had a nice stay, it was everything we needed and a good value. Be aware that while they will have extra blankets, towels and ground coffee available this is not a
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your fantastic review! We are so happy to hear you had a great stay with us, and we hope to see you on the next one!

Summary: Perfect for Disney! We had a wonderful time here. We had a beautifully updated 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom suite right by the pool. The kitchen had everything we could possibly want, and the suite was spacious and clean. The pool and hot tub was awesome. Parking was great and it was easy to walk to the Disney parking lot (or even Disney). Very impressed!
Room tip: We came in November and the pool area was never busy. Parking was easy and the area was very...

Summary: My family group of 6 from New Zealand, stayed mid October 2022. The group is a family of 5 and one sibling.  We had a two bedroom suite amd sofa bed.  We spent the evenings hanging out with extended family from Seattle. We grilled on an immaculately clean BBQ, even though it was used only two hours early by another resident.  The room was large, the full kitchen perfect for a large group. As was the massive table.  The pool and hot tub were great after a warm day.  I appreciated the sales person respecting my declination of a seminar, as time was precious to us. Plus he also helped us out with a code to gain discounts at Vons down the road.  While it is subjective, the beds were spoken of positively, even the sofa bed. The AC was welcome as rhr nights were warm.  We thoroughly
Manager Response: We're so happy to hear you enjoyed your visit! Thank you for sharing your review and we hope to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: Everything except the bed was great. The location was great. The room was great. the furniture was also great except the bed. The service as also good even though it took 2 days to change out the bed. It had be remodeled and look great. I was surprise the furniture in the living room was so comfortable.
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving a review of your stay with us. We are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay. We will ensure your concerns regarding the visit are passed along to resort management so that we may continue to improve in the future.

Summary: The room smelled very bad and maint Eve came to clean the drains twice and the smell just came back every time after a few hours. It was disgusting and made it hard to even sleep. We were at Disney all day so the only time we were at the room was to sleep

Can you please call our Owner Care team at 1-800-251-8736 so we can learn more about your vacation? We look forward to connecting.

Summary: We were a family of 5 with adult kids and we stayed for a week in a two bedroom suite at the end of August. I have really nothing negative to say! The suite was a great price for the space, clean and newly renovated. The staff was friendly and gave us our request for a quiet suite. The pool and hot tubs were great and we even played mini golf. I would stay here again for the size of room you get for the price. We booked directly with the hotel so we had no cancellation issues.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review. We are so happy to hear you had a great stay with us! We love when our guests have a great time on vacation, and we hope to see you on the next one.

Summary: Unfortunately another experience of the Dolphins Cove cancelling a reservation because they are over booked. Reservation made and paid for in January and cancelled 2 days before arrival date. No money returned, how are you supposed to pay for alternative accommodation ?? Advised by booking.com that it will take up to 10 days to receive my money back !! Extremely poor service by both parties.  Temporarily homeless from the UK

Summary: Avoid Remodeled Unit 515 or the suite below. If anything goes wrong with your room, expect less than nothing from the staff. The day before checkout late morning/early afternoon my kitchen sink stopped draining. I was trying to get the dishes washed so I could then go to the grocery store and top up our food for the last day of stay with a kitchen and come back and cook.  I called the resort desk and they sent up and “engineer” he could not fix it from my room. They then went up on the roof and had someone in the room simultaneously for about 3 hours. The attempted clearing of the pipes has now backed up into my washroom sink (it's disgusting sludge that smells). I can no longer use the kitchen or washroom sinks. They determined they could not fix it. I’ve been stuck for 3 hours

But when we do, we try to make it right. Can you please call our Owner Care team at 1-800-251-8736 so we can learn more about your vacation? Thank you.

Summary Heading: Recently remodeled condos with friendly staff
Summary: Great remodeled condos on beautiful grounds. With very friendly and helpful staff. About 20 min walk to Disney. Or the Toy Story parking lot is about a 7 min walk to catch a ride with the parking lot bus, straight to main gate. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving a review of your stay with us. We are glad to hear you enjoyed your visit, and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: A nice hotel close to the park.
Summary: We recently stayed and it was an enjoyable visit. The rooms are nicely updated. The beds are very comfortable. The rooms were very spacious. Great amenities. My only complaint would be that while updated the room was not very clean. There was a mound of hair in the tub and a ton of dust on the trim. All and all I would recommend the hotel for someone who wants to stay close to the park
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving a review of your stay with us. We are glad to hear you enjoyed your visit, and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: We really enjoyed Dolphin's Cove.   It was very clean, beautiful grounds.   Our room was updated.  We had a 2 bedroom and it was perfect for a family of 4 since our kids are older. There is still a little construction left while they are remodeling, but it did not interfere with our stay at all.  It is in a great location to easily walk to the Garden Walk, nice restaurants and Disneyland Toy Story lot if you do not want to drive.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your fantastic review! We are so happy to hear you had a great stay with us, and we hope to see you on the next one!

Summary Heading: Another wonderful stay at Dolphins Cove
Summary: Our experience was wonderful.  They are fully remodeling the units and they are beautiful.  Large pool area with 2 large hot tubs.  There is also a clubhouse, ping-pong table outside, mini golf area. Getting to Disneyland- you can walk and it’s about a 25 minute walk.   You can Uber but the prices are really high first thing in the morning and the evening.  There is a free shuttle “Toy Story” around the corner but it’s about a 15 minute walk so you might as well just walk to Disneyland.  Last is the “ART” bus.  You need an app that the front desk with give you the link.  Please know, that ART has 2 stops by Dolphins Cove; one around the corner by Dennys (4 minute walk) that stop is the #3 bus and right across the street the #4 bus. Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review. We are so happy to hear you had a great stay with us! We love when our guests have a great time on vacation, and we hope to see you on the next one.

Summary Heading: Cockroaches in the bathroom and kitchen
Summary: There were cockroaches in the bathroom and kitchen. My sister-in-law planned to stay with us, but she had to book a separate hotel because of it. We were afraid that we would bring cockroaches or their eggs home with us and infect our home.
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We are terribly sorry to hear of your concern - experiences such as this are unacceptable and the cleanliness of our suites and our entire resort is one of our top priorities. We’d like to discuss this with you further. Please call our Owner Resolution Team at 855-670-0758.

Summary: Easy to walk to parks if you use the Disney Bus at the toy story lot.  Free.  Pools are nice, activities  kids and adults.   Right next door to Denny's . I have stayed 4 times now, always a good experience. Staff was nice. extra towels no problem
Manager Response: We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you so much for sharing your review. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Facility is nice once you get inside and the staff is friendly.     We had a "special" RCI room that had a tiny bathroom, was a bit dated AND had a view of a blank wall.    They would not move us when asked.    The parking lot was halfway full at best so they had other rooms.   Daughter said sofa bed was very uncomfortable.   Last but not least we needed maintenance twice to fix bathroom issues.   There are nicer places to stay - sorry.

Nice staff, limited activities, 3 adults, 2 children sharing 1 bath unit??  We were told even if a 2br 2 ba was available, RCI doesn’t get it!!  You could tell it was an old unit, needing updating, the beds were uncomfortable, staff were good, especially the pool attendant!

Okay so we booked this place through our RCI/DISNEY Vacation Club. We have been on a number of vacations,  so I might sound a little spoiled but I just feel that this place should not be included anything DISNEY.  This vacation was a family reunion  so we stayed for 6 whole days. Our room was done maybe 1 hr early which was great no doubt about that but that was the only thing good about this place oh yes one more thing is it was a gated area.  Our room had a very bad odor to it that got on our clothes and our mask and the bathroom fan was so loud we only used it when very necessary. We were way in the back behind the building too with a bad view.  I just expected more because if anyone knows about DVC we used our points we banked in a RCI account .

Summary Heading: Compared to a 1,000/night AirBnB we just came from, this was a Dream.
Summary: Compared to a 1,000/night AirBnB we just came from, this was a Dream.  I would take the Wyndham Club Dolphin's Cove over the 1.5 Mil home we rented. The time share was fully supplied, clean and comfortable. You can keep the AirBnb's, they should call it "Pot Luck". RCI member since 1982 approx.  (3 weeks owned)

Excellent service, friendly staff who are always cheerful and ever ready to assist with anything.  Clean room and comfortable. Safe and the location is great as it is walking distance to food and shopping

Summary Heading: Nice property close to many amenities.
Summary: We spent a week at Dolphin's Cove the week prior to Thanksgiving 2020. The property was well kept, clean, and everyone we interacted with at the property were very nice.  We enjoyed our stay. The units are large as this is a converted apartment/condo complex. They have a large pool, which was opened to a limited number of guests at a given time, because of COVID 19. The parking area is gated, and there are stores, restaurants, and fast food within easy walking distance.

Staff is excellent. Property is older but well maintained. Good location if going to Disneyland,  within walking distance.  I was at location over Halloween,  employees had a small Halloween for kids in parking lot (very nice and unexpected).

It was an amazing experience for the entire family! The Dolphins were well trained. The trainer was awesome! Everyone seem to be in a good mood and try to make it the best time for us they possibly could. Highly recommend!

Summary Heading: Great Time Near Disneyland With Family
Summary: We stay frequently at Wyndham properties. This one is an older facility that is well maintained. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They were not pushy with the timeshare meetings which we don’t go to anymore. It was very convenient to the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) stop around the corner. We purchased a three day pass through the ART app and were very pleased with that service. It only takes about 10 mins to get to and from Disney via the ART bus.  My only critique is that the facility could be updated aesthetically. Though in good repair, some of the furnishings are outdated. The style of the resort is a stucco structure. Again, it is well maintained, but it felt like we were on the set of Three’s Company (if your old enough to get that TV show reference).   The grounds

this is a great place to stay while visiting disneyland. its close to the parks which enabledus to come back in the afternoon and rest. nice pool and jacuzzi. Rooms have kitchens. Ours was a 1 bedroom and had a sofa sleeper in the living room

Nice resort. Clean and well maintained grounds, security present, gated entrance. A little older, but well maintained and comfortable no elevator for second floor is troublesome I’d you have any mobility issues.

Our room was clean. We had 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms with a kitchen,living room,and dining table. The hot tub and pool area was clean along with the landscaping. It was easy to get a Uber lift or many people walked to Disneyland. Would recommend staying at the hotel.

We recently stayed here, but wont be in the future. We had issues right off the bat at checkin, the ac units wouldnt run, rooms weren't the cleanest, our remotes needed "reprogramming" multiple times and the sofa bed was very uncomfortable and hard to use. The staff was extremely friendly aside from one and we can see why people like it there. It just isnt in the cards for us any longer. A quick walk to the Toy Story Lot from here is better than paying the daily parking fee though. That was a plus.
Manager Response: We're disappointed to hear that your most recent stay did not meet your expectations. We are continuously looking for ways to improve, and the feedback you provided regarding the unit will allow us to do so. Your comments have been documented, and will be passed along to Resort Management.

Summary: We love Dolphin's Cove.  The condo's are really nice with full kitchens and very nice layouts.  We always stay at Dolphin's Cove when we go to Disneyland.  It is only a four or five block walk to Disneyland's entrance.  Dolphin's Cove has a very nice pool and mini golf course.  Fun place to stay.

If you stay here, you can walk to the Toy Story parking lot and slip in the gate toward the street and get in for free.  It is only about 1 1/2 blocks from the timeshare.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  I used a luggage cart.  However, you need help to get the cart up front by the lobby to the pool area like we did.  They need a ramp of some sort there.  They also need more trash cans in the room like the master bedroom/  There was a little noise this time we stayed but overall a very comfortable trip!

We were very comfortable staying at this resort. We were expecting two bathrooms with a two bedroom unit but made it work with one.  The grounds are impeccably kept with a nine hole mini golf we used everyday.  The property is aged but well maintained.  We walked to a Disneyland the first day, it took us 22 minutes at a semi brisk pace. Next day, we walked to the toy story parking lot 10-12 minutes away and took their bus to Disneyland.  Great at the end of an exhausting day.

Dolphin is located in very good location by walking distance to Disneyland and other amenities nearby, such as Target, and many restaurants. WI-FI is slow and have option to pay for high speed. Front desk and other services are great and quick. Other amenities such as swimming pool, and business room are good. No kiosk for ART pass anymore.

This resort had very nice sized units and was close to everything. Disney, AMC, great restaurants. Large pool and jacuzzi was huge. Patio to enjoy a cup of coffee outside was nice.  It's also close to I 5, although I 5 can be a nightmare of traffic.

We loved this place. Beautiful grounds, nice pools and a very friendly staff. They were always welcoming and the place was nice and clean. The playroom for the kids has a lot to offer.  The distance from Disneyland is about a 15 minute walk (1 mile). Not bad if you are willing to walk, otherwise its a 5 minute walk to the Toy Story Lot.  Yes, its an older condo complex, but it is well kept and clean. No issues what so ever.

The resort was nice and quite. A little far from Disneyland. We did walk it a few times, but we took the transit most of the time. The bus stop was close. Units were very clean. Staff was helpful. Pool is small but nice.

We stayed at dolphins cove September 2019 for a Disneyland trip. Had a lovely 2 bedroom in the family friendly resort. This is the 3rd time here in 12 years and still a sensational place. Helpful staff and clean comfortable rooms in a great location.

We stayed there with our adult kids, we had 2 rooms.  It was very nice. We needed the laundry facilities as it rained and we had plenty of things to dry! Only bad thing was an oder  that I couldn’t identify.

Ceiling fans filthy. bath missing shower curtain. Fan in bath so filthy worked intermittently. Ac in lr leaked water all over floor. Grounds kept up. Hard to find at night for main sign not lit up....
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We're disappointed to hear that the resort did not meet your expectations. We appreciate your feedback regarding the cleanliness of the unit and the resort grounds, and will make sure to pass along your comments and concerns to Resort Management to look into further.

Summary: Old. Depressing. Roaches upon entry. Smells like cat pee. Hard beds. No washer dryer. Dark. It has no elevator. It’s just simply dingy. I would stay elsewhere. Many other options. Not worth the money at all!
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We take the cleanliness of our resort very seriously, and we're troubled to hear that this was your experience. We'd like to look into this further and make sure that your situation has been documented. Please contact us at DolphinsCoveResort@wyn.com and a Resort Leader will be able to address your concerns in more detail.

Summary Heading: Nice place .....kids loved game room. front desk VERY nice
Summary: Only difficult thing was using the gate to enter BUT felt very safe inside because of it and security was always present if needed. Rooms were nice and clean. LOVED the golf course.Parking close to rooms was easy. Kitchen very stocked even with dish detergent and coffee. A/C not working in one of the bedrooms but was issued a portable unit that worked fine.

This resort was mediocre. The master bedroom had a hard mattress and the mattress on the pull out bed was thin and needed to be replaced.  There was no shuttle specifically for the resort to go to Disneyland so it added quite a bit of walking even though it was deceptively close to the park. The pool and hot tub were ok the grounds looked good and the unit was clean.
Manager Response: We're disappointed to hear that the resort did not meet your expectations, Erika. We appreciate your feedback regarding the unit and resort amenities, and will make sure to pass it along to Resort Management to look into further.

Summary: Amazing place. Perfect for families with young children or children at heart. This resort has a code of customer service which starts at the front desk or even before you reach the front desk at times when depending on the day they greet you with   and cheese or a "kids check in which provide lemonade and snacks. The front desk is wonderful!. They have water with lemons and ice and friendly smiles. They have gratis snacks for the whole family 24 /7. One day I returned dehydrated and dizzy from a hot day at disney alone and could not get into our room. Mike from the engineers came to help me and even cleaned some blueberries I dropped on the floor then waited giving me water till I felt better. Several days later we had some electrical problems which he fixed immediately with a

Summary Heading: Not up to Wyndham Resorts Standards
Summary: I am a Wyndham owner, but I booked the room through RCI since it wasn't my use year and I needed to use the RCI points. That said, I have stayed at several Wyndham properties and the room I stayed in was not up to the standards I have seen at other resorts. In the two bedroom unit my room smelled strongly of mildew. If my niece hadn't already unpacked all her things I would have insisted on a different room. The air conditioner in the suite rattled so loudly that you couldn't hear someone enough in the other rooms to hold a conversation with the doors open. Lastly, the faucet in the tub leaked badly and drained poorly. My niece and I both have long hair and had to clean the drain out after every shower because it would clog up with the smallest amount of hair. This is a
Manager Response: We're troubled to hear that the unit did not meet your expectations.We take the cleanliness of our units very seriously, and we're disappointed to hear that it was not up to par. We appreciate your feedback and will make sure to pass it along to Resort Management to look into further.

Summary: This resort was awesome. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Lots of activities available. Clean rooms and grounds. Would definitely recommend and we’d definitely book again. Everyone went above our expectations to make us feel welcomed and we didn’t have a single complaint.

This place is not the most plush Wyndham Resort we have experienced however it is well thought out, well managed and is in a great position for Disney. I would congratulate the manager Jennifer on running a resort that caters for every need, from the pools, with disabled hoists, the club room, laundry, helpful staff and many other features.

The size of the unit is great, closet space, dining areas, patio and living room, two bathrooms and two bedrooms, however the smaller bedroom had two twin size beds and one very uncomfortable sofa bed in the living area.  I think it would be more comfortable for the bedroom to have maybe full size beds so that the sleeping arrangements would be more comfortable, the master bedroom had a king size bed and possibly room for switching around, there was no master bath, they were both located in the hallway.    Unit had a mildew smell the whole time we were there, we sprayed essential oils to eliminate but it did not help.  Towards the end of our stay we noticed black mold growing inside the toilet bowls, did not want to look into it further, probably that is where the smell was
Manager Response: We're troubled to hear that the unit had a less than desirable scent, and that the cleanliness did not meet your expectations. We appreciate your feedback regarding the unit and bedrooms, and will make sure to pass along your feedback to Resort Management to look into further.

Summary: The resort  itself is less than what we used to see from other Wyndham, but the friendly front desk staff and the cleanliness of the newly renovated unit left us speechless of what to complain about. The room is nice, clean and comfortable. It is very nice overall. Keep up the great work of delivering excellent customer service. Thank you, and we’ll be back.

This is our families favorite place to stay when going to Disneyland, or even when just passing through. Great for kids with remodeled pool area and game room, condo style rooms with kitchen, living area and bedrooms, and easy, gated covered parking. Close to everything and super quick to drive to Disneyland or Disney parking lot with free shuttle is a few minutes walk. It's not as high end as some other resorts in the area, but I feel the best value.

Summary Heading: Four stars thanks to pool area
Summary: So the pool area is really nicely laid out, two large hot tubs and a pool in between. Lovely! We were there before noon and had the place to ourselves almost all the time, since everyone else was at Disney probably. A bit more crowded in the afternoon.   The apartment was not more thanok. Comfortable bed and bathroom and kitchen was ok. The sofa bed for the kids was terrible, the linen as well. Fortunately we stayed for four nights so we still managed, but the apartment was not what we expected.   Walking distance to Disney and a lot of restaurants.

the accomodation was very comfortable. the people at the reception were very hospitable. the place was awesome and the jacuzzi very relaxing. i would surely love to go back. i was with my cousin and she loves the feeling of being in a friendly resort. the resort is just  a walking distance from disneyland. we  walk all the way to the area near Disneyland, however, there were a lot of people and it was already late in the afternoon, so we decided not to go. we walked back to the resort stopping at some souvenir shops and restaurant for dinner. everything is wonderful. would definitely go back.

We enjoyed our stay at Dolphin's Cove Resort. We stayed in a 2 bedroom 1 bath condo that had been beautifully renovated. Check in was friendly and a breeze no sales pitch. We were able to check into our room early go the Disneyland park right away.  We had food delivered and when it came to the office they brought it to us in the room. I receive an email from the resort with a map of the area and helpful apps to download. The next day when we checked out I had asked for a late checkout and they were able to give it to us free of charge.  There was still some time before we had to leave for the airport after we checked out and they told us we could hang out on the property use the rec room or swim in the pool until we had to go. I have stayed at the other Worldmark hotel up the

Stayed with my daughter and family in a one bedroom. Next time we will try to get a 2 bedroom. Staff was very accommodating when we arrived , just had knee replacement recently. They weren't so accommodating on the phone. Facilities were very clean, nice, small gym, warm pool with a jacuzzi, putting green. Within in walking distance of a free shuttle to Disneyland, aroung the corner and down the street. Very nice little convenience store across the street. Looking for fresh fruit. They cut up a very nice bowl of a variety of different very fresh fruit.

Summary Heading: Great Resort Hotel when visitng Disneyland
Summary: This was our first time to California and decided to try here with their proximity to Disneyland. We first pulled into the resort and they had check in parking spaced for up to four cars.  To get to the main office you need to go down a small walkway and around the corner. Can be a little tricky to find at first.  The office is fairly small but does the trick.  We were greeted with a big smile and a "Welcome to Dolphins Cove".  We went through our check in procedure and then we were given a gift of a bottle of apple cider.  They mentioned if we had any questions we could ask the actviities/sales team. We are seasoned Wyndham owners so we just took our parking pass and moved on to our room.  We were not going to get stuck with Sales.  The room we had (1BR Deluxe) was very roomy.

I stayed here during a conference at the Anaheim Hilton, which is easily walkable. My room was on an upper floor and was quiet and cosy. I had a full kitchen, living room, bedroom, and bathroom, which was pretty amazing for a few nights. The welcome was friendly and informative, with helpful info on restaurants and food delivery. There are nice amenities, too, including a pool and free laundry.

The staff was great, the unit was clean - they are older but they have kept them in pretty good shape.  We did end up in the building that faces the main street but we adjusted & really didn't bother us much!  We are spoiled as usually have had laundry IN the units and most 2 bedroom ones we have had in the past had 2 baths, this one only had one (but they may differ) but the laundry was free & available so it worked out fine.  Location was GREAT - the shuttle back & forth to Disney was easy!

We visit this area every winter and find it sufficient for our needs.  It is not a luxury place at all but meets what we expect.  We had no problem with insects and our unit was very clean.  We had a two bedroom unit ground floor- at times could hear sounds from upstairs but nothing too serious.  Did our own meals, - just one time we ate at Dennys which is very close by.      Hope to come again next winter.

Summary Heading: Good Resort Experience in Anaheim CA
Summary: This is a good resort with decent amenities, plus it is close to DisneyLand, if you are into that sort of thing.  the weather was awful during the week that we were here, so we didn't really use any outside amenities, or even any inside ones.  The resort layout is OK.  Except for the lack of elevators that makes it a royal pain to haul luggage, groceries, etc. up to the second floor rooms.  This is the second time we ended up with second floor rooms. Essentially half the resort (second floor rooms), is not handicap-accessible, if that is a concern.

Summary Heading: Glorified Roach Motel Posing As A Resort
Summary: The Dolphin Cove Resort is a converted low-end apartment complex masquerading as a Vacation Resort. The roach issue was so bad even after they sprayed that I checked out of the "place" 1 day early. They also had construction going on which meant guests had to come through their office to enter the lobby area. But the biggest issue besides the roaches was the lack of a security protocol. Imagine my horror when I woke the next day to find out that the patio door was unlocked. My 1 bedroom unit was on the first floor directly across from the parking lot. The Dolphin Cove Resort is a Wyndam property that looks and smells like a Motel 6.

Great resort close to DISNEYLAND and California Adventure park. Within walking distance 2 Hot tubs Good sized pool for the kids. Ping pong connect 4 and mini putt plus more activities for the kids. Beer and bingo for the adults! Cheese and wine greeting on check in day!

Summary Heading: Perfect Family Property Accommodated our Nightmare
Summary: We booked a 2bd 2ba via our WorldMark ownership with the intent of park hopping for 5 days, one of which, our 11 year old daughter would be performing with her dance troupe on the Fantasyland stage. The 4th day of our stay, our 9 month baby started violently throwing up/diarrhea. He had finished a round of antibiotics prior to traveling for an ear infection. We took him to Urgent Care where they diagnosed him with a DOUBLE ear infection, which meant more antibiotics, and possible gastroenteritis. (Unsure if related to ears or meds at this point). The next day, the last day of our stay, our entire condo unit (family of 4 including 9 month old infant, and my parents) was hit with norovirus. The first episode was around 3 p.m. and moved quick with us all violently ill by nightfall.

Summary Heading: Great location for Disney, Knots, Universal, Mid Evil Times
Summary: We had a great time and used all of the amenities. Close to all that we wanted to do. A choice of restaurants with-in walking distance. Staff was awesome and very helpful. We caught the shuttle to Disney and walked one day.

Get ready to Enjoy this beautiful resort. Rooms had so much space. I loved the Private patio. I didn’t get to enjoy the  Heated pool . I was great to have onsite laundry room was convenient. Secured resort with gate entrance.

We booked a one bedroom timeshare for 3 adults and a 6 year old. At first we were given an apartment over an industrial laundry and the room vibrates. I asked reception to move us and at first they were not helpful but eventually moved us to a better one overlooking the gardens. The bedroom was large and the lounge room had plenty of room for our rollaway. The bathroom had a large room with vanity and a long wardrobe and a smaller room with toilet and shower over bath. Our kitchen was fully equipped and had a full-size fridge  There was a large pool with barbecue and beautiful gardens. A games room had coin operated machine to keep the 6 year old happy At reception was a coffee machine, iced water muesli bars or cookies for guests. We bought groceries at Vons and had a couple of

Summary Heading: Seclusion and Escape from the Hustle and Bustle
Summary: Going to Disneyland? Need to escape? This is a so called "diamond in the rough" for Anaheim.  While not next to the front gate, the rooms are well furnished  and comfortable with full kitchens and plenty of parking. The grounds are well kept. The staff is pleasant and helpful. One of the best things about this resort is that because it is only 2 floors, its quiet and peaceful. I have never had issues with people being loud or disruptive. Instead of feeling like you are in the always busy city, it helps you to disconnect and really relax while not staying too far away from it all.  I have stayed at this resort 4 times and never had a bad experience. Twice was for runDisney events and twice for leisure. One of the only downsides is that there aren't as many bathrooms as most would

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay with kids
Summary: We stayed here in July.  It was quiet and easy to get to great attractions.  I loved the fact that it had fenced parking and that we had kitchen facilities.  The children loved the pool area.  It was not the nicest Wyndham place we have stayed, but it was clean and great for us.

Stayed with friends in a 2bedroom. Although the initial request for a 1st floor unit was Not followed, we had a very pleasant stay. We had all that we needed Since it was Close to Denny’s and a Convenience Store. Ample parking and nice common areas.

I just checked in to this hotel.  I had called several times to check on room availability and add requests.  All of which were ignored.  We have stayed here before and not been accommodated but made it work.  This time we were placed in a room with a gate that opens to the 5 lane road.  I have a 3, 4 and 5 year old.  When I asked to move due to my safety concerns they were not able to move us at all.  We were refused a refund for or deposit that was more than one nights stay.  We offered to downgrade our room and they were still unable to help. I feel like your guests safety should be a priority.   I have another booking in December at this hotel that I will now have to cancel. Guests continued to trickle in getting checked in to rooms other than the one we were assigned

Had a wonderful week here. The staff was very friendly, room was extremely clean. There was a ton of amenities including a welcome wine and cheese party. two huge jacuzzis, heated pool rec room (had to pay for games :( ) But overall a beautiful and convenient place to stay if you are doing Disneyland. On the nights we stayed in we relaxed in the jacuzzi and were able to see Disneyland Fireworks, it was amazing! We will be back.

Summary Heading: This is the worst Wyndham property I've been to.
Summary: 1.Musty room. Room felt damp and stinky.  2.Small kitchen.  Only one person can be in kitchen at a time,  nowhere to store dry Food goods. 3.balcony overlooks a crummy parking lot.  4.No laundry in room.  Most wyndham properties have this.  5.Old.  This is an old building that hasn't aged well.   Pros 1.Close to Disneyland, that's what we came for and thankfully didn't spend much time on the room.  2.Nice pool area. Big heated pool and two nice hot tubs. 3.Kids enjoyed the new mini golf feature.  4.Staff was friendly and tried to help.

Dolphins Cove is a Timeshare resort in Anaheim. It is about 20 to 30 minutes walk to Disneyland. Very convenient. Public transportation is only about 250 metres away. Facilities are good. However, the most outstanding feature is definitely the staff. They made our stay truly wonderful.

We based ourselves here to visit Disneyland with the kids. It’s a perfect spot you can bus or walk. The accommodation is good with all you need. Swimming pool to cool down it can get quite hot. We were so busy we didn’t even get time to play mini golf.

We are timeshare owners here. It’s not the newest or best, but most rooms already remodeled and the resort has everything you will need. A lot of restaurants across the street or within a few walking blocks. If you have a car very close to everything. Has a kitchen so you can eat in.

Ok ...so I read the reviews and the complaints which, having stayed here for 2 weeks in a 3 bed apartment, I think are rather unfair. Yep..the apartments are a little dated and the lack of a washing machine is a bit tedious buts seriously folks get organised and learn to clean you own apartment! We have had a lovely time here, staff polite and helpful and nothing is too much trouble. I’m impressed with the amount of cleaning around the resort, bbq, windows, bannisters. Pool is lovely and supplied with pool toys for all ages. Trash emptied regularly. Cheese and wine social on Saturday most pleasant and table tennis, golf and games are a nice family experience. Air con again a little dated but ...ce la vie ...it works, just noisy. Good location for Disney, malls and breakfast at

Summary Heading: We go there almost every year!
Summary: We have been going to Dolphin's cove almost every year since our now college age children were preschoolers. The lush landscape is really full of surprises so take a walk around the entire resort. One awesome thing updated this year, at the resort is mini splits in the bedrooms and living rooms. Very cool and comfortable for our July 4th vacation. Our girls loved activities around the pool when they were little and we parents love the full kitchen (dishwasher and all) We can go to Costco and cook/grill most of our meals for huge savings.  We have never ever seen a roach there in all our visits. Sorry for the person who did, but I can say we never. We go for a conference but also visit all the sites including Disney and the Beach. It is VERY close to Disney just look on a map.

Summary Heading: Great Location For Disney And A Nice Place To Stay
Summary: We had four units for a week long family reunion.  Just a great place to stay!  The staff here is one of the friendliest we've ever encountered.  Got a smile and a friendly greeting from every worker encountered over seven days.  The grandchildren really enjoyed the pool and the games located poolside.  The grounds are well kept.  We took family photos in front of some very nice landscaping there.  All four units were clean, never saw any bugs, and everything worked except for a dishwasher in one unit which was fixed promptly.  We stayed here because it's close to Disneyland.  The park is a little over a mile from the hotel.  Our youngest son and his family walked to the park from the hotel several times.  There are supermarkets within a few miles.  Gas station across the

Got the room through RCI was happy to use points. The room seems clean on the surface, but has a musty smell when you first entered. I believe it’s the dampness from the rooms being kept at 72 degrees with 3 a/c units. The only part of the room where the cleanliness was iffy was the bathroom I feel the floor needed a deep clean and so did the tub enclosure lots of soap scum.

After reading all the negative reviews about this place, I was ready to take a loss and leave if it was as bad as they said.  The resort was wonderful and well maintained.  Our room was clean and not a cockroach in site. Lol!  The staff are super friendly and helpful.  Like any hotel you stay at, you should always walk around with flip flops or slippers because it would be absolutely impossible for any place to wash carpets between guests, so naturally the carpets do not look dirty but more than likely are because everyone who stays at a hotel walks on them with their shoes on.  The beds were comfy and everything worked.  I was also worried about the air conditioning it all bedrooms had a unit that you could control as well as the living area. All rooms also had ceiling fans.

We planned and paid for a nice family vacation to California. Upon returning to our room from a baseball game the night we checked in we found cockroaches and decided to leave promptly. It was after hours and no one could help us so we drove around until we could check into a hotel. Wyndham resort employees a well as Donna with Kahuna Time Shares were not helpful at all. They didn’t believe that we found cockroaches even though we left one we killed on the counter and sent a picture. This was our worst vacation ever. Additionally, Dolphins Cove is not in a great neighborhood, the units are dated and smelly. Please do not rent from this horrible Wyndham Resort.

We booked a week long stay at Dolphin's Cove Resort. The pictures online looked amazing (two queen beds in a room, 5 minute walk to Disneyland, beach access). However, we were mislead. There was only a double bed in our room and they only agreed to upgrade us for a large cost. It was a 15 minute bus ride to Disneyland and the beach was a 45 minute drive away. When we asked about this misleading information they told us a third party company handles their advertising. We explained that they are accountable for it however! All week things broke down, towel racks broke off the wall, shower handle kept coming off, phone stopped working, DVD remotes didn't work, wifi was spotty at best, cockroaches under the bed. By the third day no one had come to clean our "suite." When we asked

Pros:  friendly staff,  large room, great room amenities, full kitchen, like a small apartment, lots of parking, lots of storage  Cons:  kind of run down, could use updating, on a busy street with lots of road noise

Dolphin Cove, I see has some bad reviews. I am a experienced traveler. I am a Wyndham owner. This is my second visit here. I really enjoy the setting with all the flowers. Parking is on the back side. But I like that to. As we don’t have to look at cars. It is also covered parking. Everyone at the from desk was very polite and helpful. I’m going back again in August. We are Disney pass holders.  Every time I have been it’s always been clean. And very comfortable.

Just returned from our annual family vacation.  It's never easy finding a place to call home for a week when you aren't familiar with the area, but we all agreed Dolphin Cove worked out great!  We were in a 3 bedroom unit, the unit was comfy and clean.  We would have preferred central air, but the California nights were cool and the wall units were ok.  The staff were all friendly and helpful.  The pool was a delight!  It was nice to see the constant attention to cleaning and maintaining the grounds.  Family vacation 2018 was a success!

The resort was conveniently located near Disneyland. The grounds were beautiful and outside maintenance was excellent.  The cleanliness of the unit was poor, our feet were black on the bottom from walking on the floor and the tub became black and scummy and would not clean up.  Linens were poor quality.  Requests for linens and towels were prompt.  Staff were courteous and friendly.

This is an old apartment complex that was renovated for timeshares and rental condos.  I was in a 3 bedroom unit which are all on the second floor. This unit can handle up to 8 people. The walls and floors do transmit some noise, but tolerable. The master bedroom is huge with a nice master bathroom but the other bedrooms are quite small. The second bedroom has a queen size bed, but no dresser. Luckily the closet is decent size.  The third bedroom has two twin beds squeezed in and has adequate closet space and a dresser.  The units have either a patio or balcony. The pool area has been recently renovated and the complex has a laundry facility free to all guests.  For the rest of July they are removing concrete walkways and putting in new pavers. So the noise during the week is

Loved our two bedroom unit. It only had one full size bathroom though. The unit was spacious with everything you need for a weekend getaway. The pool was fun and geared towards the kids. The staff went around and gave each child a dolphin. It was cute. I love that there are treats and drinks in the lobby to welcome the guests. Awesome family weekend!

2nd time to Anaheim and 1st time to stay at Dolphin's Cove, base on reviews I read, I was skeptical before I arrived, and I was wrong.  Check in was a breeze, front desk was very helpful, I requested a room close to the laundry faculty and Andrew was able to get me one in the same building, and we got a bottle of wine as welcome gift.  Ground is well kept, pool is clean, there also a grill you can cook out next to the pool.  Dolphin's Cove is a timeshare by Wyndham, since we are Wyndham owners elsewhere, we were offered 30k Wyndham reward points to attend a owner update at the new World Mark location, which was pleasant and easy, no sales pressure at all.

The last time I stayed here was the great ant invasion of I believe 1998. This place was a wreck. Happy to say things are a little better around here. Although,  while taking a bath I discovered house keepings misses. Several places in the tub but mostly where my head was resting!! Clean it up folks. This mold can be seen from inside the tub!!

Everything about this place was great. Rooms clean and large. The balcony was nice at night. We didn't go to the pool much as we spent our days traveling by the coast. but this resort was close to a lot nearby and a short drive to other areas like huntington, Newport, and downtown la. place felt very safe and ambiant

I stayed here for a few days during a business trip and I really wish I was able to spend more time here during the day. I got a king sized bed room, it was very spacious, the kitchen was a full kitchen and supplied. full sized fridge. it was a separate bedroom with tv in the living room and bedroom, nice patio. The room was heavily supplied with towels (not complaining about that at all). The area was clean, bed comfortable. But the only downfall is the AC unit is only in the back corner of the living room and the bedroom did not cool off at all. an AC in the bedroom would be very nice.

Summary Heading: April 2018- Early May Stay.  4th Stay overall
Summary: There are things I really like about Dolphins Cove and there are things that just don't seem to improve or instead get worse.   This is our 4th stay at Dolphins Cove. I believe you can see my previous reviews through my profile?  The Good:  The grounds are really nice The new pool area is great The resort is gated so it feels safe Their is a lot of space in the rooms and the kitchen is furnished with everything you need You don't pay to park The onsite laundry is free They have started getting split systems in the rooms so you don't have a loud window style air conditioner anymore.   The Bad:  The bathroom was pretty gross. (See pictures) How does this not even get cleaned?  The carpets are super dirty. Within 5 minutes of walking bare foot or in socks on the carpets our feet

Disney and more.location and staff great. The building is not. Great kitchen and beds. Insulation and sound proofing is not. Every room had mitisubisi climate control systems, which is great!!!!!!! But you could hear everyone talking and walking by and downstairs. Laundry was nice 7 machines no cost

I really like this resort. Quiet garden like atmosphere and new pool facilities. I feel more like a house guest than a resort. If you need handicapped access, let them know and they will help. Close to attractions but just out of the way. Enjoy.

Summary Heading: Stayed as a couple and were mostly pleased
Summary: First, we are Worldmark owners but had never stayed here. My husband and I stayed here recently while we were visiting Disneyland. It’s .8 miles from the park and we did walk it most of the time but there is other transportation nearby. When are we were dropped off we couldn’t find the lobby and it should be little bit better marked. We arrived on a Saturday and no one told us that there was a wine and cheese event going on but we eventually figured out that we were able to go to that which was nice. The entire time we were there we were continually asked over and over to go to an owner update and we had just done it the week before but they had a hard time accepting a no. Restaurants were in walking distance and it did meet our needs for the most part. Room was updated and bed

Close to Disney Land & Angels Park.  Lots of restaurants close to resort.  Safe to walk and stroll day or night.  Easy to access shuttle buses or city transportation.  The staff was eager and enthusiastic to be of assistance.

While the resort is older, it's still a nice place to be if visiting Disneyland.  Still close enough without all the congestion.  Denny's within walking distance.  Central gas grills by the pool where you have to ask for utensils.  Reasonable rates for Aneheim.

We (all 7 of us) stayed in a 3 bedroom unit. Our unit was very clean and updated. It was a great place to stay for our Disney Trip. We parked at the Disney lot a block away ($20. Fee) It was easier to use than the Disney lot closer to the park.  Some days we saved the $20. Fee and walked to the lot and caught the shuttle to the park.  The pools and spas were under construction but we had no problems with it. The area under construction is fenced off. The resort staff was friendly and helpful. A couple minor repair issues were handled right away.  Would definitely stay here again.

LOVED this place. BEST beds, great staff & only a short bus ride to Disneyland. Nice to have a place to cook if you wanted & a fridge for snacks & cold drinks. Parking was close & the hotel was gated so it made you feel very safe, too.  I would definitely stay here again & I would recommend it to friends and family.

Summary Heading: Nothing special, but I’d stay here again
Summary: Had a long weekend with my friend visiting Disneyland. We stayed on her points so I can’t comment on the cost/value. She did comment that the overall look was less than she has experienced at most Wyndham properties. I have only been to two others and this was the least impressive, borderline run down, but undergoing AC installation and the inner courtyards and such were nice. The outer parking looked rough.  Our unit was 501 (presidential one bedroom) and seems to have been updated inside, but only had a window unit in the living room so her bedroom got hot. She said the bed was fine. I slept on the pull out couch and it was as you would expect, very firm and not great, but it was free and I was exhausted so I slept great.  Shower was hard to keep a good temp. There was a dying

Summary Heading: A Little Tired But Clean and Tidy
Summary: We were a bit unlucky during our stay as construction upgrades on the pools were taking place. This meant a bit more noise and mess than would normally be present. Our 2 bedroom suite was also on the road front which was quite busy and noisy.  Staff were nice, welcoming, knowledgeable and friendly.  Location was good. Walking distance to Disney or quick Uber ride.

I hate to leave negative reviews, but I feel those that haven’t been here should be warned. I’ll start with a bit of the back story. My husband and I tacked on a quick trip to Disneyland for our middle daughter’s birthday at the last minute. We were staying at the Indio Worldmark (fabulous property) and hopped over to Anaheim for a few nights. We were thrilled to find out that worldmark Anaheim opened up and had last minute availability. There was a miscommunication between my husband and I and we were short a night at the worldmark Anaheim. We panicked, but luckily Dolphin’s Cove had an opening for a two bedroom unit.  In a way, I am so glad that this little mishap happened because A. I am only here for one night and B. I now know what I’d be getting myself into. About a year

Summary Heading: Not as bad as the others say
Summary: Well you get for what you pay for, we are staying with my parents and two daughters, and its just fine, its a bit of a walk to the parks but can be done, bfast restaurant just outside the resort, parking was fine but if youre fuzzy then stay away

This is an older property and OVERDUE for maintenance and updating.  Units need to be “cleaned” before letting guest check-in.  The shower had mold, rust, and a large footprint (see pictures).  The toilet sits higher off the ground and the sink is LOW.  The lighting in the eating area and bedroom should be brighter.  There is no central air or heating.  Only a wall air conditioner/heater unit in the living room.  There were 2 portable fans and 1 portable heater for our 2 bedroom.  The second bedroom had twin beds one bed had a BROWN stain on the bedsheet (see picture).  Positive: Close driving distance to Disneyland.  Next to Denny’s restaurant.   We were happy to check-out!

Cons: Dated, pool was under construction, hotel clearly hasn't been updated in a while!  Pros: Close to everything, (walked to Anaheim convention centre in less than 10 mins) rooms are HUGE, very good value for money compared to other hotels close to Disney. Clean. Friendly staff.

Summary Heading: Roach motel, unacceptable and unclean place to stay
Summary: This resort is filthy.  We stayed the week before Christmas.  Upon arrival in the room, the fridge was full of to go food, hamburgers, soda etc.  Upon further inspection, we found crumbs on living room floor, under table, table was sticky.  Baseboards looked like they had never been vacuumed or cleaned.  Since we were there ten days and staying at a relative the following night, we asked them to thoroughly clean the unit while we were gone.  When we returned, we noticed food on the floor between the fridge and wall, easily in plain sight.  I looked at the bottom of dishwasher, and there was an old candy cane and a child's flip flop, in plain view.  Baseboards were still dirty and still some sesame seeds under table.  That night my wife found a roach on our bedroom wall.  This is

We staid here 12/22-12/30 2017 for Christmas vacation through RCI. The resort was nice and located close to the highways and Disney. You can walk to the Toy Story parking lot to ride the bus to Disneyland. We had a 2 Bedroom/1 bath room with a central AC unit in the living room. It was cool while we were there so the room didn’t get to hot. There was a king bed in one room, twin beds in the other room, and a fold out couch in the living room. Stand up fans were provided for comfort. The beds were to hard for my liking but that’s just personal preference. A full kitchen with all needed cookware etc was provided. There was not a washer and dryer in the unit but full size machines were available to use for free. The pool was under construction so that was not able to be used. The

Family trip in the US of A and we had this as our last stop and staging point for all thing southern California. Quiet location and close to Disneyland, walking distance and very safe. Supermarket not far and a servo across the road. Freeway access is easy. Kids had a ball in the pool and we relaxed with a few drinks.

Summary Heading: Second Visit - Had to drop my rating
Summary: This is my second visit to Dolphin's Cove.  We stayed in the Spring of 2016 and had a wonderful experience.  This time, not so much.  As a Worldmark Owner, I had to book the 3-bedrooom unit 12 months in advance.  I was charged full credits for the unit and believed we would have full access to the property.  Fast forward 12 months and now we are told that the pool is being renovated and will not be able to swim.  Now, I understand renovations must take place.  However, I should have been informed at the time of booking, so I could have made other plans.  Despite this, I figured they must have an alternative location that we could use, perhaps the Worldmark Anaheim that is less than a mile away. Upon inquiring, I was told that no - there would be no place to swim.  Huge

I have to admit, reading the reviews before we arrived had me a bit scared... didn’t sound too promising. However, I was pleasantly surprised. Front staff were helpful and friendly. The resort grounds are beautiful, with a very well maintained mini golf course that winds around the rooms. Our room was very spacious and well furnished with modern details. The golf course and two (indoor AND outdoor) play areas kept my boys very busy on our “day off”. Yes, the pool was shut down for construction, which was a bummer, but from looking at the layout of the new pool, I definitely want to come back to check it out. Looks awesome. Only criticism was the noise level of the AC. Maybe we had an old unit or perhaps user error on our part, but it was very, very loud (which at the end of a

Been a Worldmark owner for 17 years and stayed in many of the now Wyndham resorts including 7 Mile Beach in Hobart Tasmania, Denerau in Nadi Fiji, Golden Beach in Qld,  Wanaka, Kirra Beach, Melbourne and the list goes on. Read the reviews and was quite suprised at the many negitive comments   All I can say is somebody has got their act together as except for a few minor issues like water going off at around 3pm and door lock about to fall off I couldn't really find faults.  The property is old and in fact I believe I stayed here 30 years ago but many additions make it hard to recognise.  The rooms are large and spacious, the kitchen large and the lounge comfortable with a small balcony outside looking over the garden. Was on second floor 800 block and being 70 did find it a

SLEEP WITH LIGHTS ON!!!!!!! Plug your drains, use a towel to cover door, and do not trust the staff. We found and killed several roaches during our stay. Some in our room, one right out of the bathroom drain, and many all over the grounds as we walked through in the evening. Staff lied and told us twice they would come spray and at checkout as we continued to complain because we were certain no one did and spent whole vacation sleeping with the lights on they finally told the truth never having actually sprayed. It is a real shame they have the Wyndham name attatched to them. We would of gone to a different hotel if everything in area wasn't booked for Blizzcon. The front desk didn't even apologize. I just hope as TSA scans our luggage they are nice enough to tell us if a roach

We have stayed here at this time share before. It is usually really great. We will never stay here again. The first night my 11 month old baby was bitten by a spider and had a very large wound on her arm. Then the next night we fought a cockroach approximately 1.5 inches in length on the floor just before our baby was about to grab it and inevitably place it in her mouth .... thank goodness we were paying attention. I reported this to management but now what do we do with our luggage? I don’t want roaches in my house. I guess we will have to pay to have our clothing laundered before we head home. Like I said we will never stay here again. My older kids are trying to talk me into sprinting the money for a different place to stay tonight.

Extremely convenient to Disneyland.  Two story buildings - no elevators so may be a bit difficult for seniors to tote luggage and groceries up and down the stairs. Stayed in a roomy three bedrooms unit with full kitchen - NICE!!!

We called the resort to let them know we would be arriving very late for check-in.  Upon arrival, the front desk had someone waiting for us and that was very appreciated.  We stayed in a 2-bedroom unit on the 1st floor close to the clubhouse.  It was nice having 2 bathrooms in the room so everyone could get ready in the morning.  The room seemed like it had been refurbished because there were air conditioning units in each bedroom and the living room area.  I was pleasantly surprised that these A/C units were extremely quiet and they kept the room comfortable.  There is a free continental breakfast on Mondays & Fridays, but don't lose any sleep over it.  It was very basic with no hot food items.  Complimentary coffee was good in the front lobby though.  For a better meal, walk

Stayed in the 100 building which apparently is the older building. AC was in living room and only ceiling fans in the 2 bedrooms which made for incredibly uncomfortable nights. No fan in the bathroom only a small window above the shower. The beds were as hard as cement and the pull out in living room was worse, the mattress was super thin and the frame was bent sloping at a downward angle. The carpet was disgusting and needed shampooing. 5 minutes after you showered your feet would be black ( no exaggeration ).  Upon checkout we mentioned this to the clerk and they clearly did not care.   All of this aside, the location was phenomenal.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. Disneyland is within walking distance making it a perfect location for tourists. The pool and hot tub area are nice and they have a little mini golf course. The beds were very  comfortable and  the rooms were immaculately cleaned. We saw the individual box AC units as a plus allowing each room to set their own temperature preference. On the negative side, the grounds seem to be better maintained than the buildings. The bottom metal door trim fell off when we first  opened the door to our unit. The closet doors were metal and broken on their tracks. The water pressure in the shower and the sinks was basically non existent. The buildings themselves do not have elevators- which when you have luggage for a few days or small children, hauling

We had so many issues while staying here.  1st, we checked in and they charged us again (we had already paid online), so we were out $600 for about a week, until they got their stuff straight.  2nd, we asked for a roll-away which we were charged for.  Any other time being charged would be fine, but I think double paying $600 calls for some kind of break, 3rd we had a ROACH, I repeat a HUGE ROACH run across our kitchen.  They didn't believe us and tried to tell us it wasn't a cockroach.  Finally after arguing, they agreed to move our room.  And guess where they moved us?  NEXT DOOR, now I am not an expert in roaches, but I do know they live in walls, and if they are in one room, they will be in the one right next.
