Summary: We stayed here for a week and we were really impressed with this "resort"! Its close to many great spots to eat and really close to Disney Land (if you dont mind riding a bus for a few minutes)! We also went to Universal Studios, which is only a few miles away. Keep in mind that LA miles are alot farther than other miles! Took us an hour and 15 minutes to go 30 something miles! Less than 20 minutes to Knotts.   We had a 2 bedroom 2 bath room. The rooms were very spacious and very clean! The grounds are well maintained and the pool and hot tub were perfect! I would give it 5 points if A): I had one of the rooms with the Central Air and B): the hot tub stayed open a few hours after the parks closed for adults only or quite people. It sure would have been nice to soak the old bones

We stayed here 2 weeks in a one bedroom apartment which was roomy, clean and very comfortable. The resort is secure with plenty of parking for guests. Kitchen was well equipped, bedroom was huge and had a very comfortable super king bed - loved it!  We were lucky to have new AC in the lounge and bedroom.   We received complimentary cleaning twice during our stay which was very much appreciated and the staff were happy to replace our beach/pool towels after each use.   Front desk staff and housekeeping were very accommodating.  We were given a small basket with treats on arrival which was topped up mid way through our stay.  It had amazing Arbor Day coffee (can we buy this anywhere?), popcorn, powdered lemonade and cute mini salt and pepper shakers. Wendy from guest services was

I stay with wyndham a lot. This was an added day and worldmark anaheim was full. This room was roomy and updated to a point. You have a window a/c and a fan for other room . When I woke up in the morning I was congested and sore throat. Mind this was my 6th day in Anaheim.  Had no issues until now. My room was above their chemical and laundry room. My wife checked out immediately and all they could say is it's going around. Bad customer care .

My Dad, younger brother and I stayed here when we were visiting Disneyland. For this reason the location is excellent, with Disneyland only a 25 min walk away. The 2 bedroom apartment was suitable for our needs over the 3 nights.   But why, why, not upgrade from the box aircons?! It's positioned in the loungeroom, about 3 feet to the left of the TV. This meant that the TV had to be at max volume for you to be able to hear anything over the ridiculous noise coming from the aircon. When I went to bed early, and my Dad stayed up, sleeping was practically impossible. As my Dad, who had the main bedroom, didn't have a TV in his room he had to watch it on max volume in the loungeroom. My family are in the tourism industry and know that it is not too expensive to upgrade to split

We stayed for a week using our timeshare. The accommodations are comfortable and the location is desirable if you are visiting Disney. The landscaping, grounds and pool are very nicely kept. However, service is non existent! If you stay a week all they do is change towels once in the middle of the week. No replenishment of toiletries or any kind cleaning takes place. We would be reluctant to stay here again.

Summary Heading: ROOMS WERE OLD AND FILTHY NO AC IN SOME ROOMS AND THE STAFF WAS VERY UNACCOMMADATING
Summary: I am an owner and i will never stay at this resort or recommend to anyone. It was not clean and no ac in the rooms. very old and outdated an the manager was so rude. this is one of the worst wyndham worldmark property ever. How can you have rooms in hot california with no ac in the rooms . There was also no hot water to take a shower and power went out  while there.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing Wyndham for your Anaheim location.  I am sorry to hear that the unit at Dolphins Cove did not meet your expectations.  We attempt to alert owners to the limited AC.  While I am not familiar with the hot water and cleanliness conditions, I welcome you to either reach out to Owner Care so we can research your concerns or contact WVOSocialResponse@wyn.com with more information.  Best regards, Heather W.

Summary: The service was great, greeted and given so much info. on what to do and where things were. Bus trip to Disneyland was just around the corner, got tickets for bus on site, very handy. The grounds are well looked after, fun playing mini golf on site. the pool was nice and the room was very clean.
Manager Response: Hello, Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay!  We're glad that our staff was so helpful and helped make your vacation even better.  We hope you're able to come back for another stay very soon!  Warm regards,

Summary Heading: Near Disneyland and SO Much More
Summary: We took our grandsons on a Family Vacation.  Had two rooms.   All two bedrooms units are on lower level.  All one bedroom units on upper level.   We arrived early and the property gave us a key to the pool area as the rooms were not available ( We didn't expect them to be ready)   The boys had a great time in the pool.   The place does do events nearly every day.  Wine & Cheese plus lemonade and popcorn or one night they had In & Out Burger bring their mobile truck.  They sold out the expected number.  The property subsidized the pricing, what a deal.   The rooms were very comfortable.  The only negative was that they had one air conditioner unit in the living room with tower fans in the bedrooms.  We had a car so we drove to Disney Parking.  The property is a stop on a paid

stayed here for 4 nights as part of a larger California trip , from the outside it doesn't look like a typical wyndham  resort but once inside it was very nice, the pool is a OK size but can get very busy with all the kids around , also a lot of people leaving towels on the sunbeds which was inconsiderate to others  who wanted to use them , rooms themselves were fine and spacious, Being very close to Disneyland is obviously a big plus and I presume the main reason most people stay there  , also Plenty of  restaurants  were  with walking distance

We've stayed here twice because it is so close to Disneyland and only 10 minutes from Knotts Berry Farm.  We had ample room and my two sons were completely comfortable on the twin beds. The room had very comfortable furniture, beds, full kitchen, dinning table, and a patio right by the pool.  A very nice pool and it was very quiet too.  Our room was on inside towards the pools so it was very quiet.  It is gated too and the laundry room had plenty machines, dryers and was very clean too!  Lots of parking too!

From check in to check out, the experience  was great. Gilbert was super during the check in and provided us with all the relevant info within 5 mins. Stayed in the 2 bedroom unit and it had everything we needed for a comfortable stay. The nice lady at the timeshare desk was not pushy at all but helpful in providing advice. Facilities were great with the laundry being free to use with working machines. Only wish the gym had all the equipment working and the machines oiled regularly but still gave 5 stars because usually people don't go on holiday to use the gym😆.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with family
Summary: What can I say.  This place is one of the best places we have stayed. We stayed here for 17 days and we weren't disappointed.  Staff are exemplary and attentive. Everyone from the reception desk to maintenance was very welcoming to us.  As a family of 2 adults and 2 kids, we found the service was the best I ever experienced.  On the day of our departure, we had a fair number of bags that we needed to take to the bus stop for the coach transfer to LAX.  One of the managers went out of his way to ensure that our bags were all carried to the bus stop and assist us by wheeling the luggage trolley for us.  This is just one of the little touches that I felt that this was the best place for us to be in and as Wyndham owners, it was a breath of fresh air.  The place is comfortable and

We have a ground floor unit.  The resort is quiet given that it is in the middle of Anaheim. The room was clean and odor free when we arrived.  The front desk people were very helpful and provided all the help we asked for.  Depending on how you reserve your room the wifi MAY be free, it was for us.

Before getting to far into the review, it wasn't aweful by any stretch, just not what we would usually expect from Worldmark. We checked in a little early (big plus), just wanted to drop our bags because we were heading out until evening. Bathroom was dirty, not a big deal since we weren't sticking around. Let them know so it could be dealt with while we were out. Got back that night and it was still dirty even though they said they had re-cleaned it. Had to have them come in to show them the mess on the floor (which I thought was pretty obvious).  Unit was a bit run down as well (inside and out).  cheap carpet joints, no trim on the dish washer, outside had noticeable termite damage.   Besides those things there were a few other things that I weren't great, but were mentioned
Manager Response: Thank you for this great feedback, Charles. This will allow us to continue to enhance the vacation experience at our resort and know where to improve. Please let us know if there are opportunities to make your stay better in the future.

Summary Heading: Nicely updated condo, family friendly activities and close to Disneyland
Summary: The staff was friendly and we stayed 5 nights in a 2 bedroom unit. It appeared recently remodeled and each room had its own thermostat for overall comfort for everyone. They had kids activities and the lady running that was very kind and kept the kids busy. She made goodie bags for all kids, even if they didn't participate. The pool was clean and warm but wish they would keep it open until 11:00pm not 10:00pm Several adults were enjoying some quiet time after a full day of Disney and right at 10:00pm the staff made us get out. Short walk about 15 minutes to Toy Story shuttle but we choose to Uber because of convenience and was about 5-8 dollars per trip money well spent.

Summary Heading: October Disneyland Vacation. Great property overall. With small negative
Summary: We have stayed at Dolphins cove multiple times.  I think this was our 5th visit.  We got a room on the south side of the swimming pool.  We could sit out on the balcony and overlook the pool which was nice.  It was also a great view for the Disney fireworks.   We enjoy the gated community feel and it gives you a safe feeling which is nice.   The grounds are very nice and the kids really enjoyed the swimming pool and the on site miniature golf course which is included in the price of the stay.   The rooms are well appointed which makes it easy to cook your own meals on site.  There are BBQs on site which you can use as well.     You can catch the ART bus just around the corner from the hotel which will take you to Disneyland.    HINT: If you jump on the ART bus at any point, one

From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, it was a wonderful vacation for us.  The check in process was easy and quick, we were able to check in early which was great, the staff was pleasant and helpful and the room spacious and comfortable.  Could use some updates but it was clean, comfortable, had all the amenities we needed and a wonderful view of the courtyard.  The grounds were always clean and offered plenty of parking at anytime day or night.  The staff around the resort were always friendly and always said hello, good morning or good evening as you walked by, which I liked very much.  The amenities were great from the nice sized swimming pool, to the ping pong table, to the gym, barbeques and even a mini golf course.  The only negative I would say is that it is a
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing Wyndham's Dolphins Cove!  We are delighted for your enjoyment of the unit, amenities, and staff.  The best part about the distance from Disney is that it doesn't charge occupancy tax, so that is nice savings to spend on fun.  Thank you for sharing your experience.  Best regards,

Summary: This is our first time in a condo, and it was a great experience overall.  We were concerned it may not be close enough to Disneyland but that was not a problem. The city shuttle is just around the corner and it passes about every 10 minutes and takes about 10 minutes to get to Disneyland. The way back is about the same. The room is nice with your basic, good quality and supplies provided.  Amenities are great with a miniature golf course within the condo, gym room, laundry room, pool, and game room (although you have to pay with quarters in order to play anything.) The only drawback is that these are only open from 8am - 7pm, so if you're looking to do things late or early, you're out of luck. They also have a kiosk at the condo to buy tickets for city shuttle, which such a
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  We are happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed your visit and found the location convenient to the city shuttle.  Your feedback is very valuable in helping us to identify our areas of opportunity.  Please let our staff know if we may be of assistance during your next visit in making it more enjoyable.

Summary: Great little gem of a spot for a kid friendly place close to Disney.  Not fancy by any means...but has all the amenities.  Clean and great for families.   Heated pool was a bonus for a colder stay.  We used Uber to get to park in less than 5 minutes for around $5-6 each way.  Much quicker and more affordable than the shuttle.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  We are happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay.  Please let our staff know during your next visit if we may be of assistance in making your visit more enjoyable.

Summary: Stayed for 1 week for a visit to Disneyland and California theme parks.   Distance from park was reasonable.  Walked 1.5 big blocks to Disney Toy Story parking lot (approx 10 mins, we did it with our 4 yr old in a stroller).  Depending on the number of people waiting for the shuttle, could get on a shuttle right away or wait for 20 mins.  Disney staff did a reasonable job of letting you know if they thought it would be faster for you to just walk to the park instead of waiting for the next shuttle.  Suites were previous condo units that have now been converted to timeshare units.  We had 2 x 3 bedroom units. Plenty of room for our party of 6 adults and 4 children.   Our units were on the second floor, but Not a difficult set of steps (even for children or seniors in our party).
Manager Response: We are sorry about the inconvenience from the air conditioner noise. We know it is important to feel completely relaxed when on vacation. Please feel free to reach out to anyone in management during your stay if this occurs in the future so that we can look at options while you are still onsite. We are glad you enjoyed your stay, thank you for choosing Dolphin's Cove!

Summary: Let me start by stating that we didn't actually stay here, we were just guests of someone who did...   We had friends who were staying here and since our hotel room wouldn't accommodate all of us for dinner we came over here two nights to have dinner. Our friends had arraigned to have a key and parking pass left for us at the front desk which wasn't a problem, nice. The only problem with this was the sales person trying to hard sell us when we picked up that key ( this property is a time share ), but this was the only negative to our visit.  The room was a good size, seemed clean and well stocked. Manager Response: I am glad you enjoyed your visit to Dolphin's Cove and that the maintenance staff provided Count On Me service.  Thank you for your feedback!

Summary: First of all they look like apartments so it looks a little different which is nice and the people at the frot desk are very friendly and helpful and u also get a complimentary gift when u check in rooms are extremely nice it has a full kitchen with all supplies and what i liked most it has 2.bathrooms the only thing i didnt like was the continental breakfast it really sucked other than that its a.good place to stay at

Stayed here with our two girls in a 1 bedroom apartment. It was clean and spacious. The unit had a balcony facing the pool, on some days it we had a lot of pool noise. The kitchen was conveniently stock with all the essentials. There is no laundry in the units, there is a common laundry room which was a fair walk away from our room. The staff were very friendly especially the front desk. Disney is only a five minute bus ride. Enjoyed the our stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are so happy to hear that you have enjoyed your stay. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Looks Like A Converted Apartment Complex
Summary: As long term Worldmark Owners, we have previously stayed at the Worldmark Anaheim, so thought we would give Dolphin's Cove a try.  On arrival, use the entrance closest to Harbour Blvd and park in one of the spots to the left. Check-in was easy, with the staff being very pleasant. After getting the room key you then head over to receive a parking pass and be harassed into attending a Wyndham sales presentation, which they call Owner Education. As long as Wyndham is involved with Worldmark we will never attend them. However, the young lady was very pleasant.  We were assigned a ground floor single bedroom, with king bed. The unit looks like a converted apartment. The kitchen is tiny, even smaller than the kitchen in our RV. The A/C is a through wall unit, located in the living
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time and sharing your experience with us. I apologize the unit/amenities were not up to your expectations. Our goal is to make each part of the vacation experience satisfactory and with your feedback it will help us achieve our goal. We value your feedback and appreciate your taking the time to provide this information.

Summary: Fantastic trip with my grandchildren, first time at Disney's California adventure and it was phenomenal the light show was amazing at 9:00 PM, day two Was at Disneyland and we thoroughly enjoyed all the new additions and had a blast, The dolphin Cove resort was one of the timeshares listed in the area and we had a fantastic complementary breakfast it's got a pool it's got a workout room sauna Jacuzzi, the only thing that was lacking was washer and dryer in the room  but there are facilities on site, great 2bdrm condo
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing Wyndham’s Dolphins Cove to share the magic of Disney with your grand children.   We are delighted to hear that you all had a blast and will look forward to your future return.  Best wishes.

Summary: First the negatives:  Yes, there is one wall AC unit, and it does sound pretty loud when operating.  It is December and we did need heat a couple nights.  Also, it does appear to be a converted apartment complex.  However, that means a full sized apartment with kitchen and private bedroom(s).  Neither of these were dealkillers for us, they just are what they are.  I could see the AC being problematic in summertime, though.  Now for the positives.  The staff are outstanding and will bend over backward to accomodate their guests.  The grounds and buildings are immaculately kept.  Although they are laid out like an apartment complex, they have all the amenities one would desire of a resort except a dining option (not a big deal for me or most timesharers).  There is a Denny's next
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words. We will share these with our staff. We are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay. I am sorry to hear you experienced some difficulties with the AC unit during your stay. This is certainly not our Wyndham standards. I will have our maintenance team look into these issues to eliminate any future occurrences. We strive to provide top of the line accommodations for all our guests and your feedback will help us to do so. Again, thank you for reaching out and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: What an amazing place to stay
Summary: What can I say.  This place is one of the best places we have stayed.  We stayed here for 17 days and we weren't disappointed.  Staff are exemplary and attentive. Everyone from the reception desk to the maintenance was very welcoming to us.  The place is comfortable and suited our needs to a tee.  This is what service should be.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing this feedback, Roy. We appreciate that you took the time to share your experience with us. I am glad to hear that you enjoy your 17 day stay with us. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: All the comforts of home! We always have a wonderful stay while visiting Disneyland! There are 10 of us that travel to Disneyland each year and enjoy staying at Dolphin's Cove Resort. The pool, game room, laundry room are great to have on site when not at the Park. The staff are very accommodating and the units are clean and spacious.
Manager Response: I am glad to hear you have enjoyed the many amenities at Dolphins Cove as part of your visit to the happiest place on earth! We look forward to your next visit.  Thank you for choosing Dolphins Cove!

Summary: Pool heated and nice. Great clubhouse for large group to gather. Shuttle to Disney is 4 minute walk. Denny's next door. Great activity director- fun projects. Key cards don't always work. Need free cookies all the time in check-in area.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your experience. We appreciate the suggestion about the cooking in the lobby! We hope you come back to visit us soon.

Summary: We came in November for Thanksgiving week so first off.. The air conditioning issues that many people reference were not an issue for us! Read below for details of the timeshare and travel to Disney, etc.   I have never been to a time share so I had no prior expectations. (This was my sister's timeshare we used.) I was very impressed!   1. From the moment we checked in, staff was friendly and accommodating. We had a small family emergency during our stay that resulted in us having to contact paramedics. The staff went out of their way to help us out with everything, having security help flag down the coming paramedics, front desk staff asking if we needed anything and supplying things for us before we could ask... And even hugged and just provided emotional support to other

The living room had an air conditioning unit on the wall that didn't even cool the bedrooms had only 1 bathroom which we should have had 2 for 2 families the carpet was dirty the bath/shower was awful it didn't drain properly the drain in the sink didn't drain hardly the.room cards didn't work had to go to the office several times so that they could issue new cards!!!  The ceiling fan in one of the bedrooms was very very noisy!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Overall it was the worst experience I have had😠
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear about your experience and apologize for any inconvenience you experienced while staying with us. If you would like to discuss your stay further please contact us at 800-251-8736, Option 1, Option 1 and ask to speak with Owner Care.

Summary Heading: Awesome Customer Service - We love Dolphin Cove
Summary: My family stayed at Dolphin Cove for a week in August. We had 3 two bedroom units that are the standard World Mark units without a washer and dryer. They do have laundry facility on the property so it's not that big of an issue to not have them in the room. The property was extremely quiet, clean, and very well maintained as usual for a Workd Mark property. The big difference with this property was the customer service - it was by far the best service we have ever had at a World Mark property. No matter what we needed, more towels, soap, fixing the garbage disposal. They came immediately!   Me and my brother were looking forward to BINGO and Beer night and were disappointed when no one else showed to play. We decided not to play BINGO but they still gave us the beer - it was
Manager Response: I am glad to hear you and your family enjoyed your stay in Anaheim at Dolphins Cove.  It sounds like the resort staff demonstrated Count on Me! service and helped make your stay fun! Thank you for vacationing with WorldMark.

Summary: We stayed in a 3 bedroom unit on our way to San Francisco and a 2 bedroom unit on our return trip.  It's an older Wyndham/Worldmark Resort.  The 3 bedroom unit had 2 AC units, one in the master bed room and one in the family/dining area.  The 2 bedroom unit only had 1 AC unit in the family/dining room and only 1 bathroom.  The AC unit does not cool the bedrooms.  Fans are included in each room.  The resort is close to restaurants and fast food.  If you go to Disneyland take the bus that you can catch around the corner from the resort.  Even though the resort is mostly families it is quiet.  We had no problems and enjoyed our stay.

I stayed in a one bedroom condo that was superb. The living room and bedroom were spacious and comfortable. The small patio had a great view of the grounds. I was in a corner unit which was great for little noise from neighbors.

We loved the older look.  The pool and the 9-hole miniature golf course were great.  Also a plus was the fact that you could self-park your vehicle in a carport, if you wanted to.  We only had one complaint which the maintenance crew fixed for us.    However, be aware that there is no air conditioning in the bedroom.  there is a ceiling fan, but it got rather stuffy in August.  There is also no overhead light in the bedroom, only a couple of lamps.

Very nice, peaceful, relaxing place to stay in the midst of a bustling city.  Unlike most, we were not there for Disneyland.  However, it is located within decent walking distance of Disneyland (depending on your definition of walking distance...it's about a mile) and not far from Angel Stadium.  While there, we traveled to various beaches, including Santa Monica and Manhattan.  We also visited Hollywood, Griffith Observatory, and the LaBrea Tar Pits.  Traffic is what you would expect in LA, but we coordinated our excursions so as not to be traveling during rush hour.  The resort itself had complimentary breakfast for us twice.  There was a lounge room with theater-type seating for watching movies.  There were also games, such as an air hockey table.  The pool was decent and

We stayed at Dolphins Cove for seven days while visiting Disneyland. The staff at check-in were very friendly and personable. When we got to our room it was obvious that floor had not been vacuumed.  During our stay at the resort housekeeping switched out the towels one time and they didn't leave enough for us for the duration of our stay. They did not ever change the sheets and linen on the bed.

As a timeshare owner I was a bit taken back by how age has affected this property.  On the positive side the facility is well maintained by the staff and location is hard to beat if visiting Disneyland is in your plans with plenty of restaurants within walking distance to choose from.  On the negative side the facility is quite old and timeshare sales is pitched quite heavily upon check-in.  There are scheduled activities throughout the week for families with pre-teen children.  This was our first visit to this facility and we would have preferred quiet but it wasn't too bad for an older couple like us.  We did occasionally reminiscence for a few times when we were that family with kids running around but only for a brief time before retreating back to our unit. Can get quite

Truly the place to stay if you're going to Disneyland. But if you aren't--like us--it is still a really nice place.  The people were always helpful. The rooms were clean and pretty spacious. The bathroom had two areas with doors to separate shower/toilet from sink/closets. Really swell for having one bathroom and multiple family members. Washers and dryers were provided at no extra cost. Free breakfast on Monday and Friday. Game room with pay-per-play billiards, air hockey, arcade machines and movie watching area with free DVD access.  Ping pong by the pool, pool toys allowed and provided.  There were only two grills (gas), which meant they were hard to get with everyone wanting to use them during our stay, but they were by the pool and the maintenance guy started it for you

Summary Heading: Absolutely Love this Place!!! 2 bd/2 bath heaven
Summary: This is our 4th or 5th time staying at this resort near Disneyland Ca.  We absolutely love this resort.  It has something for absolutely everyone in the family!!!  lots of fun activities for both adults and kids.  pool is always clean and refreshing. Love the spa...lots of lounges available.  The 2 bedroom/2 bath units are perfect for our family. Very close to everything...easy freeway access.  Staff are wonderful. Always helpful and ready to help out.  We will continue coming back again and again to this wonderful resort.

We booked this last minutes when we changed our plans in the area due to it's proximity to Disneyland and Knott's Berry Farm.  Well, prepare to travel back in time.  We have stayed in many Wyndham properties over the years which have all been updated and very comfortable.  This two bedroom unit hasn't been updated in at least 20 years.  The air conditioning is a single wall unit in the living room for the entire suite!  If it was comfortable in the living room, it was sweltering in the bedrooms.  If the bedrooms were comfortable, the living room was an icebox.  I understand the cost associated with upgrading to central air, but for pete's sake, put wall units in the bedrooms!  And the A/C unit itself sounds like a jet engine.  Very, very uncomfortable beds.  Tiny kitchen.  No

Still my go to spot in Anaheim. Not as fancy as Wyndham Anaheim but cozy, family friendly and close to Disneyland.  We are a military family and when we visit "home" SoCal we have a crowd with us. I am a Wyndham owner and all the 2 bedrooms are advertised with 1 bath on the club wyndham website...was very pleased that we were given a 2 bed 2ba which made life easy for a 3 day excursion to Disneyland with my sister, brother in law her children, me, my husband and our 2 children.  Location is very convenient to Disneyland we never drove onto Disney and paid parking, the Toy Story parking is literally right around the corner and we walked it every morning and every night when leaving the park. This is the third time my family has stayed at Dolphin's Cove over the past 10 years.  It's a good resort that seems to miss on some of the little things.  Pros:  * Security on site.  We saw security on site every morning when leaving and every night when return back, so it looks like they have it on site 24/7. * Gated parking lot.  Again, anything safety feature which eases the mind a lot * Tons of activities on site.  They have a great game room, pool on site, and even a nine hole mini golf course on the property. * Well stocked rooms.  We never had to worry about doing dishes just so we had enough silverware or plates for our next meal.  Cons: Overall, most of my cons are small, but it shows a lack of detail in my opinion. * Missing items in room.  There was no alarm clock or

My in-laws saved up and got 3 units for the family.  I'm not a time share person and don't understand it.  Check in was easy and the staff is great. They are all very helpful and positive. The staff is what makes this place a 4 star review.  The unit was clean and adequate, nothing fancy. They have all the amenities with extras: dishes, cleaning supplies, detergents, etc. Free on site laundry. Was very helpful with 3 kids. Location is about 25 min walk to Disneyland or 10 min walk to Disney shuttle and then 10 min free wait/ride to entrance (Disney shuttle parking across from Convention Center is for anyone, not just those who park there. Toy Story parking lot).   A few restaurants around but nothing really to choose from. We shopped at a local grocery store and stocked up. The

This resort is a great centrally located spot to a lot of the things to do in Anaheim. The rooms are well maintained, clean & well supplied. The grounds are well maintained & pretty. The pool is a great area with lounges, a ping pong table and hot tub. The resort also offered activities like bingo & mini golf which the kids enjoyed. Although all rooms have a balcony/patio - some offer only views of the parking lot or brick wall of the neighbouring building. You want to get a room with a balcony that looks over the pool or the grounds/mini golf course. We did not rent a car for our trip & this hotel is perfectly located if you like walking. It is only a 20 minute walk to the Disney parks & Downtown Disney (plus you save on parking & the congestion of driving). There is also a

After reading several mixed reviews about Dolphin's Cove, I wasn't sure what to expect.  I am a Worldmark owner and used to Worldmark standards.  This resort met them all.  We stayed as a family of 5 in a 3-bedroom deluxe unit.  It was on the second floor.  Note - there are no elevators at this property, so that meant we had to haul our luggage upstairs.  It actually wasn't that bad because the stairs led right up to the front door of our unit.    The unit has been updated with new carpet, fixtures, appliances and furniture.  I really loved the layout, including the vaulted ceilings.  The balcony was a bit iffy, I didn't feel very secure out there at times, but seeing as we were hardly out there, it had no impact on our trip.    This resort offered some extra treats.  In the

Stayed at the Dolphin's Cove Resort for 3 nights in total and it was good. It was nothing amazing, it is nice that it has barbecues that you can use and it's very family oriented for little kids. There's kids at all times of the day by the pool side making it hard to just enjoy it for a bit before the storm of kids hits the pool. It would be nice if they had another hot tub as well as it was packed every single night we tried to go. The rooms were okay, the pull out couch isn't very comfortable so as long as you sleep on the beds or don't mind not being very comfortable, go for it. Would recommend for families with kids, not so much for people that don't have kids.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay near the park
Summary: Dolphin's Cove is located fairly close to Disneyland, so it was pretty convenient for us. The bus is right around the corner too. For a Wyndham resort property, this was pretty below expectations though. The kitchen was on the smallish side and the bathroom was below par. Everything else was fine though. The rooms were clean and beds were comfy. Everything else was satisfactory. The grounds were nice, but again, not as fancy as most Wyndham Resorts.

Summary Heading: Close to Disney and friendly staff.
Summary: This was a really nice little family resort. Close to Disney. It's clean and comfortable. The staff is very friendly. The only down sides are lack of central air and the card keys have a hard time staying magnetized. Other than that it's a nice place for families to stay.

Summary Heading: Great Place and close to Disneyland
Summary: In January 2016 we stayed in a 1 bedroom deluxe. There were three of us, two adults and one four year old. The staff are very warm and inviting. My only compliant was the parking for check-in in a really small area. The resort is gated and very quiet.  Our 1 bedroom was very nice. I think everything had been updated recently except for the bathroom bathtub and toilet. There were plenty of kitchen supplies for out stay. The appliances were all full sized. Plenty of room for groceries. The one bedroom has a lot of space, plenty of room for 4 people. The pull out couch was relatively comfortable. They are close to grocery stores and restaurants. Disneyland is a few blocks away. We walked with out 4 year with no problems. You can also take a bus to Disneyland if you don't want to

Our nephew has timeshare with Wyndham and last minute could not take his room. There is no canceling with timeshare last minute, so we took the room.    Everything that I had hoped Wyndham would fix, they did. It's been remodeled: flat screen TV's, all new carpets, new flooring in the kitchen, better beds, nicer furniture, LOVE the linens on the bed. We had a downstairs and I love the patio. Two downsides: only one air conditioner for the whole apartment and it's in the living room. It would be nice if each bedroom had it's own AC. #2: it's hard for 5 adults and one child to share one bathroom.   This is the first time we used the pool. My husband took our 8 year old granddaughter there every day for an hour or two and she loved it! (90 degrees in February!) The deepest part of

Summary Heading: What we expected and maybe a little more
Summary: We reserved this property through our timeshare exchange via RCI.    It was not rated as a gold or even silver crown, which is what we typically try to find.   However, it was rated as an RCI hospitality award winner.   If you read the description you will find it to be very accurate.   The staff at the front desk was very helpful and friendly throughout our stay.   The property is very clean and well taken care of.   Pool was very clean, perfect temperature in the hottub....just as advertised.   Our room wasnt bad.   Not that nice, but everything had been updated.   New appliances, new furniture, comfortable beds.   The floor plan was dated.   The windows were not well insulated, frame was soaked on multiple occasions from condensation.   Wyndham has done a great job preserving

Stayed here on Jan2-4th, in a 3 bedroom unit. It was a quick one day trip to disneyland. the location is still pretty convienent. Since we had 8 people we drove to the Toy story parking in one car, vs paying $5 per person for the ART shuttle. Although that night at midnight, I chose to run back with the stroller about a mile, and made it back well before everyone else that took the shuttle back to toy story parking lot.  The room was pleasant, and spacious. With the new homewood suites hotel that was built, made it difficult to see fireworks, from our room in north east corner of the complex.  They had a cheese and cracker social, the night we arrived. Also they only do breakfast on monday and fridays 8:30-10:30. At least when we were there.  My inly complaint on the room, they

Summary Heading: Had a great time at Disneyland
Summary: We are timeshare owners, the Dolphin did not disapoint. The accommadations were very good, kinda of a small one bedroom suite. We did have 4 adults and 2 children, it was tight but we had everything we needed. When we arrived we noticed that our frig wasn't working and it was replaced within twenty minutes. We were ther in Oct but the weather was still in the 80-90's so we needed AC and it was glorious, you could turn the thermostat way down and it complied, maybe the best part of the room. They had a great covered pool and two hot tubs, and a large screen TV while using either. And the beds were very comfortable.

Stayed here for two nights dec 6-8. We were at a wyndham location in oceanside and had a horrible experience so we left and they fit us in here no problem !!!  Room was great , pool was spacious and beautiful . Front desk were amazing and felt so bad that we had a horrible experience at the other location. I would def return here hands down !! Highly recommend it !

I had a few reservations about staying here based on prior trip advisor comments. However, be ready to be blown away. This place was wonderful. Our unit was very clean, all the amenities of home, minus the dog. We had a room over the parking lot, low noise, and we still sat out on our little patio. The staff are incredible, very pleasant, helpful and friendly. We easily walked all over, to Target for groceries and to Disney. If you get tired, the bus stop for Disney via ART is conveniently located a block away. I would recommend this resort to any one. We stayed here for the sole purpose of participating in runDisney's Avenger Half Marathon weekend. Easy commute to the start and to the parks.

Summary Heading: A couple minutes from Disneyland by shuttle
Summary: Stayed at the resort the first week in November. Everything was exceptional.  Suite was a three bedroom. Staff was very gracious and accommodating.  We will definitely be back.  Weather was perfect.  Shuttle to Disneyland was just around the corner on Harbor Blvd.  Cost was very reasonable.  There were 4 adults and 2 children.  Everyone had a great time. Pool was heated. Very clean.

Summary Heading: Making memories to last a lifetime!
Summary: Nineteen family members gathered for a surprise birthday celebration.  The accommodations at Dolphin's Cove Resort were fabulous.  The staff went "an extra mile" to make our locations of three different condos convenient to each other.  They also worked on upgrades and stay extensions to meet our needs.  The amenities and activities gave the eight grandchildren hours of fun.  The convenience of getting to and from Disneyland from a nearby shuttle service for nineteen of us made for easy planning.  The resort is gated with key access for entry to the parking area and resort.  This allowed our young children freedom to move back and forth among family members without adult supervision.  The pool, jacuzzi, and recreation building is separately gated with key access too high for

When you drive up to this resort you would think it was a dump.  No curb appeal whatsoever, but we were pleasantly surprised.  The hotel lobby is very small, but the staff was super friendly and helpful.  We had a 3 bedroom unit which was extremely spacious and very nice.  The hotel has a nice pool area, although that is small as well.  It contains a business center, breakfast center, gym and laundry facilities on site. It is about 4 blocks from Disneyland and very close to many restaurants and shops. In fact, there is a Denny's right next door.  Overall we had a great stay here in Anaheim.

Our unit was nice. Clean and roomy. Front desk staff very kind. They didn't have our reservation from hotels.com because we booked just about 1/2 hour before heading there. I already had one unit booked through Wyndham timeshare and booked two more through hotels.vow. The girl that helped us was very kind and accommodating.   That being said, the air conditioning situation is ridiculous! There was one unit in the living room. Bedroom and bathroom were scorching even when the living room was left on 68 degrees. There's a fan but that doesn't really help much besides the middle of the night after it cools off slightly.   Just a word of caution to know before you go. Especially if going when the weather is HOT. There was a heat wave when we went in October.   Other then that we

This is one of the very few Resorts in Anaheim where you can get 2 and 3 bedroom accommodation. We have stayed here 5 times. Love the rooms, love the pool, love the resort. A major plus going for it is it's close proximity to restaurants. The only other 2 and 3 bedroom accommodation in Anaheim is in the middle of nowhere. Dolphins Cove as a restaurant next door and at least 5 others within a 5 minute walk. Staff here are courteous and friendly, and very helpful. The rooms are large and comfortable.

We traveled from New Zealand and really enjoyed our stay. The check in was easy and the staff were very nice and helpful. We booked a two bedroom apartment and it was more than we expected. The bedrooms were large and the living area and kitchen were a good large size also. The Disney shuttle is a 2 minute walk away and there are many restaurants in a short walking distance. The kids enjoyed the pool after a long day at Disneyland. I would definitely stay here again.

The resort is located a couple of miles from Disneyland, so those with younger children may want to consider taking the bus or driving directly. The resort offers free covered parking for all guests. We did not have a car for our visit, but being two adults we found it nice to walk to the parks each day. If you do have a car, there is a Super Target within a short driving distance to get groceries. If you don't have a car, or prefer not to drive, there is a grocery store that delivers and there is a CVS within walking distance that offers a variety of items.  We stayed in a one bedroom king suite at the newly remodeled resort. The room was well maintained and stocked with a great supply of kitchen items. While there isn't a washer or dryer in the unit, the resort offers a

No elevators, no safe, one wall AC wall unit in living room so the bedroom is too warm.  Definitely not up to  Wyndham standards.  A little disappointed.  But the place is clean but too high priced for missing a lot of the amenities I expect at a Wyndham property.

I was a guest of someone who is a time share owner so let me start by being grateful for the opportunity to stay at this property.  Check in was fine even though I don't like the pressure of going to a breakfast/meeting to be sold something.  I opted out but it felt weird.  The room was mediocre.  One bedroom with a terrible and perhaps even dangerous fold out couch.  We had a toddler sleeping on the couch and we had to prop up the mattress so that he wouldn't slip under the couch.  The air conditioning was also terrible.  The room was clean and the kitchen was well equipped.

My wife and I are Wyndham timeshare owners which Dolphins Cove Resort is part of.  A few weeks before our arrival the resort called us to confirm our reservation.  I asked at that time if it would be able to have a room on the first floor near the pool.  Although they said they could not promise it they would try.  We were not disappointed.  Room 107 is a 2 bedroom suite right next to the pool on the first floor.  It has its own private patio (5 1/2' metal grate fence with no gate) with patio table and chairs, next to the pool.  The room is nice and well kept.  Masters bedroom has a king size bed, the other has 2 twin beds.  There is a queen fold out bed in the main room, which is as comfortable as you might imagine it would be.  The bathroom is shared with one entry door and is

Beatifully remodeled near Disneyland.  Timeshare unit, that at first glace you would pass right by.  The resort is gated, but you pull I to a parking lot that looks like an apartment building.  There is covered parking which is a major plus with the abundant sunshine.  Look however are deceiving.  Once you walk around to your unit, you see the beautiful landscaping.  There is a nice pool are, a fitness center and plenty of activities if you have young children.  The units have all been recently remodeled with all new appliances, carpet and granite. I had one minor issue with my room and it was immediately taken care of. The location of the resort is also amazing.  You are right around the corner from Disneyland.  Anaheim is also conveniently located between San Diego and Los

We stayed here for a week in May in a three-bedroom condo. Check-in was easy and fast, with friendly service; the crib we requested was already in our room when we got there. The resort is rather small but is undergoing renovation now; our room was newly remodeled. It was clean and comfortable. The resort was within a mile from the park, so it was possible to walk to Disney; there was no shuttle available directly from the resort. There was a nice pool area and a small gym on site.

The staff was very friendly. There were even cookies available in the lobby when we checked in! Our two bedroom suite was spacious, very clean and comfortable. The bed was soooo comfortable! The pool and hot tub were nice. Pool towels were provided. I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: The best place to stay when you need extra space!
Summary: We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo for 3 nights in July 2015.  The room was freshly remodeled.  The kitchen had everything we needed.  The grounds were immaculate, the room was very clean.  There were people working on the property any time we were out of the room.  There is plenty of staff keeping this place in tip top shape.  We will stay here again, in fact we just booked another 3 night stay for November.  I highly recommend this hotel for families who need more space than a standard hotel provides.

Visited  during 4 the of July week. Was a guest of the actual timeshare owner. Requested several things....(early check in...upgraded upstairs room near pool) The staff went above and beyond to accommodate our every request. The only small issue we ran into was that we assumed all 2 bedroom units had 2 bathrooms (because we've stayed in the 2/2baths on several other occasions) so upon entering our room...we noticed it only had 1 bath...but a quick call to the owner and a few calls to the front desk manager..we were quickly moved to a beautiful 2/2 bath room close to all the activities. There is too much to say about this awesome resort...the daily activities are the absolute best! The staff really go out of their way to make sure everyone is having a great time....from daily

Summary Heading: Stayed in a lot better and a better price.
Summary: Very small for price we paid,were not told about taxes when we booked,were only asked to pay when we were checking in,had a few issues and staff on desk were not interested actually very rude about the whole situation, will never stay there again a and will tell as many people I can about the horrible experience we had there.

We stayed at Dolphin's Cove from June 20-26, 2015.  We must have had a renovated unit since the furnishings appeared to be updated.  We had a 3-bedroom 2-bath, just like an apartment.  The kitchen was well-stocked with utensils, dishes, etc. and even had a dishwasher.  The rooms were nice and the beds were comfortable.  We loved eating breakfast out on the balcony in the morning.  The grounds are really nice here, lots of pretty plants & flowers.  Since we were on the run most of the week, we didn't get a chance to use the pool & rec room until our last day.  The pool was heated and they threw in a bunch of blow-up toys.  They had games in the rec room, which my 5-year-old loved.  Their continental breakfast on our last day was better than most places we've stayed at.

Summary Heading: Renovations, noisy, old rooms are awful.
Summary: We were unfortunate enough to get one of the old rooms. This is a Wyndham property and it should have been upgraded/renovated 10 years ago. If you plan on staying here, make sure you ask for a renovated room. There are also building works going on next door, which make it unpleasant and noisy (not sure when these are due to finish).  Once it is fixed up and renovated it will be a lovely property, but until then make sure you ask what type of room you are getting before you book. The rating I have given here is based on the old rooms.  If you get a new room, it would be a 3 and 1/2. Having said that, in our new room, we were located above people who were constantly smoking so there needs to be better signage about designated smoking areas.

Summary Heading: Misleading photos on Dolphin Cove website
Summary: Overall, the resort was nice.  Several days were filled with activities and the staff was very personable.  However, one of the photos shown in their website's gallery shows an "observation deck" with a spiral staircase leading to the upper deck.  Once we arrived to the resort, I noticed there was indeed an "observation deck"...but you are not able to access it.  There is no spiral staircase which leads to the top.  I don't know if they removed it..or if there never was one to begin with.  Somewhat disappointing.  It would have been a nice spot to watch the nightly fireworks from  Disneyland.

Summary Heading: 4th Time and we Still Love It
Summary: We are very happy Wyndham owners (we own in Sedona and Flagstaff, AZ).  We have been to Sedona once and Flagstaff twice.  This is our fourth trip to Dolphin's Cove.  Yes, it is a couple of miles from the Happiest Place on Earth and yes it is in Anaheim where the weather is nice!!!  But, we really enjoy our time at Dolphin's Cove.  We arrived on a Saturday, settled in to our 3 bedroom and 1 bedroom units and had a great week.  One day at the pools, one day at the parks.  When we had any issues or needed any additional items, the staff was responsive and helpful.  One unit was ready when we arrived early and the other unit was available a few hours later.  We had two updated units and were very happy with the new decor.  The pools and entertainment areas were all in good order.

This was truly above my expectations.  The rooms were well furnished and clean. The grounds were clean and beautiful.  It was a wonderful relaxing place to stay. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  I would stay there again if I needed to be in the area. all units had either a balcony or a patio with chairs and tables.

Wyndham owner, this is a Wyndham MANAGED Resort. Stayed here Feb 2015 for a week. Great location, great staff, rooms are in need of serious updates. They are in the process of remodeling rooms, don't know how many but it is needed. The pool area is nice, there are 2 hotubs but only one was working, pool is great for families, deepest is 4ft. Since you're going to Disney, it's adequate. Staff is great, if you have questions they're very helpful, very willing to work with you. Don't walk to Disneyland, take AART, tired kids will thank you.

Summary Heading: Would happily stay there again ANYTIME!!!
Summary: I will tell you up front, I am a Wyndham owner.  Dolphin Cove calls me every time I have a reservation a few days before my arrival to ask if there is anything they can do to make my stay better. I wish all Wyndham properties and hotels this this...  Upon arrival they greet me with a smile and give me a little bottle of their sparkling cider. They always are very friendly and are willing to help if there are any problems.   This hotel/timeshare is close to Disneyland. There is plenty of parking either covered or opened. The grounds are beautiful, well kept and quiet (away from the hustle and bustle of Disney). The rooms are clean and very comfortable.   My only 2 wishes is that they had the laundry in your room like some other Wyndham properties. (There is a community laundry

Summary Heading: + Location, Location, Location | | - just an OK time share
Summary: We stayed at Dolphin's Cove during Easter/Spring break last year and it's pretty much just like what everyone here has mentioned -- great location, very close to Disneyland, you can walk from there but we didn't since we had a stroller.  However, the rooms and especially the carpet can use major updates.  The carpet was pretty run down and seemed dirty.  Tried not to have kids roll around on them.  My in-laws used their Wyndham points to book the accommodation for us so I can't complain.  We had a 1BR with a pull out couch, a full dining area and kitchen  We had breakfasts here; bought pancakes and waffles from the nearby Target.  Overall OK but would not pay to stay there.  We stayed a few days at a nearby hotel (Hotel Indigo) and that cost less if we paid for Dolphin Cove.

We just stayed at the Dolphin's Cove resort.  It was much nicer than we expected.  The views from the photos don't give justice to the grounds.  The rooms are nice but dated a bit.  They are currently remodeling so that could change depending on where you get a room.  The nice part was that it is close to the Disney attractions. We bought bus passes for each day so that we did not have to park the car.  Shopping is close with Target and other options near the site.  While not the most modern place, we plan on booking this again for our next trip.

We traded into this one through RCI. Not nearly the same standards as most RCI trades we have traded into. It is a bit run-down and tired. They undergoing renovations which is great for the future, but horrible for those who are staying there during reno. Parking is rough, it's noisy and construction zones throughout. I would not pay the $200plus per night for this one. The location is not bad, but not the closest resort to Disneyland which is why we stayed there. You can take the ART bus to Disneyland, or you can walk a block or so further and just take the shuttle at the Toy Story parking lot. The area is OK, not the nicest, but I never felt like we were going to get mugged or anything like that. The pool was lovely! Great temp even in the Winter, nice hot tub too. We didn't

We booked a three bedroom timeshare at this location.  We are Wyndham members which means nothing at this Wyndham resort.  We entered the room, The heat had not been put on so it was freezing. We turned on the one air-conditioner in the main room and opened the oven and turned it on to get heat.  The air conditioner itself was missing the button to turn up the heat so we had to resort to using a pen to hit the button.  The other air-conditioner in the master bedroom only blows cold air and does not have the ability to blow heat.    The bedrooms were freezing and did not warm up after three hours.  My son slept in sweat pants and a sweat shirt.   My other son went to shower to find out that the shower curtain was missing the inner liner.  We called and asked for assistance to

I was a little nervous of this resort as it has some very mediocre reviews but we really could not find much to complain about.  We arrived VERY early after landing at LAX from Australia.  The receptionist jokingly advised we were too early for check-out never mind check-in, then promptly offered us immediate check-in if we were happy with a room at the rear of the property. Perfect, we were away from any road noise and got to hop straight into a shower.  Bear in mind this was prior to 9am so they were most accommodating. From that point on, every single staff member we encountered was as friendly and helpful as could be. The room was a 1 bed suite which was perfectly adequate for the time we spent there and comfortably slept 2 adults and 1 teen.  The bedding was comfortable and

We've been to Disneyland many times and with that being said, we also have lots of experience with hotels in the area. We stayed at hotels like Hilton, Sheraton to Budget 8 and this hotel/resort would be some where in the middle. Yes, the hotel is old and the carpet is stain, but the bed is clean and the room is roomy. We stayed at one bedroom suite with one queen bed in the separate bedroom and one queen size sofa bed. There are two flat screen TV, one in the bedroom, one outside in the living room. There is a dining area with a big round table and four chairs. The kitchen is loaded with everything you need and it's set up like any apartment! Did I just said APARTMENT? Yes, the resort rooms are setup just like apartments, but a decent one with with very nice and secure

Summary Heading: Great location, Good Amenities, Average Rooms
Summary: Four Stars is based on location to Disneyland.  First, the reason to choose Dolphin's Cove is its proximity to the Disneyland Resort.  You can walk a 1/4 mile from Dolphin's Cove to Disney's Toy Story parking lot which has trams to the main gate.  I accidentally drove to the lot and parked -- a $17 mistake! -- when I could have walked to the tram.  And, if you feel like it, it is only 1 mile to walk to the Main Gate down Harbor Blvd.  The Resort Amenities are not bad.  There is a heated jacuzzi, heated pool, two available computers, a ping-pong table, bar-b-ques, and a clubhouse with video games and televisions.  The resort is secured with gates which is good because it is located on the fringe of what might be considered questionable neighborhoods.  The rooms are a little dingy

We stayed that the Dolphin's Cove Resort last week while on a family vacation to Disneyland. The location was great in regards to Disney, just a 5 minute drive to parking. The street view of DCR was a little misleading.  It's really hard to tell how what you're driving into at first glance, it almost feels like an apartment complex.  Check in was a breeze. Once we found our room, it was easy to see that there had been recent updates to the units. Our Unit was clean and cozy.  We had a 1 bedroom unit for the 4 of us, my 2 children slept on the pull-out couch, which was quite comfy i might add.  Our balcony looked out on a nice green courtyard.  We used our Worldmark membership to stay there, and to be honest, was well worth the money (credits). We have stayed at the other newer

Summary Heading: Great location, great staff, Love this place
Summary: We stayed here for 2 weeks and absolutely loved it. All the staff were amazing and it was so close to everything.  For food there are a huge variety of places around the resort and there is also Von's around the corner. We also visited some outlet centres and travelled into LA which were fairly close by.  The best bit about this place was the fact that we were able to walk to Disneyland everyday for a week (there was a big group of us so we had lots to do).

We spent a week at the resort and had a great time. They had fun activities thoughout the week including beers and bingo, karaoke, kids scavenger hunt, craft hour, etc. it was great to have free entertainment when we all were in need of a break from the park. every staff member we encountered was kind, helpful, efficient and professional.  Our room had all the start up necessities for put week, coffee filters, one pkg of coffee, a pkg of microwave popcorn, laundry detergent. The soaps for bathroom were poor quality. The free washers and dryers were a great bonus. I love going home with all our laundry clean!! Will stay here again!  We took ART route 1 or 3 to disneyland.  It is a very easy walk to ART stop.

My friend and I were there for a week. Halfway through our stay we moved to an upgraded room...it was cool. Our first room the AC and the oven had issues, neither working properly.  The staff were all very kind and helpful.  Loved that there was someone there to give out information about the area!

Each staff person we interacted with was very friendly and accommodating. They made you feel very welcome. Our one bedroom unit was fairly comfortable, but the layout was odd. It almost felt like it use to be an old apartment. There is no central A/C, just one wall unit in the corner of the living room. We had it set as low as I could go but barely felt it in the bedroom.   Although the units (at least ours didn't) don't have a washer/dryer in them, a laundry room with plenty of washers and dryers was just a short walk from our room. The best part - it's FREE, and they provide soap too. It was nice to be able to wash our clothes for free while on our 10 day California trip.  The kitchen came stocked with a lot of items - even small packets of various spices! What we didn't see

It was ok. Except...  1. Our air conditioner never worked EVEN after calling maintenance AND leaked our whole time there (3days) so we had to put a pan under it to catch the water with one of our pool towels under it to soak up what we didn't catch  2. Water pressure in showers wouldn't even wash off soap  3. Vent in 2nd bedroom just stopped working. And nobody would do anything about it.  4. Place looks dingy and stained and run down.   5. No tv. In other bedroom (sounds kinda petty BUT caused fights on who got to sleep where)  6. Beds were WAY hard and very uncomfortable  7. Construction in pool area while trying to play  You would think with charging so much per night they could clean the carpet or replace it and update the hotel.... very outdated and rundown looking. Summary Heading: Pay A Few More and don't stay here.
Summary: I am not someone who picks apart everything wrong and posts pictures from under the fridge. With that said, I wouldn't go again. Here are a few complaints 1. In the master the dresser is so close to the bed you can hardly get out of the room. 2. Bugs in the bathroom and kitchen-spiders and ants. 3. My wife and daughter in the pool, while construction crew wearing face masks work on the tile in the same area. 4. Asked to be relocated because of bugs-including fee for bigger room, cleaning fee- total 200.00 5. Carpets stained bad. 6. Place has kinda creepy run -down feel to it. 7. SLOW WIFI  Positive: 1. Close to Disneyland 2. Staff seems to try hard. 3. Climate control excellent 4. Bed's very comfortable 5. Very clean (just worn and dumpy)  Ok, so sneaked one last negative in the

We've stayed at this hotel many times.  Our most recent stay included grandchildren ages 1 and 3.  The location is great for access to Disneyland and California Adventure.  There is a shuttle stop just around the corner for the theme parks.  The staff are friendly and helpful.  Each unit has a full kitchen and it's nice to be able to have breakfast in the unit.  We also packed our lunch into the park to save a little money as well as being able to have healthier food.  The pool is nice and there's a wading pool for the little kids.  It is an older property and needs some work.  We will go again and are hopeful the planned remodel and upgrades will make it a better experience.

Room 616.  This is a second floor room with no elevator.  For the first 24 hours, the room smelled awful, a mix of musty and bathroom cleaner odors.  Guests staying on the uncomfortable (not leather) sofa have to go thru the bedroom to access the bathroom. Shower was nice but found ants on toilet both days. Wall-unit AC located directly over couch, bedroom had ceiling fan only, so warm. Kitchen well appointed, large TVs. Packing up and found AC unit had leaked down wall and carpet was soaked probably contributed to awful smell. Nice pool area. Gated parking. Beautiful interior grounds. No maid service for stays less than 7 days. Front desk friendly, but had security and a maid at our door by 10:10am on checkout day.  We had requested and received an 11am checkout. $5 Disney

We stayed here for a few days around the labor day holiday to spend some time at Disneyland. This is about 5 minutes away from Disneyland and Disney California Adventure parks. Upon checkin I was presented with a bottle of sparkling cider and a goodie bag upon checkout with two small waters and a snack.

We just returned from a short visit, stayed there for 3 nights.  It is an older property, but well maintained and secure.  Our rooms were clean, had a nice balcony, the property was quiet, even with lots of families.    It is a great location as a 'home base'  we went to 2 baseball games (angles and Dodgers) Newport beach and Disneyland.  The staff is very knowledgeable and friendly.  I would recommend this property and would love to come back.

Summary Heading: We were well taken care of.
Summary: Staying here under my timeshare I have a level of expectation for resorts I stay at. This place exceeded my expectations over and over. The resort staff was helpful and very kind. The housekeeping was always thorough and fast.   The amenities were great. The pool was always the right temp and not over run with people. My 18 month old loved the kiddie pool.   The room was simple layout. Kitchen was well stocked. The grounds were very well kept.  Location was great. Very central to SoCal attractions. Freeways were easy access.    If there was any complaint it would be that there was hardly any water pressure and the ac air didn't really reach the bedroom. The kids room was nice and cold. The master bedroom got hot if we didn't keep the ac running at night.

This is an older hotel but it has a close location near both Disney and California Adventure. It was a short two minute walk to the bus stop and the bus took you straight to the main entrance. It's a cute little resort with personality. The resort is safe and locked at all times.

We stayed here for 3 days (my family stayed the whole week) as part of a trip to do the Disneyland 1/2 marathon.  There were some issues with booking the place - some mixup with the reservation, but once that was ironed out everything else went very smoothly.  The place was clean and the beds were comfortable.  As other review have mentioned, a big downside is that it only has one air conditioner and it is in the living room.  You can either sweat it out in the bedroom or freeze out the living room to make the bedrooms comfortable.    It came with a fully functional kitchen including dishes, silverware, stove, fridge, microwave, and coffee pot.  All worked well.  We didn't get to use the pool/hot tub but they looked nice and there were gas grills available if you wanted to cook

We just left Dolphins Cove after a week stay in a 1 bedroom unit. It is a little far to walk to the parks, but the ART bus stops are right around the corner. Take bus 1 to the park and then 3 home and get off at Doubletree. The landscaping was beautiful and there were gates to get on the property, but we still found a homeless man hanging out by our car one morning. The rooms were a decent size for a 1 bedroom unit, the only problem was that the AC unit is not central AC and the box is located in the living room so the bedroom got really hot at night unless you were to make the living area freezing. We stayed at the other Wyndham time share closer to the parks 2 years ago and definitely prefer the other Wyndham to this one, but we would stay at Dolphins Cove again.

I was actually very impressed with thus property, except for one big problem: the hot water pressure was basically non-existent.  We thankfully only stayed for one night, but good luck trying to use any sort of hot temperature if you're staying longer.  FYI, the issue was in both the bathroom and kitchen sinks as well.  However! On that note, our room came FULLY loaded. Fully stocked kitchen with a stove, microwave, and fridge.  There were plenty of basic cooking utensils as well as dinnerware.  There was a dining room and huge living room (& tv #1) leading to a balcony with furniture.  As soon as we walked in the room was freezing! But it being over 90 degrees outside, it felt amazing! The A/C is located in the living room and I did wake up to try to turn it down overnight and

Despite some negative reviews, we decided to give this property a try. We went through the timeshare, so our cost was super cheap. No elevators, and our room was on 2nd floor. However, the very sweet gal at the front desk offered to send someone to help with our bags (which we did not use). I was concerned after reading some of the reviews that the room would be dirty, moldy or noisy. The room was just fine! Yes, the carpet was worn in places, and yes, the decor was dated. That being said - it was sparkling clean, it was quiet, (we were out at the end away from the pool) the king sized bed was super comfy, and they had starter items well stocked and ready (including spices)! The couch was a pull out, which we never did try. I spent half a day just reading in the room, very

We stayed here for three nights (23rd to 26th July) and couldn't fault it.  The reception staff couldn't do enough for us; when we asked them to get us a taxi on a couple of occasions it arrived in an instant.  The room was extremely clean and exceptionally well equipped.  We had read previous reviews of dirty carpets but we didn't find this in our room; it was lovely!  In fact we had a takeaway in the room one night just so we could spend longer enjoying its faciiities rather than dining out.

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, clean well equipt rooms and prefect location for disney
Summary: We stayed for 1 night only and were disappointed to have to move on to another hotel as our room was lovely, we hardly spent any time there at all! The staff were very helpful and advised us how to purchase our disney shuttle tickets (on site) and how to get to the stop which is a few minutes walk away, the room, bathroom and kitchen were all very clean and the welcome package even included popcorn! All in all a great place to stay.

My family and I stayed at Dolphins Cove for 6 nights, leaving this morning 8 August 2014. There were four of us in a one bedroom unit.  There was a sofa bed in the lounge that the kids slept on (they are 6 and 7).  The resort, although a little aged, is extremely clean and the staff extremely helpful.  The staff advised me on two occasions to let them know if there were any issues with the resort and appeared genuinely happy to assist if there were any issues.  Check-in was nice and easy.  We got to our room and we were happy with how it was presented.  Kitchen was adequate with fairly new electric oven, microwave, dishwasher, cutlery and crockery.    The resort has a free laundry allowing us to wash our clothes during our stay which was very convenient.  The resort has free

Great place to stay . Not even a mile from Disneyland California .. We are going to universal studios this time. Fun to play putt putt golf. All free on site. Game night and pool. Just love to stay here..

I recently stayed at the resort & I don't know about everyone else but my room sucked. I had the 1 Bed, 1 Bath. Let's start off with the dining table, mine was tilted to the side so the surface was'nt even. The balcony door was particularly hard to open. I had to push several times because it was stuck. The bedroom design is horrible. THERE IS NO AC IN THE ROOM AND IT WAS PARTICALLY AN OVEN IN THE ROOM. EVEN THOUGH THERE WAS A FAN. The bathroom is very small and doesn't have enough room to move. The shower head is horrible also. The water couldn't wash my face without getting my hair wet. There weren't enough spouts for water to come out. Everything else was alright though.

Summary Heading: In need of serious cleaning, but ok
Summary: I first stayed at Dolphin's Cove in 2001 for a trip to Disneyland. We just returned from a 2nd trip there and again stayed at Dolphin's Cove in 2014.  I don't remember anything negative about it during our first visit, but this time I certainly do.  As other reviewers have said, the carpet is FILTHY.  And I mean filthy - to the point that you can see the black and stains on the carpet and our kids' feet were black after just a short amount of time in bare feet on this carpet.  Other areas of our 1 bedroom condo were acceptable as far as cleanliness (and I'm not overly picky), but the carpet was horrific. One reason could be that there are no vacuums in the units for guests to use - only those dumb little push brooms.  Our extended family all stayed here for this trip (we had 3

We stayed at the resort in a 2bed unit over summer.  The unit was well furnished, comfortable and easily accessible.  The resort is 1 building from the ART bus stop and an easy 5min commute to Disneyland.  The room was clean, management provided spices, basic start up items for the kitchen - that were all greatly appreciated. The pool was clean an well used.  We stayed in a unit over looking the pool - and although the pool was in use until 10pm it wasn't too loud and did not bother us (or our 2 young kids).  I would definately stay here again if we are in Anaheim - especially as the customer service we received there was amazing.  From check-in to check-out it was great and the staff was very helpful.  I would recommend this resort - I was a little worried based on some of the

We stayed here for a convention in Anaheim with my family in June 2014. Great location waking distances to the Convention Center and Disneyland. The hotel is very clean, spacious, with a balcony and a lot of green areas.  Also have everything you need in the kitchen a real kitchen kitchen. we strongly recommended.

Summary Heading: Great rest stop for the day.
Summary: Stayed here with my family for a week during Christmas 2013.  a much needed break from a very weird year.   2 Bedroom and 2 baths, spacious for a family of 6 people.  Loved the balcony which overlooked the courtyard and the small clubhouse with the pool was put to good use by our 2 Kids.  It had a great location, 5 min drive to Disneyland.   We had an unfortunate incident with one of the toilets which overflowed, but the service immediately responded to it and fixed it up at 10pm in the evening.  Considering that it was Christmas eve I was very happy with the effort the guy put in, who was really polite.   It also had a self service laundromat for the convenience of it's patrons, if your staying there awhile, this would be a cost saver.   I strongly recommend staying here

We booked a 2 BR 2 BA unit for a week and received confirmation. When we arrived we were told we could have a 2 BR 2BA for the first night but we would have to move to a 2BR 1 BA after the first night. Then we could move to a third unit which would be a 2 BR 2 BA. @ nights and 2 moves. Our other option would be to take the 2BR 1BA all week and not have to move. As upset as we were we decided to take it. We were told there was free Internet. Yeah right. We connected upon arrival and that lasted about an hour. I called guest services and was told everything was fine, it must be me. I called back and was told I needed to call ATT tech support because everything was fine. (FYI- the signal was strong but the router was not handing out addresses. Any 6th grader could have fixed this).

Summary Heading: Phenomenal Stay within two blocks Disneyland
Summary: Secure location!  Stayed in January for 7 days.  Great experience.  Can walk to bus/shuttle line from resort.  Denny's on corner.  Stayed in one room suite.  Daily service for towels and general amenities.  There are two beds in bedroom both at least full size with a pull out couch bed in living room area.  We had up to 4 people staying.  I slept on the couch.  Can request a pad for the couch.  We were within walking distance of the convention center.  We chose to drive to Disney and park there.  Parking still had to take tram to get near gates.  Just as easy to ride the shuttle buses.  Can buy transport tickets at resort near pool.  Guides are very visible in the parking area.  At least 4 washers and dryers.  If there is a problem with room, gets fixed very quickly.  Great

Pros:  Close proximity to Disneyland (the ART and Toy Story Parking lot are both easily accessible); Secure gated parking; family friendly resort; well kept grounds; friendly staff; adequate air conditioning; units have private decks/patios; nice pool area. Cons:  Some money and time need to be put into refurbishment of the units.  Our dishwasher didn't work, the lamps were broken, broken box spring, dingy curtains, carpets are in rough shape as previously noted in other reviews, etc.  In addition to maintenance, our unit could have used a thorough clean.   It's unlikely that we would choose this place again on a return trip to the area.  We like a two bedroom unit with kitchen, but felt this unit was a little too run down for us to really relax and be comfortable.

Friendly staff and large rooms with the comfort of home. Much improved from five years ago, and you get a bottle of sparkling apple cider when you check in. Free laundry is a plus, although the machines sometimes leave your clothes smelling like the dampness of the washing machine. Convenient location to the convention center and Disneyland.

Summary Heading: National Tattoo Convention and Disney vacation!
Summary: This is a time share apartment, so it's different than a hotel. There are always salespeople at time shares trying to sell you a unit, Dolphin's Cove asked us, we said we weren't interested and they were very respectful and didn't ask us again.
