We very much appreciated that. When we checking in, we got some cold and semi-rude treatment. We are heavily tattooed but we also paid to stay at the resort like everyone else. After we were checked in, the vibe changed and we were treated very well by the staff. Dolphin's Cove is centrally located to Disney, lots of places to eat and  there is a grocery store close by to stock up the kitchen.

Dolphin Cove was a beautiful place to stay for our family's Disneyland vacation. We loved the space of our suit, and the grounds were well kept and inviting.  The staff were very friendly and went out of their way to ensure that we were comfortable.  We will DEFINITELY stay again.

We wanted a hotel in LA for a night over summer while visiting colleges. Since, we are Worldmark owners, we looked for a resort in the LA region, and this was the only one available. It was more of an apartment complex than a resort. The service was still great and the room was actually quite big. It is a little outdated though. I wish I could have stayed there longer.

After reading some of the reviews I was worried about my choice of hotel for 2 families to stay,  but upon friendly check in, kids pack on arrival and amazing service of the staff, I was blown away. Our room was a triple and plenty of room for 7 people lots of towels. the staff were constantly cleaning the BBQs and pool area and were always helpful. The gardens were beautifully cared for and our over 3 night stay was perfect. The kitchen was well stocked, shame no kettle but I think that is a English habbit of wanting a kettle for a cup of tea!. Great stay thanks Dolphin Cove

Summary Heading: Nice place.  Needs a little updating.
Summary: We stayed in a one bedroom unit.  It had central airconditioning.  The carpet was in bad shape and the dishwasher didn't work but those were my only complaints.  The staff were wonderful and the rooms were clean.  Lots of towels and they left all of the things you would need for this type of stay.  The kitchen was stocked with nice dishes and pots/pans, measuring utensils and even a colander.We bought breakfast and snack foods to keep in the unit which was nice.  They had washer/dryers on the premises (not in the unit) but they were free to use.  Work out room was quite adequate with all the equipment one could use. They had grills available for use. Overall it was a very nice stay.

The Dolphin's Cove was a good value because we used our timeshare points.  We had a short walk just around the corner to catch the city bus. Look for the City of Anaheim bus ticket machine by the pool. We purchased 3 day bus passes and got a discount... Instead of $15.00 per person it was $12.00. They charge $5.00 per person per day.   The unit we were in had everything we needed. We stopped by the Ralph's nearby and picked up some healthy foods. Saved some money there! But, the carpets were nasty!

My first impressions upon check-in to the resort were not was favorable as I would have hoped. However, after the staffs amazing helpfulness with a personal medical issue that arose during my visit, all I can say is that I have found a permanent place to stay on my future trips to Anaheim!

We stayed here while visiting Disneyland.   We have previously stayed at the Disney Hotel and Grand Californian, and I have to admit that the convenience of those hotels is totally worth it; after along day at the happiest place on earth being able to walk to our room was awesome and the atmosphere fun; and in my opinion worth the expense if you can swing it.  That being said we stayed at Dolphin's Cove with family who are owners in this time share so the price was right! The unit was clean, but very basic and furniture lower end compared to the other Wyndham resorts we have stayed at (Tahoe and Colorado).  There are not washers/dryers in the room and the sleeper couch was not so comfy, but we were really too tired to notice much.   Also in other resorts all rooms had a TV, in

Summary Heading: OK- but old and run down
Summary: Good location (walking distance from Disney Land). Sign is hard to see- it is a blue light and I passed it the first time. No signs to state where to park or where to check in. Once checking in- that was good. Desk staff was very friendly.  Check in area had the smell of an economy motel.  Everything is locked (that is good for security, but really do not forget your key or you can't get into the stairwell or parking area or anything).  Unit was set up well, but carpet is old and dirty. Other than that the decor was OK. No washer or dryer in the units. I had a nice view of the pool, but it appeared that most had a view of the parking areas. Small and old balconies did not look pleasant to sit on.  The dishes were all there, everything worked. I felt safe in the unit. I was on

Summary Heading: Niece and Family First Trip to Calif
Summary: Just want to thank you for providing my niece and her family a very luxurious experience in your resort.  I have heard back that the staff and resort itself have been exceptional.  They are their presently and will be until  Sat. April 26th.  I would like to thank everyone  at the resort for making their first family trip one to remember.  Have a good day  \B. Henson

We came here in  October 2006. After returning again 8 years later, this April 2014,  it would seem there would have been updates... our unit, #122, was filthy, and apparently, not updated at all. The first day the carpet was soaking wet and smelly from who knows what. Overall, the carpet was disgustingly dirty. It made my daughter's feet black! (I would recommend tile/laminate)... I made my children wear socks while inside. Thank goodness we spent the majority of our time outside the unit. I get that location is a key factor... but cleanliness should be mandatory. There was cotton candy remnants left behind in the fake tree of the living room. The laundry was a joke. 6 washers and 6 dryers to service the whole resort??? I was one of several unhappy folk to happen upon this

Me and my family stayed at the dolphin Cove resort for two nights and when we got there we were asked if a Blu-ray movie was in the room from the previous family that was staying there and it wasn't. They said they knew for sure that it was in there because the room had a Blu-ray player in it and they asked housekeeping and were told they didn't have it.  THEN when we left I realized I left my laptop under the bed just in case housekeeping came in when we were out but when I realized I forgot to grab it I called front desk and was transferred to housekeeping to leave a message. I left a distressed message explaining that I need it for work and has thousands of pictures and documents that weren't backed up and I offered a reward for any information and to call me back asap in the

Summary Heading: Bad Experience and we didn't even make it to stay at this "resort"
Summary: So I have a group of 6 four adults and two kids going to Anaheim for a family Vacation in Aug. We saw the dolphin cove resort online looked through the pictures and everything thought it looked like a nice place and it was a wyndham property so we thought perfect. We booked the two bedroom suite and came to find that they took the FULL amount. We have never had this happen while booking a room anywhere even at other wyndham properties. So I started to look into this resort some more and found some recent reviews and was completely turned off by these reviews. So we decided that we would cancel get our money back and book elsewhere. We called to see when the funds would be returned.... 10 DAYS!!! are you kidding me?? Not only did they take the full amount for a 2 bedroom suite

This was our third stay at Dolphin's cove in about five years.  We are timeshare owners elsewhere and sometimes trade in to get such a great location close to Disneyland.  In three stays, we have had a nice experience each time.  The beds are comfortable, the units are clean, and the kitchens have all the needed amenities to save money on food.  The interior courtyard is quiet and pretty, and we could not hear any sound bleeding through from other units.  It's not a fancy place, by any means, so if you plan on spending tons of time at the resort, this might not be the place for you.  But then again, why would you be spending tons of time in your resort half a mile from the Happiest Place on Earth?  Positive experiences all around.  I definitely recommend for other families.

Summary Heading: A Nightmare Vacation at Dolphins Cove Resort!
Summary: Shame on you Dolphin's Cove!  This resort is NOT run properly and I would not even think to call it a resort because it was lacking in so many ways. This resort is not up to Wyndham standards. As a Wyndham timeshare owner, we were expecting much better - were very, very disappointed!  Think motel or apartments with an outdoor courtyard and very limited amenities. Nothing fancy, nothing special - staff has a carefree attitude. Our families Special occasion stay - not so special. :(     I plan many of my families vacations and I really wanted to like it here - I really, really did.  I read the tripadvisor reviews before coming, and looked at pictures too.  The courtyard looked pretty, rooms seemed updated and nice, they had a fitness room, pool, 2 hot tubs and the location was

Summary Heading: Perfect for location for families close to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed a week and the room was nice and large.  We had 4 teenagers with us.  The pool was nice and never crowded- though the hot tub was a little small  We didn't do the time share welcome breakfast. The last thing we wanted to do was waste a morning on out vacation, and we didn't bother answering the phone calls to our room.  The worst part about the stay was having to pay for extra coffee, and there was no clean towels provided. I suggest if you stay to bring your own & wash them Laundry was open all night and it was free, but you need to bring your own soap & fabric softener.  The kitchen was stocked with everything we needed to cook with, but the dishwasher was terrible, loud and didn't clean the dishes properly so we had to wash the dishes by hand. And the air

Summary Heading: Comfortable once you get past the exterior.
Summary: Not much to look at from the outside, and a bit difficult to get into with its odd gate and parking setup, but once you get settled in there are many pluses that make this a good base if you are heading to Disneyland.  The rooms are spacious and well furnished, though the beds were just average and our bathtub/toilet area was a little cramped. Good kitchens if you plan to eat in. Also, any rooms with a balcony facing north have an excellent view of Disneyland fireworks. The interior courtyard area was inviting and the outdoor heated pool was perfect for our two young children. The indoor common areas were also well adorned, and there are some planned activities if you want to take a break from The Mouse. The guest laundry was convenient and accessible, which is good if you are
Manager Response: Thank you for this great feedback  Norman. This will allow us to continue to enhance the vacation experience at our resort. We are looking forward to an in unit refurbishment in early 2015. This will help with the carpet challenges we have at the Resort. You are correct we do not have any elevators for the 2 story buildings but are happy to assist any guest with luggage up the stairs.  Please let us know if there are opportunities to make your stay better in the future.

Summary: Before our stay, I saw that Dolphin's Cove didn't always get the best reviews; I didn't have high expectations. I was excited to have a 3 bedroom apartment close to Disneyland. When we arrived, I was pleasantly surprised that Dolphin's cove had some nice features. The pool area was comfortable; I loved the lounge chairs with head rests. My kids swam in February and others were swimming, not just us from the Northwest cold, so the pool was heated enough to be comfortable. There were lots of trees and vegetation to make the place feel resort-like and less apartment-like. You cannot see any cars from the pool area which is nice.  The Space was decent and suited our needs to be comfortable as we rested between going back and forth between the parks. We did have to drive to Disney

Dec I booked a cancalable1bedroom suite, breakfast included at the Dolphin Cove Resort (Wyndham) funds were removed Dec shortly after purchase. Heading to Disneyland my wife, 2 1/2  daughter and I stayed 22-25 Jan14. Excited, became very disappointed quickly. Entrance could only be located when the desk clerk came to the street and showed us the way in. Check-in is a two part fiasco.  Wanted and took a $150.00 deposit.  Sent me to second desk for instructions who explained no breakfast unless you attend a 90 min presentation Denny's is next door were you catch the shuttle to Disneyland (not). The room was 60's - Suite was not cleaned in our four days, zero shower pressure (ever after they fixed it) and had no safe.  As far as I am concerned they lied to us from the onset and was
Manager Response: Hi Ron,  Thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback. Please be advised a credit card security deposit is required upon check-in. This is returned back to your credit card upon check-out if no incidentals are charged. We are sorry to hear you were unsatisfied with the room and resort accommodations. Our goal is to make each guest feel at home by providing kitchen and laundry accommodations. Because we have condo-style resorts, certain hotel amenities such as daily housekeeping do not exist. We strive to provide this information to the guest through our website, pre-arrival letter and confirmation letter. We apologize for any confusion and will work to better communicate this through additional channels in the future.  We apologize for any inconvenience experienced. We value your feedback as this helps us to improve in many ways.

Summary: I travel to Disneyland often, generally with the same group I was with on this trip.  My cousin has a timeshare, when we can, we use it.  That was the case this time.  There were 5 of us in our party, all adults, we had a two bedroom unit, it was perfect for us. One of the bathrooms has a very large closet, it was easy to keep one couples luggage in it.     The grounds are nice, the units appear apartment like rather than hotel like.  There was plenty of parking.  The grounds and units were all clean.  The service at the front desk was good.  We felt there was a little lacking in the housekeeping schedule.  I don't believe we ever got replacement towels.  We had to ask for more at the front desk during our stay.  We were there Sa - Fri.  Really, we felt that was minor.    One

As a time share holder our apartment was great. Upon arrival we were given as bkd a one bedroom. Although very nice a 2 bedroom was preferred and not available when I initially booked. This was changed at a small cost to a perfect 2 bedroom. Very spotless, clean towels every second day, full kitchen, sml balcony , close to bus stops etc. fabulous helpful tour desk which we used often. Reception staff could not have been more helpful in fact best of all time share sites we have stayed. Maintenance on grounds and pool 100'/. We were so impressed with this resort and will recommend to friends here in Aystralia. Thankyou to Dolphin Cove for making our stay in LA fantastic.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback. We are glad you were able to be moved to a larger unit, as it seems this was more accommodating for your vacation. We appreciate your kind words regarding our staff and property grounds. Again, thanks for reaching out and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: We have a group of 6 and we have booked a 3-bedroom apartment.  Both rooms are comfortable.  There are two toilets that are good for 6 of us.  The kitchen is well equipped to allow us to do cooking every night (we stayed there for 5 nights).  The sitting room is spacious enough for us to spend our leisure together.  There is also a balcony and we can enjoy sunlight when having lunch there.  We are all satisfied with the living environment.  The staff is very polite and helpful.  One comment is that there is no lift service and we need to take our heavy luggage to the second floor.  Nevertheless, we can manage with this small problem.

We stayed with a time share, so I dont know if the accommodations are the same if you do not stay with a timeshare. But anyway, I would start here again based on my experiences at other hotels. The staff is friendly. The pool is good and the breakfast is ok. But The rooms are good size clean and having a kitchen is so worth it! The walk is not as close as I'd hoped to the Disney parks but its still doable. I personally enjoy the morning speed walk and the night time stroll back. This place is great for families. Having a washer available is also really nice.

We were very hesitant to stay at Dolphin's Cove based on other reviews.  We have never stayed off property when traveling to Disneyland and were ready to cancel our reservation even up to the last day because of our concerns.  We actually would have done it even though we would have lost money, had the Disney properties not sold out before we could pull the trigger.  We should not have worried!   Dolphin's Cove was perfect for us.  Plenty of room to spread out (we had a two bedroom), very comfortable beds, heated pool, small cafe and clubhouse, etc.  With the crowds and chaos of Disneyland, it was wonderful to come back and relax in something other than a small room with a couple of beds and a bathroom.  We had all of the comforts of home.  I read other  reviews that asked "how
Manager Response: Hi Joanne,  Thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback. We appreciate your kind words and will share them with our staff. We are so glad you enjoyed the unit space and accommodations. Our goal is to make each guest feel at home while on vacation. We look forward to your next visit. Happy Holidays.

Summary: We were only here for a very short one night stay to use it as a place to relax and rest before/after visiting Disneyland.  The front office staff were very friendly and helpful.  Much more so than most places I've stayed in the Anaheim area.    We had a very small one bedroom.  I appreciate the little things they do, like stock kitchen with small spices and hot cocoa.    The only think I didn't like is that the heater/airconditioner is just a box in the living room.  It was unusually cold during our visit and it wasn't easy to heat the entire unit.  In fact, you can pretty much forget about heating the bathroom at all.  Dollar wise, though, you get a lot here for very little $.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback. We appreciate your kind words and will share them with our staff. It’s so good to hear you enjoyed the stocked kitchen and unit amenities. We apologize that you were uncomfortable due to the cold temperate of the unit. We will be sure to look into this matter to ensure all our guests are fully enjoying their stay. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: This was our first stay here, and we were extremely pleased.  The place was very cozy and a perfect size for us (2 adults and 1 young child) and quite reasonably priced.  Having a kitchenette/dining area and complimentary laundry was definitely a plus, and added to our relaxation and comfort.  The pool, laundry and commons areas were always clean and in good condition.  We took advantage of a few of the resort activities for kids, which were fun.  The entire staff was always friendly and helpful.  We had one very minor housekeeping problem that was resolved quickly and pleasantly.  Not only would I stay here again with my family, I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a comfy place to stay with young children.

We didn't know what expect from these condos. We had read some questionable reviews (although the minority), we were very pleasantly surprised at all the amenities and necessary daily needs provided. Additionally, the pool, jacuzzi, putting green and laundry facility were very clean and nice. The 24 hour staff was also very friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay here again.

We have stayed at Dolphin's Cove a number of times in the past few years. It is our favorite place to stay when we visit Orange County.We love that they have a full sized kitchen, spacious bathroom, our own private patio and we always enjoy coming back. The staff is very friendly, it is family oriented and we would highly recommend staying here.

I stayed at the Dolphin's Cove for a week. When we checked in, we were offer goodie bags and popcorn. They have a big pool which we went everyday and had a bbq. The room is pretty big, kitchen was nice and bedroom was amazing. Everything was simple and good, no problem at all.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback. We are glad you enjoyed your unit and the resort pool. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: The resort is good. A nice heated pool but rarely cleaned so quite a few leaves and bugs are floating. The rooms are clean and functional but the grounds are dark because of the trees etc. It needs a fairly big makeover. However I would certainly return. Whilst not our need it is very close to Disneyland. Overall I'd give it 3.5 stars.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing this great feedback. We are so glad you enjoyed your overall stay. We appreciate your feedback regarding the grounds of the property. We are always looking for ways to improve and your feedback will help us to do so. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Dolphin's Cove in Anaheim has a GREAT location. It's convenient, near Disney. We stay in the first floor near parking. They gave us a handicap room. I don't know why. But it turns really nice after all. They have free breakfast on Tuesdays and breakfast pancake for 5 dollars on Sunday. I will go back!!
Manager Response: Hi Norma,  Thank you for providing such great feedback. We are so glad to hear you enjoyed the resort accommodations and location. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: Close to Disney and room has a lot of utilities!
Summary: We travelled as a couple and found the drive from LAX was about 1 hour. It is situated just off the highway and very close to Disney parks (walking distance.)  Eating wise there's Chinese food, American diners and fast food and a Walmart near for groceries. We had planet of options.   The room and service was great. We didn't use faculties outside the room but the bed was medium in firmness and the kitchen had all the utilities you would require (including dish washer.)  Finally, weather in early October was lovely and there were no problems with the area or finding anything in local proximity or slightly further afield.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing such great feedback and tips regarding activities in the area. We are so glad to hear you enjoyed the resort accommodations and location. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: Will Stay Here Again If Ever I'm Back In Anaheim!
Summary: First, I will admit that I don't have any clue how much Dolphin's Cove charges because I stayed with my sister and this was her timeshare.  However, I will most definitely contact this resort if I ever stay in Anaheim again!  We had a one bedroom apartment that was roomy enough for the three of us.  It was a bit dated in décor but was clean and well maintained.  The full sized kitchen allowed us to eat several meals in the unit rather than eating out constantly.  Fresh towels were abundant, as were lotions, shampoos, soap, etc - no need to purchase/bring these items.  The resort has a lovely garden feel to it; we sat outside and felt like we were in a secluded area with plants and palm trees and an adorable red brick walkway as our view.  The resort has a ton of free and low

We stayed here in Mid September 2013 and we went with mixed feelings after reading the reviews on trip advisor.  We went via a timeshare exchange and our unit was spotless.  Don't know which unit previous reviewers had been given but our carpet was brand new and not a threadbare spot or stain to be seen!  Yes the resort has a communal laundry but this was very well used and didn't seem to be a problem to other families using it.  Our experience was great, the staff were super helpful and even shipped a toiletry bag to us in Vegas that my husband had left at Dolphins Cove by mistake.  Please go here with an open mind because we had a nice surprise when we arrived.

Summary Heading: Great Rooms That Could Use An Update
Summary: Our family shares a timeshare membership and has access to this resort and the Worldmark Anaheim. The Worldmark Anaheim is newer, and it shows in the design, decor, and conditions of the furniture/unit. Dolphin's Cove is what you'd expect from a timeshare, except that it lacks in-unit laundry that most other timeshares include. The furniture and appliances are in good condition and the bedding seems new, however, the carpet in the various units we've stayed in was thread-bare in some places and not very clean. It's weird that there is a window-mounted air-conditioning in the living room but not the main bedroom, but using the fans we were able to keep the unit relatively cool without having to run the cooler non-stop. Not having elevators is an issue as well, as we often travel

Great place to stay . not far from Disneyland . you can walk or take the shuttle . There pool is great . Bbq to use also the laundry is room is great for doing your wash . Best of all the management is customer friendly .

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with kids and great location close to Disneyland
Summary: Like others we had read the mixed reviews of this resort however we need not have worried. Yes the resort from the outside looks a bit tired but there is obviously a big  refurb in progress. The staff couldn't do enough to check that things were ok and hat our stay was enjoyable. Great location very close to Disneyland -a great family base. We travelled with kids aged 10, 8 and 4 years. On arrival we found we only had 2 small single beds in the kids room when our 4 year old needed a bed too, rather than us having to use the sofa bed in the lounge we called the front desk and within 15 mins another single bed arrived.  Would definitely stay here again without hesitation . The staff try really hard to please and there is a kids activity schedule with loads to do for the children.

Summary Heading: Great stay! Hope to come again someday
Summary: After the very mixed and somewhat scary reviews I had read on here about Dolphin's Cove, it was with a bit of trepidation that we arrived and checked in. However, we were using a family member's time share which was saving us quite a bit of money, and honestly I was happy with just a place to sleep at night and hoped it was relatively clean. But I needn't have worried - we had a great stay. The room was clean, modern, and well furnished. The only thing I could nit pick about is that the carpet had a couple of rips in it, but it was clean - no nasty dirty carpet like I read about on here. I did see what may have been a bit of mold in the bathroom, but wasn't a big deal to me. Nothing nasty and gross like others described. And of course having a kitchen was really helpful to help

I do my homework and  always  read reviews when planning vacations, which is what I live for.I love to take my four  grandkids to kid friendly places. In July 2012 we stayed at Dolphins Cove to be close to Disneyland and Knotts berry farm. We had a  amazing time for a week.  And again this July we stayed  at Dolphin's cove,  the staff was great, they called to see if everything was o.k. with the room, called to see that we received the roll away bed, very helpful and friendly.The condo is spacious and clean, with  a full kitchen.All of us loved the heated pool. I am  the type that will check the internet for price and value and that's why we will be back again  Cindy B.

Summary Heading: Poor Customer Service, Good Value for Size of Condo
Summary: We planned a very special trip to Disneyland with our family of eight, six children, my husband and myself.  This was four of our children's first Disneyland trip and the older two hadn't been in eleven years.  As a large family we needed an appropriate place to stay with a kitchen where I could cook some of our food, a hotel room wouldn't cut it and two hotel rooms would not only be very expensive but still wouldn't have a full kitchen.  My bad experience with Dolphin Cove started the morning we were leaving home to drive there.  I called to ask the staff if they offered any special services as it was my husband's birthday and wanted to have a little surprise waiting for him in the room, which I was happy to pay for.  They didn't offer that, which was fine, but my problem was

Staff is professional and very friendly. This is well worth the price! At 7am there were kids running the halls and screaming. The front desk took care of it right away and were very kind. Internet was slow and not very usable. I can complain at all they met and exceeded every part of our visit! Thank you for making part of our honeymoon so wonderful!

We have a family of 6 and stayed here comfortably. The bedroom had a king size bed and living room had a hide-a-bed. The pool and hot tub were clean and not very many people were using them. It was close to Disney. We would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay with lot's of space.
Summary: This is a nice place to stay, I would recommend asking for a room facing the pool or garden otherwise you face the parking lot. The front desk was nice and always helpful. Pool was clean. My only complaints were that bathroom gets pretty musty and hot and the AC is in the living area so you don't have any in the master bedroom, to me the size of the room and having a full kitchen made up for it.

Summary Heading: Should be called the moldy Dolphine
Summary: My very sweet parents got us a room here for a girls trip to Disney. Beyond excited we hopped on our plane to our 4 days with Mickey!!!  Upon arrival we were less than impressed. The mini mart was across the street with bars on the windows.... The resort is located on the wrong edge of the "safe" Disney bubble. We were told the resort offered a shuttle, but be aware it is the ART bus, and one block over... The resort host was nice, but wanted to chat way longer than we did. They held our bags for us while we dashed to Disney, but when we arrived to go to our room the door to where our bags were was wide open. In fact my friend went & grabbed them they never checked our tags to be sure they were in fact ours. That did not feel like they were safely stored. Shrugging it off we

traded our Vegas timeshare to take our 12yr old grandson to Disney May 2013. after reading some negative reviews we almost canceled, glad we didn't, the resort is well maintained, our unit had everything we needed, everything was in working order, close to restaurants and Disney. The only suggestion I would have is to replace the carpets which are hard to keep clean with laminate hardwood or tile.   The shuttle to Disney stops around the corner from the resort, it costs $5 per person, which for us was $15, parking at Disney is $15 and has shuttles running every 5 minutes to and from the park whereas the public shuttle runs every 20 minutes therefore we found that parking at Disney was better.  Wyndham has a new high rise resort a few blocks from this one, you're given a free

My parents are timeshare holders and we have stayed in a lot of resorts, this was not one the best. We arrived at 4pm, our room was not ready we had to wait over an hour to check in. The TV in the room did not have good receiption however the day we departed April 26th they were changing all the TV's. There is only one pool and one shared laundry, each time I went to use the laundry I found machines broken. Our plumbing was blocked I rang on the first morning, went out all day to find no-one had come to fix it so by the next morning the toilet was blocked too. They did come to unblock everything that day. It is a secure site with auto gates that you need a swipe card to enter which is good but could use some updating. some of the furniture had stains and the curtains were

Summary Heading: Decent hotel close to Disneyland, kids enjoyed
Summary: I am a Wyndham timeshare owner and after reading reviews online I was a bit skeptical because I have become used to a certain level of resort from Wyndham.  We just got back from our trip and overall I would have to say the resort was pretty good.  It definitely is not like any other Wyndham we have stayed in, but it really looks like they are trying to improve this resort.  It is a gated resort, which is nice.  The staff there is extremely friendly and helpful (they even called us prior to our arrival to see if there was anything we needed or if there was a specific place on the resort we wanted to stay.)  We actually ended up arriving early 2:30 pm and they were able to give us our room key (we had told them we were coming in early and they said they would try and have our

Summary Heading: Great place for family, close to Disneyland Free Shuttle
Summary: We were overall happy with this resort, the rooms, the grounds, and the staff.  It was very quiet at night, it was secure, and the grounds were beautiful.  They had kids activities daily while we were there and the pool and hot tub are great!  The parking lot for the free shuttle was a few blocks away, so we would walk there each day to shuttle off to disney for free.  The only complaint I have is the carpets in the rooms (well at least ours) could use replacing.  We also had an issue with the toilet running every so often, and they came to fix it twice to no avail.  So we just turned it off at night so it didn't keep us up.  Also, the rooms are a bit musty, probably due to the fact that the bathroom has no fan in it, but they provided several floor fans probably for this issue,

I am a Wyndham timeshare owner and I usually love the resorts we stay in but there were a few problems so I can only give it 3 stars.  Check in is at 4 but we arrived a little early so our room was not ready, no big deal.  We then waited until about 4:45 when we finally received our key so we were a little frustrated.  The staff felt bad so they gave us a free bottle of Martinelli's sparkling cider so still, not a big deal.  We finally get to our room and the door is open, the person cleaning it had just finished and said the only thing we didn't have in the room was small wash clothes and he would bring them up right away.  Still no big deal since the room smelled clean and you can tell the carpets had been recently steamed.  I had to use the bathroom really bad, but when I

It was clean, my kids had a fantastic time. Staff was very friendly.  Great game room, snack bar, and pool area. Fun activities scheduled each day. Close to Disneyland. This is a perfect place for a family!

We have stayed in nicer places but this one worked for us. The staff was nice. The rooms were decent. The only complaint I had was the dirty carpet. I would not let my child play on the carpet without laying a blanket down first. They should really replace it. Definitely need slippers to walk around in your room. Other than that, the rooms were spacious and parking was not a problem at all. Staff was very responsive. I would not mind staying there again.

We stayed here for a couple of nights before a cruise. It is an older, apartment style complex. Our 1 bedroom was toward the back and quiet, even though our neighbors had children. It was clean and very comfortable. We would stay here again.

Dolphin' s Cove Resort is a quaint urban resort with excellent amenities, but that aside, the main reason for stay here is Disneyland.  Staff helpful and friendly.  We're in our 70's and the parks are within walking distance.  Convenient to assortment of restaurants but amenities include full kitchen facilities and groceries are available within half a mile.  Trolley transportation to area sights available at marginal cost.  An older multi-use resort within the Wyndham/WorldMark Vacation Resort Properties.  Rentals available as well as timeshare.  Enjoyed our stay.

This property is far from resembling any kind of resort. There was no amenities that are offer by a resort and was disappointed by what little was offered. Unlike the other up-scaled hotels near this property no transportation was offered. I will never be stepping foot on this property  again and I will definitely tell my friends and family not use this property either. No restaurant, room services or any other simple amenities.

One of the best priced timeshares within walking distance to Disneyland. Checking was very simple. It took all of 5 minutes. A bonus is the property is gated and controlled with your room key. The 1 bedrom deluxe was very clean. It had a full kitchen with a compliment of dishes, cookware, and utensils for 6 people. Seperate towels were available for the pool area, so you didnt have to worry about using your bath towels. The king size bed was very comfortable, but the hide a bed was worn and well used. Our 8 yr old son woke up every morning saying how uncomfortable it was. We stayed  6 nights during spring break. The property was very quiet at all times. Also a great bonus is FREE washer and dryers. There are 6 washers and 6 dryers for everyone to use. The downside to that was 3

This resort is the worst Wyndham I have ever visited.  It is dated,the smell of chlorine tried to cover the smell of mold. The carpet is definitely old and looks dirty.  It does not feel like a Wyndham.  The kitchen is small and dated. The furnace /air conditioning was noisy and blowing off white dust . I do like that the staff called me ahead to find out what view and floor  I want.  I also like that it is walking distance to Disneyland and the private card key parking at the resort felt safer.

This is a very family oriented hotel. They have 1-3 bedroom suites equipped with a full kitchen. there is activities for the kids and is very close to restaurants. there is also a shuttle you can pay to go to disneyland which is two blocks from the complex. it is very clean and a reasonable place to stay. discount tickets can also be purchased here for Disneyland

Booked a week stay 8 months ahead of time and prepaid the whole thing ( $1340). They charged my credit card right away. 2 days before we were due to arrive they called to say they didn't have a room for us and we switching us to a different hotel. We only booked with criminal Wyndham because our friends were staying there on a timeshare. Now we were no longer together. They did not offer any sort of compensation. At least the airlines offer a free flight.

Summary Heading: Disappointed! Close to Disneyland but aging property.
Summary: We are Wyndham timeshare owners and we were not happy with our stay at this place (resort?!). This was our first time at Dolphin's Cove Resort and probably the last. Wyndham should renovate this property since the location is good.   THE GOOD Location! Close to Disney... we parked at the Toy Story Parking Lot and it is a minute away from  Dolphin's Cove. Friendly staff.   THE BAD Aging property. The carpet was very dirty.  The furniture was outdated and old.  Doesn't have a resort feel. More like a cheap motel.  The carpets! So dirty we wouldn't take shoes off. No elevators!

Summary Heading: good place to sleep. well maintained but aging property.
Summary: My family used two one bedroom units for our one-week trip to Disneyland over Christmas. It was clean and quiet and I enjoyed having a living room, deck, kitchen and bedroom. the laundry facilities are not located inside the units, there is a community laundry room. it's free but was often very busy with only 6 washers and 6 dryers. the pool and hot tub were clean, warm and well maintained. My only real gripe was that the pool closed at 10 pm. after a long day at Disney, the beach or Sea World it would have been great to have the hot tub open till midnight.  If you're an owner looking for a fancy, luxurious getaway this is not the place for you. if you're looking for a good clean place with gated parking in walking distance of Disney, this is a good place. we saved a ton of

To use up year end points, I recently stayed at Dolphin's Cove in Anaheim, CA. The resort was LESS than standard. Painting was going on in the lobby and check in was very discombobulated. I had to literally walk thru and under ladders, around paint rollers, etc. to register and receive my condo keys. After carrying my luggage up 14 steps to reach the unit (no elevators) I found the unit to be less than standard. The master bedroom closet doors were unable to open because they were broken and off the track and beyond filthy. I discovered black mold under the sink cabinet when searching for dishwashing soap. The carpets were beyond filthy. They were nasty and sticky all thru out the unit. I had to wear shoes when getting out of bed to use the bathroom during the night they were

Summary Heading: Not Super Elegant but still very enjoyable
Summary: We stayed here the first week of December. We were easily able to walk to the Toy Story parking lot and take the *free* Disney shuttle; thus, no parking fees.   We arrived at check-in early (11:30 AM) but Bobby at the front desk greeted us with a huge smile and said that he would be happy to get us checked in.  He was so nice and really is a wonderful representation of Dolphin's Cove.  Our condo was super clean (carpets were actually still damp from being steam cleaned!) and we LOVED having tons of TV channels to watch (just like at home with premium cable).    Bathroom is very spacious with an oversized vanity/countertop area.    A/C was not an issue during our stay since it was winter and actually cold and rainy, but I would imagine that during a hot So.Cal summer; only having

We stayed here in week 3 of a 4 week holiday. With free wifi in the room and with a free laundry with washing machines and dryers this is a great stop on the holiday. So close to Anaheim, we walked there and back (30mins), therefore saved the $15 on parking. We exchanged a week through RCI so made it even better. A gymnasium and spa, plus special welcome breakfasts and events. Will come again if we are in this area.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here for one week on an RCI exchange.  We had a three bedroom unit that slept 8 and we had 7 in our group that included 2 children.  First of all, it is true that the rooms are dated but every tv and all the appliances worked fine-- the carpet should be replaced but was very clean.  The kids loved the pool and ping pong during the down timed from visiting Disney.  We waked one day to Disneyland and it took about 15 minutes.  You can ride the city bus or ART bus just around the corner.  We walked to the toy story parking lot that is about a 7 minute walk and road in on the Disney shuttle a few times.  The front desk was great--we ran low of Kleenex and Tp and I asked the desk for more and it was delivered by housekeeping a few minutes later with no additional

traveled with family  5 in total  4 girls and myself    and only 1 bathroom   ouch lol . got there on time,,  room was not ready ..  thats ok we were  early ?   stored our luggage , and went off to see a time share  do not got to this as they do not want to take no for answer,  went back to the cove  and saw our room it wasnt bad big clean  nice kitchen , pool area was very nice and the staff friendly  and helpful   the one problem was the one bathroom in the suite  we had asked for two and as the  resort was not close to being full  I didnt see a problem but .......

Summary Heading: WOULD RATHER STAY AT A MOTEL 6
Summary: If it had not been for other family staying here, we would have left right after trying to check-in.  Issues included delayed check-in until after 4:15pm, only warm water,  carpets so dirty  wouldn't take shoes off,  kitchen floor and cabinets dirty and sticky,  and cigarette smoke. Gross.  They cleaned the floor then next day cleaned all the carpets and they were so wet, they had blowers going all night then mildew smell.  They moved us to another unit which was tolerable but not much cleaner. This property is old, run down, and dirty, not well maintained. The Motel 6 is cleaner.

Summary Heading: The Good, The Bad and The . . .
Summary: We stayed here because our nephew used his timeshare here. We followed him because he invited us.   Okay, it's not ugly, but yes, these definitely had been apartments that were converted for vacation rentals. We probably had a better stay than most because I paid attention to the advise given: ask for a room in the back; THERE ARE NO ELEVATORS, so ask for first floor if you need to.   So we had a really quiet 1 bedroom ground floor in the back. I loved the quiet. I also loved the little patio in the back. There is space, in comparison to a regular hotel room. I loved that, too. You don't feel like you have to climb over everyone in the room. This is the Good.  Now the Bad. There are a couple of advisors that say that the Disney shuttle is RIGHT BEHIND the resort. Technically,

Summary Heading: NOTHING FANCY BUT A CLEAN AND CONVENIENT PLACE TO STAY
Summary: My wife and I recently traded our Wyndham timeshare points to stay at the Dolphin's Cove Resort.  When you first arrive you will think you are at an apartment complex because that is what the Dolphin's Cove is, an apartment complex that has been converted into a timeshare.  However, we found a very nice room and furnishings awaiting us and the conceirge staff were not pushy at all about going to a timeshare presentation.  (One "No" was all it took.)  The rooms have free wireless Internet and a kitchen as well.  (The Internet was slow so doing more than checking your e-mail or simple Internet searches is not recommended.)  The parking lot is gated and there is a security guard around at night so the location is pretty safe as well.  The only negative we experience had nothing to

I read other reviews before going and was not expecting what we got.  I don't know if we were staying at the same resort.  What I can say is that when rating any resort there is on factor that overide's everything.  Location, Location, Location. This is walking distance to Disneyland although we did drive.  Close to other grocery store, we walked there on arrival (around 10- 15 mins walk.)  Our room was clean crisp and well layed out.  We had 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms.  Air conditioning in the main living area  and in main bedroom and fans in the other bedrooms.  Resort was bigger than expected but not really large.  The pool and kids club also added an extra dimension to the timeshare stay.Complimentary  Continental breakfast was good to.  Nice Coffee at reception.  Staff were

Summary Heading: Love it so much, we bought one after the 3rd visit
Summary: I see a lot of comments on walking distance to Disneyland. Best kept secret is that dolphins cove backs up to one if disneys parking lots with a tram. So when we go, we walk around to the tram in the parking lot and take it for free. Even though we don't park there. The people at Disney Said they have no problem with that. Just come and enjoy and we do.  At DC, the beds are comfortable and we like the bar b q. We have a 2 bedroom, 1 bath. Sometimes, depending on who's going, only one bath can be a challenge, so we like to get a unit down the hall from the rec room. We then utilize the bathroom there as a second bath. That is a luxery, believe me. Works great. The grounds are beautiful and have a different look at different times of the year. Free coffee and laundry facilities.

Summary Heading: Too far to walk to Disneyland
Summary: We are Wyndham owners, so the decision to stay here was mostly based on using points instead of dollars. Dolphin's Cove is an older property and is showing its age a bit. There are traffic patterns in the carpet and the deck on our second floor unit was a little creaky, but overall, a nice experience. We have typically stayed at places where we were within walking distance to go to Disney parks, so this was our first experience driving there and using the Mickey and Friends parking garage. Our park passed included parking so we didn't have to shell out the $15 it costs to park there. Public transportation is available from Dolphin's Cove at a cost of $4. The A/C in the units is from through-wall units and are located only in master BR and living room. There are ceiling fans in

After reading the reviews here and on another site we expected what we saw: a 4.5 star resort.  What was arrived at was a 3.5 star gated hotel.  This was a trade for a week for our timeshare.  We had a one bedroom unit.  There was only a wall mounted a/c unit in a corner of the living room, so we had to keep all the fans on just to get the bedroom and bathroom cooled off at all.  One of us is handicapped and there is no elevator.  The pull out couch was almost impossible to sleep on.  The grounds were nicely kept within the buildings, but the parking lot was often dirty.  The rooms were very nice although all the closet space was in the bathroom to share leaving privacy an issue. These are not things we expect from a 4.5 star rating. They do have some crafty events but most of

Summary Heading: Plan carefully if you are going to stay here.
Summary: Be aware of a couple of points when staying at the Dolphin Cove Resort.  It is NOT close to Disneyland--you will either need to drive or take the bus, which costs $3-$4.  Only the master bedroom and living room has an air conditioning unit, but the other rooms have ceiling and floor fans.  You need to situate the floor fans in such a way to get the cool air directed to the other bedrooms.  This is very difficult as there are very few outlets in logical places for that.  I would suggest bringing one or two extension cords.   Other than those two items, this is a very nice place--older, with a few problems with dry rot on the upstairs decks, but quiet, a nice setting, and plenty of room.  The beds are hard for some people who do not like hard beds.  The twin beds in the 3rd

By far the dirtiest place I have been to.  We walked into the unit and I had a completely uneasy feeling about this place. Carpet was dingy and had a funky odor. The whole place was filthy. The kitchen floor had not been cleaned. The bedrooms were small. The bedspread was old and dirty. We walked in and immediately booked a hotel for the night. I couldn't get out of there fast enough!  I am not a person that needs a fancy place to stay either. I couldnt bear to have my children in that space..Dolphin's Cove was absolutely disgusting. I am amazed that this place is still in business!

We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit (#503) located on the ground floor at the rear of the 5 acre property 3/4 of a mile from Disneyland.  It was a great and quiet unit. The living room has a pull out queen sleep sofa for extra guests.The full kitchen was well stocked. The unit has a very nice outside patio. It did not have a washer/dryer but there were laundry facilities on the premises. The grounds are beautiful with palm trees, lawns, gas BBQ, pool, and spa. It was a very relaxing, park-like atmosphere. There is a small market/liquor store across the street and a Denny's restaurant next door.  Von's market and Target are approximately 1/2 mile from the resort.

We stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment for 7 nights. We had 4 adults and 4 kids aged 8-13. The resort allowed us to hire 2 trundle beds which allowed us to put our youngest child in the main room with us and the other 3 kids shared the twin room with a trundle bed in between the 2 beds, snug but it allowed us to keep the lounge as a lounge and let the adults stay up and chat. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. They fixed a few minor issues and brought extra towels after cleaning staff did not leave enough. I had read reviews prior to our stay but found the room to be clean and well set out. Slightly dated but great for families. We spent all our time during the days either at the parks or tours round LA and came home exhausted every night. We used the cooking facilities

We own Worldmark timeshare so my wife booked an over nighter after seeing an Angel game.  We arrived around 3:30pm on a Sunday afternoon and I could not believe how many families with children were there in the pool area.  This is after school has begun, but you'd have thought it was mid summer.  This place is laid out very much like an apartment complex.  We had a one bedroom on the second story, it was well laid out, our unit had a small balcony overlooking the parking area so not ideal.  If you can get a unit facing the courtyard you'll enjoy it more.  Also, the air conditioners are wall units and only one in the living area, so the cool air does not move into the bedroom, it was much warmer in that area.  I noticed they provide a fan in the closet to help with this problem,

I can't imagine how this place is still in business.  Even Motel 6 is better than the Dolphin's Cove Resort.  DO NOT STAY HERE!!    We checked in and when we walked into our 3 bedroom unit, it was hot and stuffy (there is no central A/C in any units)  We found bird feathers in the living room and hallway.  We finally figured out why - because there were birds nesting on top of the exterior part of the wall A/C unit.   There was bird droppings all over the A/C unit.  Imagine if the feathers could make it into the room then the odor and fumes from their urine/droppings did to.  We were disgusted.  We called the front desk and they sent maintenance.  Maintenance installed little spikes on top of the unit to keep the birds away, but they didn't bother cleaning the unit.  We

Summary Heading: Close to Disney yet away from the Hoopla
Summary: I recently stayed a week at Dolphin's Cove Resort from 7/21-7/28 & did a timeshare exchange through RCI.  We had a 1 BR for 2 adults & 2 children.  The room is not extremely roomy but we really didn't spend much time in our room.  I found the RCI exchange points very high for what you got & although part of Wyndham, not really up to the standards of other Wyndham resorts I stayed at.  The units were clean & newly remodeled.  It was close to Disney yet away from all the Disney hoopla.    Thanks to previous reviews, when we arrived & did pre-check in, we requested a 2nd floor with a courtyard view.  We had a quiet view to the court yard yet close to laundry & the pool.  They supply free laundrey which is a big plus.    If you do like to sit on your balcony & enjoy a glass of wine

Positive Things - nice room layout (we had 2 bedrooms), full kitchen (full refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher, garbage disposal, pots, pans, dishes, a few spices), 2 TVs with nice selection of cable channels, friendly staff, large pool that is heated perfectly, nice hot tub that water is added to each day to keep it full, snack bar at the pool where you can buy food, often there was free fruit out at the pool - bananas and apples as well as popcorn, nice patio outside with a table and chairs that we enjoyed using several times for meals and just relaxing in the evening, security gate and free parking, close to Toy Story lot (about 10-15 min walk ) and you can take the free tram to Disney from there.  Less than Positive Things - We were downstairs and could hear the people

Dolphin Cove is within walking distance of Disneyland/CA Adventure but luckily you also have the option of purchasing a shuttle pass for just a little more.  Rooms are clean and well furnished and if you like having the options to cook and grill then this is the place for you.  We found the pool and hot tub to be well maintained.  Fellow guests are fun and friendly.  Staff is friendly and helpful.

After reading so many negative reviews, we went into our vacation with pretty low expectations, but we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived! We stayed in a one bedroom on the second floor. It was clean and nicely decorated and gave us plenty of room for our family of four.  The air conditioning wall unit worked fine to cool down the entire room (living room, bedroom, kitchen), but I can imagine that perhaps in the 2 or 3 bedroom units, it may be a little warmer with just a wall a/c unit. The a/c was a little loud, so if you plan to watch TV while the a/c is running, you do have to turn up the TV volume quite a bit.  The kitchen was fully stocked with everything we needed. There is no laundry machines in the units, so you must use the laundry room on site which only had 3 of

We stayed in room 502.  The carpet was very dirty.  The bathroom was dirty.  The furniture was outdated and old.  My wife had to clean the bathroom and kitchen before we were comfortable to use both. Front desk staff in the morning was friendly.  Front desk evening staff had no clue.  Security was good.  Overall, don't waste you money.  We decided to have 1 good night in Anaheim, so on the last day of our 8 day vacation, we stayed at the Embassy Suites hotel.  Loved it!

We decided to go to disneyland 7/3/2012-7/7/2012. We booked this resort through our timeshare. What a HUGE mistake. We had a 1 bedroom and requested a 1 st floor room because we have a 2 year old.  I confirmed the same day by calling dolphin s cove directly. We I arrived they told me they only had a 2nd floor room available. I told him I had confirmed with them earlier. But he was vey rude and told me they were at capacity and no rooms available. I told him I wanted to speak to management and all of a sudden we have a room available. How strange!!  When we opened are room door the smell was awful (musty) smell.   Tub still had hairs, floors dirty, to top it off I went into the bedroom and you can barely squeeze through. The dresser pulls are super sharp and got stuck on my cargo

We stayed with 7 people (3 children under 3). It was very comfortable. We basically slept, hung out in AM, had breakfast and left. The complex seemed nice. They served coffee and doughnuts in lobby. We stayed in the second bedroom. It was big enough to fix a playpen, toddler cot and two twin beds. The bathroom was huge. The kitchen was fully stocked.

We read the mixed reviews and have to go on the side of disappointed in the unit. Expected to wait for room as we did arrive early. Was told room not ready for 3 hours. However if became ready as soon as the evening desk came on board. Rugs were wet and smelled. We knew the air conditioning was going to be poor and it was. Best way to cool the room was to leave both doors wide open and run the portable fan. Ice machine in the hallway did not work. No pool towels in the room and could not get any first on board. Took 3 days to get pool towels. The stove top burners in front did not work. Was fixed during the stay but after one use the burners stopped working again. Vons is very close over on Chapman, but too far to walk. Cab driver took the long way, he claimed he actually got

Upon arrival, I had dismiss the negative reveiws I had read prior to the trip.  My cousin and I brought our kids to California for a vacation/high school graduation. There were 6 of us and the children ranged in age from 2-13 years old.   We were greeted by Larry and Frank. They not only informed us of the whereabouts of the grocery store, pharmacy, and restauraunts, but also mapped out the directions for us to navigate the highways to visit family members that lived in California. The location was safe for us as well as our vehicle.  The walk to Disney was about 1 mile, if you want to take the shuttle you will need a shuttle pass. The room was clean and spacious.  We would stay again!!

The ONLY complaint we have is the wall air conditioning unit was noisy -- if we kept it on during the night, we would not have been able to get a good night's sleep.  Otherwise, the staff was very friendly and helpful -- Larry G. is THE BEST!  Great sense of humor and made sure all of our questions were answered.  If we needed anything, Larry took care of it quickly and with a SMILE -- we had 4 adults and 3 kids on this trip, and he made all of us feel like family.  The breakfast bar option was great and priced well.  We took the bus to Disneyland, and it was SO convenient.  We bought a 3 day (adult) pass at the resort for $10.00 -- it was very handy for us as the bus pass could be used all day, mulitple times, for those 3 days -- awesome bargain.  And the bus stop was a very

I  have been coming to this resort for many years. It is so much better than what it used to be. My only concern that I've had since the beginning is how clean and safe is this resort. I recently went here with my three children and mother. Upon arrival, I walked into the kitchen entry way and tripped over a carpet drier that had been left in the room by maintenance. I don't understand why it was still in the room when I arrived because it was ten o'clock at night. Once I broke my fall, I turned on the kitchen light and saw a puddle of water on the floor with sewing needles. This was absolutely absurd. I also noticed that one of the bedroom televisions were on, the bathroom sinks also looked like they had been recently used because they were wet. Also, thank goodness I didn't

We stayed for 7 nights in a 3 bedroom unit. We were in unit 605. We had 4 adults and 3 kids.  We loved the resort's family friendly feel.  We had groceries delivered from Von's on our arrival day. Although we did have a rental car and were able to make other trips.  We drove to the toy story parking lot, but also walked to the lot as well,and it is an easy walk. We all loved the swimming pool and multiple bbq's on site to use. They had several activities every day for the kids which was nice on the days we didn't go into the park. I would recommend this resort to anyone.

Summary Heading: Lower for Wyndham standards, but higher than other places
Summary: We liked that Disneyland was a short drive/bus ride away.  The staff was helpful, and the grounds were beautiful.  There was a Denny's right next door, and the Gardenwalk, which has several restaurants and shops, wasn't that far, either.  The rooms are very spacious, and the kitchen, although small, was well-stocked.  We said this was lower than Wyndham's standards because of all the Wyndham resorts we've stayed in, this was the lowest.  We knew there wasn't central a/c, but we didn't expect the wall a/c unit to NOT be in the master bedroom.  We used the provided floor fan to pull the cooler air from the living room so it'd blow into the bedroom at night.  There were just a few other little things (bathroom fans make a lot of noise but don't actually pull air out -- we did the

We had used our RCI account to stay here...was supposed to be a "fair trade" for our 5 star timeshare in Vail.  Didn't like the looks of the place out of the gates, but tried to make best of it.  The first morning there, I opened silverware drawer and saw the shadow of what looked like a large bug.  Turned on the light and was horrified to see a cockroach!!  They "sprayed" the area, but the next morning I saw one on the kitchen floor. Husband killed it, and brought it to Daniella at the front desk.  She offered to switch rooms, but we weren't sure if we really wanted to stay there at all anymore.  Before deciding what to do, I opened silverware drawer, and another one popped out!  We asked them to credit our stay, but they refused.  RCI put us in a different resort (another

A nicely gated and secluded resort just a few blocks south of Disneyland.  Our room was very nice and roomy.  It had a TV in both the bedroom any the living room. Very clean with all the comforts of home.

We spent two nights at this Wyndham Vacation Resorts property for a quick trip to Disneyland and California Adventure. The first day we walked from the resort to Disneyland because the ART (Anaheim Resort Transit)  bus we paid for never came. It wasn't a bad walk because the resort is close to the Disney parks. The 2-bedroom unit we had wasn't very nice though. We were on the second floor, right above the lobby. So all night long we heard the security gate slamming shut. There was only one air conditioner in the living room, the bedrooms had no air conditioning. It wasn't hot enough that we needed air conditioning, but we found the windows only opened 2 inches, so very little air could come in. This was terrible. They installed locks so the windows would not open farther. We

A place can make a first impression simply from the attitude of their front desk. And in this case The Dolphin Cove check in staff were extremely nice, pleasant and sincere - especially the young asian man who served us. We were worried we could not get in at first as our Mother was on a seperate carriage and she was arriving later.  Surprisingly this was no issue as we provided them with the right documentation and details and they were so happy to let my husband, father and I check in. Our condo was clean, spacious and comfortable. The kitchen was complete too, with a  fridge, microwave, oven/stove and kitchen utensils. The resort had a very family like environment and you could hear kids enjoying themselves in the pools, and the parents lazing around in the spa area. The

We spent a week here in April 2012 - grandparents, parents + 2 daughter ( 11 +14). The 2 bed condo was very spacious, clean + comfortable. The heated pool and large jacuzzi were popular with the girls - after a long day walking around Disney parks. Located just 1 mile from the parks it is a comfortable, flat walk. The staff very welcoming and helpful.  Just wish it wasn't all so far away from the UK !!!

Summary Heading: Great location, old and run down even with renovations, feels low quality and not resort like at all.
Summary: The rooms were spacious, appliances old the fridge had no ice maker. The closets in bathroom rusty. There were a few cockroaches in the room.. felt dirty.  old tv  in both rooms . Air units are loud. The grounds and pool were great as well as the porches attached to the roomsw would I stay here again ..no? Did we make the best of it yes. Friendly staff and safe area due to gates and security guard walking the place.

We were here for a week in a one bedroom. There are two stories to each building with no elevators, so beware. They have carts to help unload, but you still have to carry your stuff up the stairs. We were in building 3 which was close enough to the office, but far enough away that we didn't get the kid's noise from the pool. The resort has activities (mostly kid) every day, with several free breakfasts. The free wine & cheese party was quite nice. The place is kept up - they were painting and removing carpeting in the hallway on our last day. Getting to Disney is a snap with the ART just around the corner by the Travelodge. Or you can hoof it but we decided to save our walking for the park. It is about a 15-20 minute walk to the Garden Walk with plenty of places to eat in

I was hesitant to stay here because of some of the negative reviews. The place is older and could use some updating but the staff was very friendly and the room was clean for the age. I will not say it was perfect and it could have been cleaned better but for the price, the location and convenience, this place was awesome.  I have 3 small children and we all felt very safe.  The grounds are beautiful and I have to say that I would stay here again. I gave it a 4 instead of a 5 because it really could use a deep cleaning and some updating but I felt that it was clean enough to let my infant play on the floor and the linens and beds where comfortable.

Summary Heading: BEWARE:Thefts and Unaccountability-LOCK YOUR STUFF IN YOUR CAR!
Summary: Grounds were nice, units were spotless-absolutely NO problems with the location, it was perfect for us-One little problem though, as we were moving to a different room, my mother left her phone charging on the kitchen counter and forgot to grab it, we realized our mistake within 30 minutes.  However while we were transferring things from room to room a maid-tall, 40ish, hispanic, long dye blonde, wavy hair tied in a pony tail was watching us the entire time.  When we called the front desk to report the phone missing @ 11:07 someone was literally entering our prior room @ 11:08-Hmmmmm  what a coincidence-this according to their audit.  By the time they sent someone to check room again of course their was no cell phone.  And to add injury to insult the desk staff was very

My aunt and I stayed here for a week. I have to admit, I was a bit concerned when we first drove up. The place doesn't look like much on first glance. However, once you get past the gate and into the resort itself, it's very nice.  Our room was absolutely enormous. It had a kitchen with every utensil you could need, plenty of dishes, and a large fridge/freezer. This was very helpful in keeping travel costs down, as things get pretty spendy very quickly in California. We stopped at several stores in the area throughout our trip and bought groceries to keep on hand.  It's very close to Disneyland and right off the highway. They offer a shuttle to the amusement park, but we just drove.  The room was air conditioned and had a lovely balcony that overlooked the grounds. It is

We stayed 5 nights (3/29 to 4/3/2012) and had a really good stay overall.  Dolphin's Cove isn't quite the Wyndham Vacation Resorts standards, but they are in the process of many renovations to the older resort and doing some nice work.  We had a 2 bedroom unit that had 2 bathrooms and faced onto the main road by the resort - a little noisy from road traffic, but not too bad.  The room had a few very minor issues, but nothing too significant.  Did call maintenance on the dishwasher initially - had accumulated standing water in it - they quickly responded and had someone up that used a dishwasher cleaning kit on it and cleaned it spotlessly and good to go for the rest of our stay.  They had even said that if that did not take care of it, they would even replace the dishwasher

We stayed at Dolphins Cove for a week (March 10-17, 2012) and were extremely impressed at how clean everything was, especially after reading some of the reviews.  The place is dated but they are spending the money to fix it up.  Most of our furniture seemed to be quite new, and the appliances, and dishes in the kitchen were spotless. The laundry room was also very clean. We were close enough to walk to Disney, but chose to take the bus and save our feet for our days at the park. Staff was very friendly.

We chose Dolphins Cove because of it's location to the local attractions. (Especially Disneyland, shuttle right around the corner provides great almost door to door service)  We thought it was perfect.  Everything is very convenient.  The property itself is very nice.  Yes, it's an older property but they are doing some remodeling and maintenence to keep it a nice resort.  We had a 2 bedroom and were surprisingly impressed.  It was clean and had everything necessary for a nice stay.  The beds were comfortable.  We had a nice patio on the "greenbelt" and loved it.  The pools were nice, clean and warm.   The only problem i had was too many kids in the hot tub.  We arrived very early in the morning and i wanted to ask if we could park there for the day and take the shuttle to

Our room was next to the office.  In the middle of the night there was blaring music.  I call the office, and can hear the music is coming from the office!.  I ask if they can "investigate" so the music can be turned off.  The music goes off for 5 minutes, then back on again.  This happened three nights in a row!  The room was okay.  Nice kitchen but loud air conditioner.

We used a timeshare exchange to get 6 nights at Dolphin's Cove. (Seven is better - then could have skipped the $65 cleaning fee.) The resort looks fairly nice in front, fairly bad on the sides (just bare walls and car park area), but the interior grounds are a lush oasis of tropical plants bordering meandering paths, unit patios, and the pool area. We had a 1 BR, 1 bath unit which was suprisingly spacious. Kitchen rather small, but very adequate for 2 or 4; dining table seats 4; LR very large, and small patio with drink table and chairs off it - a lovely place for breakfast! BR fairly large, tho King bed made the dresser too close to the foot of the bed.  Great room-darkening drapes, plus filmy curtains inside that to give privacy when you wanted light.  One minor irritation: no

Summary Heading: Well MISrepresented resort. Old, cold decrepid buildings with just one dirty pool!! :(
Summary: This place is a joke. Its an ANT HAVEN!!! Yes, ants...those little small criiters that come from the strawberry fields across from it. Please be aware. Wyndham is very misleading with its resorts. Dolphins, my foot!! Only one dirty swimming in front and lousy old buildings. Plus, the front desk personnel are not very professional and always playing around. Again, you'll regret it if u stay here. I'm pretty sure about this. I don't know why the BBB doesn't close them down.

Dolphin's Cove was great. We were there from Jan 22-29, 2012. It's a quick drive to Disneyland, the grocery store, and an outlet mall! The grounds are well-maintained, and we enjoyed the pool and hot tub. We also took advantage of the barbecue grills. The kids spent a day swimming and the staff kept them entertained with water balloons and other acivities. We had no problems with noise at all; in fact, the only noise we heard at night were Disney fireworks! We were able to see them from the deck of the upstairs room. The rooms (we had 2) were clean and spacious. We had a great time and we would definitely go back!

After reading several reviews on this site, I was not looking forward to our stay here.   I'm glad it turned out to be a great place to stay.   We were in Unit 514 last week and were very pleased.   The unit was very clean.  The grounds were well maintained.   The Resort is close to many great places to eat.   We had the best meal at the Cheesecake Factory.   Denny's is right next door for breakfast.   Disneyland is 5 minutes away.  We really enjoyed our stay here.

Summary Heading: It's good for kids and family even if you go with friends cause it's relaxing and close to everything!!
Summary: I live in Australia and we went with our friends. 4 adults and 4 kids. It's really good for kids cause theres sooo much to do!!! The staff are extremely nice and are willing to help you. It very close to disneyland and otter attractions. If I go back to anahime I would stay here again!!!

We stayed twice during oct for 2 different weeks.rooms were great especially overlooking the pool,kids loved the games room and pool.perfect to split up a long day at Disney . Heaps of food places around and with a car Von's supermarket is not far (sign on as ammeter to get discount) , Disney is an. Easy walk or take the shuttle from the car park a block away.car park was secure and service was good . Met heaps of nice families would stay again for sure...

My family and I stayed at this resort from December 23 to December 25th 2011.  It was certainly not up to the standards I am accustom to with Wyndham.  It is badly need of updating. Finding the front desk at night was a challenge.  We had to stop guests to ask for directions.  Unfortunately, they did not speak English, but were very nice in pointing us in the the right direction.  The dresser in one bedroom was balanced by folded cardboard sticking out from underneath.  NICE TOUCH!  It was noisy.  Will not stay there again.

We stayed last week at this resort. We were 4 people in a one bedroom unit, there was ample space. However, the bathroom was part of the bedroom, not outside. As the one bedroom unit is rated for 4 people it was awkward to use the bathroom when somebody was in the bedroom. They do have some one bedroom units with the bathroom outside the bedroom, however, these were not available, Service was slow, throughout the week, we asked a number of times to replenish towels, etc. we had to call a number of times before they were delivered.

Summary Heading: great location, bad room and service
Summary: We had a 1bedroom 1bath room for two nights here. We arrived about 2:30am and the night staff was impersonnal and did not greet us welcomly. We had our reservation confirmation letter IN-HAND when we arrived and were told that a reservation was not made and handed me and my husband two in-bound guest lists with the names, number of guests and room types of all guests scheduled to be there that week(which is a BIG no-no). We were checked in and told we had to have a copy faxed by the person who made the reservation in the morning but if we could not provide this we would have to pay for that nights stay. I have worked in the hospitality service at a resort so i know how this industry works, making eye contact and making the guests feel welcomed and important is a must and this

We rented a one bedroom unit in December 2011. We got the place from an incredible auction for $350 for the entire week, so we did not set very high expectations. We hoped for a basic, clean place to sleep after coming back from DLR.  I think this place was recently acquired by Wyndham.They got a minor face lift and re-touches insde the units such as granite countertops in the kitchen, new paint, new small kitchen appliances like coffee maker, toaster etc. So, Wyndham is coming, but not fully there yet.  Positives: Excellent customer service - they were very kind and attentive to all our needs and maintenance requests. They went above and beyond our expectations in helping us with a personal matter.  Location is great, very close to the parks and yet somewhat secluded and away

We stayed here in a three bedroom unit in December.  For a family of seven adults and two small children, it was manageable for the three nights we stayed here.  It is about a ten minute or one mile drive to Disneyland......a very long walk if you have children. There are convenient stores and restaurants.  This resort has a full kitchen so eating in is an option for larger families.  The rooms are ample size....and adequately clean. There is a large size pool on the property, work-out room, and laundry facilities.  The overall impression here is that it is an adequate place to stay....but it is old. This is a Wyndham time share property and it is typical....adequate but needs updating.  All in all.....it works for the price.

This hotel may be a little older than others in the area but it is still a wonderful place to stay with your family! It feels more like a bed and breakfast because of its size and any problem you have will be solved right away. Customer Service is amazing! It is also super clean and the location is awesome.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay for Large Families
Summary: We loved our stay at Dolphin's Cove. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a three bedroom and there was plenty of room for us and our brood of kids. Yes, it is an older place but our room looked like it had been updated. It was clean and well stocked with supplies. I thought the beds were extremely comfortable.
