We did not encounter any problems at the resort at all. There is a Target just down the road ( 5 minuntes by car) where we did most of our grocery shopping. My favorite part of staying here was the fact that they have FREE laundry facilities. Because we stayed a week we ended up needing to do a ton of laundry. My kids loved playing in the pool but we really didn't do any of the other activites because we were busy playing at Disneyland. We walked one day

Summary Heading: Dolphin Cove is Not up to Wyndham standards guest beware!
Summary: I would NOT RECOMMEND staying at this Property! Our unit was #124 which faced Orange Wood Ave. When we arrived we notice the sheets had hair and insect particles on them. We also notice the shower was not clean, soap residue from the past guest still remained on the shelf in the shower. We were attending a conference so our time was very limited we changed out the sheets and did some sanitizing on our own. We marked it up to the housekeeping was not up to par.. The condo only had one bathroom, but the furnishings were comfortably updated. The cable package is basic; the pool area was nice and offered a spa, and grilling area in the courtyard. Since the property is a “family oriented" resort   it was understandable that this area was loud with children playing. On 1/14/11 we

We stayed here in March 2011. I was nervous because of some other reviews, but it ended up being a really good place for us! It was close to the ART line, which we took to Disneyland because of physical limitations. The we're 2 kids and 4 adults in our party and it accommodated all of us just fine. We enjoyed having a place to cook, and hang out when we weren't at the parks. It was nice and clean and we enjoyed the breakfast buffet provided also. The pool and recreation building were nice too. We would stay here again.
Quaint little resort on a 5 and 1/2 acre piece of property.  We are in a 3 bed and it's spacious, clean and close to EVERYTHING.

We took our whole family to Disneyland and had exchanged our time share to stay at Dolphin Cove.  We got in late at night and the place looked run down and old in a not so great neighborhood....in the daylight it looked better, but still on the old side.  It is great having a place to cook so close to Disney.  It was a little farther than we thought so we drove each day. The staff was really nice.

We stayed here September 5th through the 10th, through our timeshare for our first family trip to Disneyland. We had a two bedroom condo for myself, my husband, and our 18 month old daughter. The condo was very spacious and clean. The grounds were very well maintained and the pool area was great too. It was nice that they had a small kiddie pool for our daughter so that she was able to play in that on her own. They also had a lot of craft activities going on for the younger kids, you could participate in these activities for a small fee. The resort itself was only about 3/4 of a mile from Disneyland, which was great. Also if you walk just around the corner you can catch a shuttle that takes you to the park. This was very convenient and MUCH cheaper then trying to park at one of

Summary Heading: Resort needs to be better maintained
Summary: Stayed at the resort the last week of August 2011 for 7 nights.  After checking into our condo (2 bedroom; 2 baths),  I turned on the kitchen faucet only to have water spray all over me.  Luckily their maintenance came out and fixed the faucet within the hour.  The refrigerator was loud and the light fixture over the dining table kept making popping noises when on.  Laundry facilities are free however, one of the washers was broken and the remaining washers did not spin the clothes dry.  Clothes were still soaking wet; either you had to spin the clothes a second or third time or wring the clothes out by hand before putting in the dryer.  Pool was out of service the first day we checked in.  It's an average resort; only saving grace was that it was near Disneyland.  We

I stayed at my Mom's timeshare at the Dolphin Cove Resort. Though I'm leary of the timeshare concept in general, I've been happy with the places we have stayed, including this one. They do pay attention to their business. The Dolphin has great location close to Disney. You can take the free shuttle from the "Toy Story" Disney parking lot, which is only a big empty lot away from the DCR. (You are technically not supposed to do this judging by the "no access to Harbor Blvd" signs near the shuttle when leaving Disney), but we were greeted warmly by Disney employees when we were obviously entering from the sidewalk, so it seems generally ok as of this writing - there were very few people doing this while we were there). Our room was clean and nice and felt like it was recently

Summary Heading: Not as good as other Wyndham resorts
Summary: We had room #402 which was a one bedroom unit on the ground floor. The carpet had stains on it and was torn in the living room/dining room area. The bathroom was only  6' x 6' (really small).  There is only one a/c unit and it is located in the living room. There are ceiling fans in all the rooms though.  The was no washer or dryer in the unit. You had to goto a central location where they washer and dryers that you could use.  The rest of the resort was alright though. It is located about 1/4 of a mile away from the entrance to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Adequate resort with great proximity to Disneyland
Summary: Dolphin's Cove Resort is a nice enough place to stay for a week, but truth be told, we've had nicer timeshare exchanges through RCI.  For someone reading this review, I don't intend for that to come across as a negative.  It's just that the main draw for choosing this place was its close proximity to Disneyland/California Adventure--which was only a 20-25 minute walk (about a mile away) for me, my wife and 2 kids (ages 9 and 5).    The resort itself was nice but nothing exceptional.  We certainly didn't experience any of the horror stories that some others have posted in their reviews, but then again, it didn't have any "Oh wow" factor going for it, either.  It was just...adequate.  The grounds were neat and well-maintained, we liked the covered carport parking (see pictures),

Summary Heading: Nice place for a family to stay
Summary: We stayed at the Dolphin's Cove Resort for one week for our Disneyland trip. We had no trouble at all checking in, and in fact they let us check in a little early which started our trip off on a good note. The room was nice, clean, and appeared to have been recently updated. I was a little worried due to some of the reviews I had read, but we were pleasantly surprised.  The resort is close to Disneyland, but not within walking distance in my opinion.  You do enough walking at the park that you really wouldn't want to walk back to the resort after a long day.  We cooked breakfast in our room every morning, and also prepared our lunches to take to the park.  There are grills outside, but we never used one.  The pool area was great, and we met another family there who we found out

We stayed at Dolphin's Cove from April 16 - 23, 2011. This resort is absolutely gorgeous! We had a three bedroom and two bath unit for my husband, daughter, son and myself. It was very clean both inside and outside. The grounds were immaculate. It is in a sense a gated community as access is by card only. Felt very secure. The staff was great. Many activities for young and old are scheduled. Very close to Disney Land. Was able to take public transportation. The resort was in a busy area but you wouldn't know it when you were inside the resort. Can't wait to go back.
Resort staff was friendly and attentive. We had a lovely stay.

Just returned from a week at the Dolphin Cove Resort.  Went with 5 adults and a 5 year old.  We had a 3 bedroom unit.  Unit was clean.  Also the large size with a 5 year old was nice.  He could scatter his toys in the living room.  We had 3 TV's which was also nice.  Having 2 bathrooms was a plus.  On the first day there the handle in the bathroom fell off and the air conditioner in the master bedroom did not work well.  Within the hour the maintenance people were there fixing both issues.  The only problem was the dishwasher did not really work properly the whole time we were there.  The grounds are beautiful.  The pool was heated and there was a hot tub.  We did not partake in any of the other activities offered.  We did have the continental breakfast one day which was nice.

Summary Heading: Accommodations are fine, but customer service is lousy
Summary: I have no complaints about our room.  In fact, I love the full kitchen and the roomy bedrooms.  But in our two stays here in the last 6 months, we have had 3 issues with very poor customer service at the front desk.  And I had a very difficult time changing a reservation by phone with their front desk staff.   I felt like I was an unwelcome guest, which is not the feeling I would like to have when we're spending this much money on a vacation resort.

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay for a Disneyland vacation!
Summary: We stayed here for four nights at the end of March.  We had a wonderful stay!  Our one-bedroom upstairs unit was nicely decorated, clean, spacious, and comfortable!  The grounds were very nicely landscaped, and the beautiful heated pool and hot tub were outstanding!  We even spent one day relaxing by the pool with the kids, and had a barbecue for dinner (the grills are by the pool).  There was a nice game room, snack bar near the pool, fitness center.  The staff was very friendly and helpful!  What more could you ask for?  I have never been disappointed with a Wyndham timeshare!      We took the shuttle to Disneyland (around the corner by Denny's).  You can buy daily passes near the front desk (or adult passes at Denny's for $1 less).  Ask the drivers, as there are two different

stayed 10 days moved 3 times!  stove, disher, toilets!!!!!  didn't work!  had to move at 3am to a new room.  along with other people.   went to talk to Manager........What manager?  he said he'd call.....still waiting!  do yourself a favor and stay somewhere eles!!!!  Also no maintenance personel at night.

We spent a week here with two adults and two children  (ages 10 & 7) in a two bedroom unit.  We found the unit size fine for us with a king bed in master bedroom and two twin beds in second bedroom.  There was one shared bathroom.  We were 5 min from Disneyland and around the corner from the Disney parking lot.  In less than 5 minutes we were on the highway where we could then travel north or south.  We found so many things to do in the area we had to pick and choose our activities.  We went to Legoland one day, 45 min south, Disneyland one day, Dana Point 35 min south (Try Captin Dave's whale watch/Dolphin Safari, we had an amazing time!) and then 3 different days traveled to Los Angeles.    Our only complaint  was we wished there was a washer/dryer in the unit.  There was a

Summary Heading: Close to the Happiest Place of Earth
Summary: Enjoyed it.  Disneyland is naturally expensive.  But I found everything else quite reasonable.  Lots of activities and dining offers available via Groupon.  Looking forward to my next trip there.

Summary Heading: No refund on $100.00 charged to my credit card
Summary: My stay at the resort was average. I am not complaining about that. When I checked in I was told that $100.00 would be charged to my credit card for incidentals. Which was fine. But I have not received a payment back. I called several times to speak to a manager but keep being told he or she is in a meeting. I feel like I am being robbed. That is my complaint.

I stayed at the Dolphin Cove Resort April 2010 with my 12 year old daughter. Our first vacation ever that was far away. We stayed in room 314 and the whole experience  was perfect. Our room was great. There was lots to do at the facility when we were too tired to go back to Disneyland and the staff was exceptional. Can't ask for much more. I wish it was within walking distance to Disneyland but if I every go back I would choose Dolphin's Cove rather than move closer and not know what I am going to get. Price was right too. Thanks to all the staff for making our trip perfect !!!!!!!

It was acceptable for the price and location.  The room does need an upgrade bc everything seems worn out. But it's comfortable.  Each room had a balcony/patio which is nice. The towels were a bit dingy.

We booked this through RCI and wasn't sure what we'd find.  However, we were very pleasantly surprised.  The room was large (as large as my first apartment), nicely decorated and very cozy.  The lightbulb in the bedroom was out and they took care of it at OUR convenience.  The only complaint I had was that I went through three room keys in one week as they would work only in the pool gate, not the driveway gate or the door.  That was frustrating.  This resort is 1/2 mile from Disneyland, so it is within walking distance if you're up for a jaunt.  But we opted for taking the Shuttle which was $4 per person roundtrip since there was only two of us (as opposed to $15 for parking at Disney).  The pool was heated which was nice on a chilly November evening.  We would definitely stay

Summary Heading: Not your typical gold crown resort
Summary: Rooms are in desperate need of renovation. Didn't feel so comfortable with baby crawling. Had an ant problem and their solution was to come spray ant spray which I did not appreciate with kids in the room. BBQ near us was used for over an hour, when went up to BBQ near pool, it took staff 20 minutes to come out and light, then took 45 min to cook hamburgers :(

Stayed at this Resort for 3 days & 2 nights to visit Disneyland with our 2 children ages 9 and 13 yrs old.  Shuttle service to Disneyland was around the corner from the resort, but the return trips takes a little extra time.  Not important if your feet are tired and you just want to rest a little longer.  Resort staff very friendly and helpful.  Plenty of parking. Room was nice and clean with lots of towels and plenty of storage space in the bathroom and the kitchen area.  Dishwasher is loud, so best to run it after breakfast when you are leaving for the day.  TV are older type if that's important to you.  Wi-Fi access was very so-so, but able to access with a little extra time. Pool area was clean and loved the very hot jacuzzi.  Great place to stay if visiting Disneyland and

Pleasant timeshare resort, no presentation when we were there, great for families, 1, 2, and 3 bedroom condos.  Sleep 4, 6, 8. Walk to corner and get shuttle to Disney for $4 per day, unlimited back and forth.

I had grin on my face when I walked into our room.  The outside of the buildings look worn and dated, but the inside was great!  New appliances, funishings and great soaps and spices in the kitchen!  The towels were stiff and discolored and our carpet seemed clean until you looked at the bottom of your socks.  The staff was friendly, and it was quiet at night.

Summary Heading: Dolphin Cove More Than Disney Adventure
Summary: I just stayed the weekend at Dolphin Cove with my family for a relaxing time. The staff was great and very responsive to questions and helping us check in. Dolphin Cove has a ton of fun activities for the kids to do, we made our own Disney Autograph book. Plus you have to check out the crows nest above the pool, it's pretty cool for all of the kids, even the grown up ones. Quite room, the only draw back is we had 1 bathroom for 4 people.

I'm still amazed at this resort.  It looks like it was an apartment complex at one point.  Lots of covered parking, meandering paths through the buildings, mature landscaping.  How quiet was this place?  We were able to sleep with our bedroom window (2nd floor) open and never heard a sound.  The room was rather dark, but we weren't there much in the daytime and it gave a feeling of being in the jungle with all of the large plants and trees in the lovely planted area below.  It actually kind of reminded me of Hawaii.  Everything in the room, except for the air conditioner, was updated and very clean.  Air conditioner was so loud we did not use it, but opening the door and window worked fine.    Our only disappointment was that because this was a last minute trip we could only

Needless to say, it seems as if people writing these reviews are staying at two different places.  Some people act like it’s Trump Plaza and others seem to think it was the hotel from Psycho.   The truth lies somewhere in the middle.  My family stayed there a week in July of 2010.  We have been Fairfield/Wyndham owners for many years.  We love going to Wyndham resorts.  They are always clean, classy, and well-maintained.  Having said that – when my wife and I walked through the door of Dolphin’s Cove, our hearts sank.  It is nowhere in the league with any of the other Wyndham resorts in which we have stayed.  The carpet, drapes, furniture, and decorations look like they’re from AT LEAST the 70’s.  I felt like we were in an episode of the Brady Bunch.  Don’t let anyone fool you –

I traveled to Anaheim with my husband and two year old daughter.  We stayed at the Dolphin Cove through our RCI timeshare.  I was a very spacious room and was very tidy.  We enjoyed the grounds of the hotel and the activities that were offered throughout the week.  The hotel staff were friendly.  I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

Dolphin's Cove had mixed reviews from what we had seen online, so we really weren't sure what to expect.  When we arrived, the staff was very friendly and went out of their way to ensure that all 30 of our family members (6 rooms) got checked into their rooms quickly and painlessly.  The rooms had all been renovated about six months prior and were vere very clean and comfortable.  We didn't attend any of the activities hosted by the resort, but did enjoy quite a bit of time at the pool.  Disneyland was the focus of our trip, and the park is about a 20 minute walk from DC, or the ART shuttle picks up right around the corner for $4/day for adults and $1/day for kids (Dennys had reduced price tickets for sale at the register).    The resort really impressed us.  It's not the J.W.

Disneyland with 2 grandkids was our main stop and we knew the location of the resort was good as we stayed there in November 09, and it was a timeshare week.  We had a 2 bedroom unit on ground floor.  The unit had been recently painted, new drapes, new carpet, and furniture looked good compared to our first visit.  We were very comfortable.  First day the fire alarm was beeping as we walked into the condo, maintenace came right away.  The laundry and pool was convenient.  We used the grills and the swimming pool almost every night.  The hot tub was great on tired feet.  Guests were friendly.  Both visits we used Carolina's for pizza, good food, and a family owned business.  One night we ordered Chinese from the Panda House, did not taste well.  We visited 2 beaches in the area,

My husband and I traveled to Anaheim to spend a few days with grandchildren. Our daughter and son-inlaw  were there attending a seminar at the convention center. They spent 3 nites with us at Dolphin Cove. We had a 2 bedroom and were on ground floor by the pool, which was perfect for the kids. The location was great for attending the Yankee/Angel game, which we took a cab to, but walked back (about 1 1/2 mi).  Disney was less then 1 mi. We took the shuttle the first trip, which was a joke, as after picking us up, it stopped a few more times and was packed solid by the time we arrived at the park. The price was right, but it would have been easier, faster and more pleasant to walk, which we did after that . The units were dated, but comfortable, with a small kitchen, 2 tvs, 2

My husband and my brother in law and girlfriend stayed at the Dolphin's Cove Resort in Anahiem. We loved the resort so very much, the employee's were very helpfull and the room was great, so clean everything you would need. The bed's were very comfortable, easy to get around to the different parks. We are looking forward to coming back some day. The hot tub was to die for after a long day of walking around Disney, and that we were able to use the grills by the pool was great, we were able to come back and have a BBQ before going back to the park. I would recommend this to anyone. Very quiet. It's a wonderful place to stay at.

Summary Heading: a bad experience soured what should have been the visit of a life time
Summary: My wife's family all live in SoCal, so on some of the occasions when we visit from Australia, we may get to go to Disneyland. This was one such trip so we got a 2 bed unit at Dolphin's Cove, a 5 day park hopper pass  and spent  the week in Walt's dream. As we were in Disneyland  we didn't  use all of the Resort's facilities, except the pool ( good) Spa (better), & free laundry ( except for a flooded washer which was fairly quickly fixed - great). Positives, comfortable room with somewhat dated furnishings. good master suite, good sound deadening between rooms, & well equipped kitchen. Not so good: lugging your luggage upstairs, the soggy unsupportive couch in the unit lounge,  the bus service ( as noted elsewhere the stop is the end on a longish route and therefore can be slow

We had stayed at the Dolphin's Cove the week after the American Thanksgiving with our kids, 7 & 10. Best time to visit Disneyland btw. Disney was not that busy and was dressed up in the Christmas theme. However, the winter hours had kicked in and was only open from 10AM until 9PM. That being said, with the low crowds, we were able to see pretty much both parks on a 2 day hopper. Probably could have seen it all and then repeated rides if doing the 3 day. We skipped the really little kids type rides.  After wondering how the accommodations would be after reading some of the reviews, I was a little concerned. They are in the process of renovating the rooms and it appeared we had one of those renovated rooms. We stayed in a 2 bedroom, the walls looked freshly painted, carpets looked

I have to admit, my wife and I had been here before a few years back to celebrate Thanksgiving with her family (from nearby San Diego) and hit up the Happiest Place on Earth.  So, this is really a review of both trips in one.  Each time we had a 3 bedroom unit.  We took the master and left the rest of the family to fight over the rest!  This last time we also had a one bedroom next door to accomidate the addition of my father and brother.  They had just begun a refurbishment of the property and we were properly notified before hand.  I will say it needs it.  Of all the Wyndham properties we head to, this one "feels" the oldest.  But, being popular and doing a good job has it's drawbacks.  Families want to stay with you so the rooms will be hit a little harder that other spots.

Thank god this trip was so full of activities for my family that I didn't really spend any extended amounts of time in my unit.  Negatives: Tired (and somewhat uncomfortable)furniture w/ the exception of the master bed, poor air circulation with that one a/c unit in the living room; but then, on the last night as I was packing, a roach the size of a Buick jumped from the closet onto my neck. YEECH. Took me 15 minutes to hunt that sucker down and stomp on it. Had that been the first night, I would have been on first night, I would have been on the phone w/ Wyndham demanding them to move me to their nicer property in Anaheim.  Pros: Nice desk staff, friendly and helpful; Manicured Property; Secure; location close to Disney and (if you don't mind driving the LA Freeways) convenient

Summary Heading: Bed Bugs at Dolphin Cove Resort
Summary: We checked in on Saturday, July 11, 2009. We were there for a week long vacation at Disneyland and CA Adventure.  We decided not to unpack our bags as we would be at the parks all week, so we left them on the floor in the master closet. Thursday morning my husband woke up with bites on his right arm.  We figured it was from mosquitos having spent many days and evenings at the parks.  He continued to wake up with them on Fri. and Sat. We checked out on Saturday, July 18.  He continued to get welts on his body for the rest of the week when we got home.  We then figured he may have contracted some kind of rash from Disneyland due to close proximity to people in lines. On Sunday morning of the second week, his body was covered in welts. I immediately sent him to urgent care just in

Summary Heading: Will Stay here again in a heartbeat
Summary: where to start....It beats any hotel. We were here to see family and go to Disney of course. It is in walking distance in fact I beat my husband getting home when he parked in the disney garage and my daughter and I walked.  I would note that after a long day at disney I would probably opt to drive if you have wee little ones. The pool was great it even had a little toddler pool in addition to the large pool and hot tub situated next to the snack bar. They have a number of events and crafts happening everyday for the kids too.  Spin art, decorate a kite etc. Bbqs are placed around the resort in case you would like to grill which we did steaks one evening and there is also a (mini) putting green. Their are some surrounding apartments nearby that may be a little lower income but

We were a little concerned because of the mixed reviews and minimal pictures of this resort. We used a timeshare exchange and stayed in a 2 bedroom suite for a week for 5 adults and 3 kids. Place wasn't too bad when we arrived, a little outdated. Fully equiped small kitchen, roomy, resort grounds are clean, staff are friendly, great pool area, complimentary breakfasts (nothing fancy), and activities throughout the day for kids, free internet, and close to Disneyland. The suite was air con, but it was in the living room so the bedrooms do get warm. The available fans do help at night.   Although we are close to Disneyland, it is a long walk to get there. The street blocks are pretty long. Dolphin's Cove does provide shuttle to Disneyland. We ended up just driving because it was

Summary Heading: Would come back if visiting Disneyland
Summary: We're finishing out our week at Dolphin's Cove right now and I have to say that we have been very pleased. After reading all the reviews I was a little concerned but we couldn't pass up a great deal that we got on a 2-bedroom unit on ebay.   We were coming to CA w/ our four kids (ages 10, 9, 8 and 6) and spending one day at Disneyland and California Adventures. I wanted some place close so we could come back in the middle of the day.  The pool area is nice and the pool is kept at a comfortable but refreshing temperature. There are lots of chairs and tables available and two gas grills that you can use to cook a meal.   The grounds are well kept and the staff has all been very friendly and helpful. The activities staff does some stuff throughout the day for the kids. Our 8 year

Summary Heading: Perfect location for a nice quick "Getaway"
Summary: My fiance and I had the pleasure of staying at Dolphin's Cove in Anaheim, CA for two days.  We were attending a friend's wedding and I didn't want to stay in "just a hotel".  As members of MGV(monarch grand vacations), we used monarch escape time plus.  I chose the Dolphin's Cove because my finance was attending the groom's bacelor party which was to be held in Anaheim.  The resort was very impressive.  Our villa was spacious and very comfortable.  I loved the fact that the kitchen, fully stocked, also included condiments(packets of salt and pepper, etc).  The resort is also centrally located.  The grounds were well kept and the staff was friendly.  Highly recommended!

Summary Heading: Dolphin Cove--Really a Resort?  Too far from Disney, my friend.
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Dolphin Cove Resort in Anaheim for just one night which, in my opinion, was enough. First of all, no one should even suggest that this place is walking distance to anything except for an old convenience store a block away.  Dolphin Cove may be close to Harbour Blvd but it is way too far to walk to either Disney or the cluster of restaurants near the main gate.  My wife and I are both avid walkers and we timed the walk to Disney at one hour; much of the stroll is past an ugly vacant block of land.  Take the bus or drive if you feel feel you have to stay here. As for Dolphin Cove itself, our condo was a one bedroom unit which I would describe as "well worn."  The carpet was aged as were most of the room amenities.  Felt like we had to wheel our luggage

Summary Heading: Close to Disney with large acommodations
Summary: We decided to stay here because of the close proximity to Disneyland & the size of the accommodations.   We had a 2 bedroom unit which was enough room for our family.  The kitchen was small, but well stocked with dishes & even prepackaged spices.  We had the free continental breakfast once & it was ok…nothing fancy.    The air conditioning is not centralized & only located in the living room.  It was loud & scarred my toddler so we had to turn it off & deal with the heat.  Luckily, there was a ceiling fan.  We did have a couple problems with our unit.  Two fixtures needed light bulbs and should have been taken care of before allowing guests to check-in a room.  Also, the bathroom window above the shower was missing the sliding window pane.  My husband put a towel there so that

Summary Heading: Best place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: I have stayed over the years at Many places over the years near Disneyland but the one I prefer to stay at is Dolphins Cove. From their friendly Activities Staff which are great to the Beautifully decored and sizeable rooms. The pool is perfect although usually very crowded and the facilities are well maintainted. If you want a place to stay at while you are visiting Disneyland this is the perfect place. You can come back to your room and relax or spend some quality time with the family after a long day of waiting in line.

Was a bit skeptical after reading some of the reviews, but wanted a family vacation to Disneyland with daughter & grandkids and this week was available through time share points exchange.  Was very impressed with the resort, rooms, pool, spa and everything else. Very secure resort.  Had their continnental breakfast twice.  Staff very helpful.  We attempted the shuttle (bus 14), but because of a marathan near Disneyland, the shuttle was delayed so we walked-not a bad walk at all.  Did use the shuttle coming back to resort that day,  but then decided to walk our next 2 trips.  Alternated between Disneyland and the beach which worked out great for the kids for our  days there.   Only complaint would be there's only 1 bathroom for the 2 bedroom unit.  The room wasn't as plush as

Summary Heading: Had a Great Time in spite of some negative rewiews............
Summary: I think we all have a problem or two when staying somewhere,but we had NO problems at all. The accomodations very comfy and the livingroom large with great veiws of the pool area. We had easy internet access for free. Free laundry facilities(your own soap ,of course) The staff was friendly and helpful. No elevater since the resort is a converted apartment building,but the staff will gladly carry your bags up for you. Could use a furnishings remodle. There were many activities and a small snack bar at the pool. We are headed back May 17th for our second visit with 2 other couples. Looking forward to our next stay. Also they were very accomodateing with our Service Animal These people will work with you. Be kind and don't forget to TIP when house keeping brings towels or cleans

After seeing all the reviews I was worried we'd have problems but it was great! The employees were very nice and helped out anytime I needed them (once for extra coffee filters and a few questions we had were answered and addressed quickly).  The pool was fun, especially since it was not very warm while we were there (compared to other months in SCal. The hot tub was relaxing. Both were very clean. We had a three bedroom unit #206 right near the pool. The rooms were plenty large and clean. I wanted to rearrange the living room all week, but that is my neurosis :S. We had a small issue with a common Southern California pest, tiny ants, but it may have been because we left some food out accidentally the night before. The front desk offered to spray, but I don't like that in the

Our family ( myself, husband, 9yr. old, and 14 yr old ) stayed at Dolphin's Cove from January 30, 2009 - February 9, 2009.  My expectations were low based on some of the reviews, but they quickly diminished from the moment I walked onto the property. First thing is the property is now owned by Wyndham Property and not Worldmark. I am guessing this has made a huge difference.  We are timeshare owners with RCI, but were unable to secure a unit through our points for the time of year we wanted; we were however able to get a fantastic deal through RCI to pay for the unit. We booked a 3 bedroom, 2 bath for the week. It was very spacious and quite clean. I was relieved when we walked in. There is a full kitchen with all the supplies you need, a full living room, balcony, 2 full baths,

Summary Heading: Everything you need to know is in this review!!
Summary: My wife and two boys (ages 10 & 6) had a one week stay in a one-bedroom suite.  We were prepared for the worst, since the reviews have been mixed and sparce.  One thing the review is missing is pictures so added 10 new ones to give a better flavor of the hotel.  First I have to say that we pay a minimal maitenance fee for our timeshare each year.  As a result, we never have really high expectations for what we can trade for with RCI.  Given the prices around Disneyland for one bedrooms in mid-December, I would suggest that anyone paying more than $125 per night for Dolphin's Cove might not appreciate what they get given what you can get in the area for a little more.  That being said, we averaged about $60 per night on our costs which changes our perspective on what to expect.

After planning our Christmas 2008 gift trip to Disneyland, my aunt offered us the use of her time share for the week. Through RCI she booked us a stay at Dolphins Cove.  After I found out what hotel we where staying at, I did research, and was afraid at what I saw! I was totally expecting the worst of the hotel. I even packed us clean sheets, and cleaning supplise, 'just in case'. But there was no need for them!  The grounds are just beautiful, the room, it was clean, fully stocked with Corelle dish ware, True Blue from Bed and Bath bars of soap, shampoo, conditionair, lotion and mouthwash. The kitchen was fully stocked with everything we would need, there was extra pillows and blankets.   It's a gated community, so we felt totally safe. No extra fee's for parking.  It is a mile

Summary Heading: Unbiased Review From An Experienced Traveler
Summary: Read the other reviews, so going there I knew to be skeptical. Booked through RCI using my week In Spa Palace Cancun. Not quite an equitable trade, but had to use the RCI week, or lose it. Since I have never have been to So. California, decided to just take my wife there since our kids are over 18, and are in college. Arrive 2 hrs before checking time, and was pleased they allowed us to check in. However, only the rooms in the perimeter of the resort were available, aka parking lot view. But, "we would get great seats to see the fireworks tonight". We got to the room and it was homey, but needs updating. Nothing to write home about compared to the places I've stayed at, but not roach infested either. We were told we'd get garbage removal on or 2nd, 4th, and 6th day of stay. Only

We found Dolphins cove as part of our time share, and it was everything we expected and more.  Room was really clean when we checked in, no problems at all the whole week.  The only a/c was in the living room and the week we were there it was in the 90's, we just left it running while we were at disneyland and it kept everything cool and we were able to shut it off at night. The sofa bed wasn't too impressive, kids just slept on the couch and floor.  Bedroom was nice and good sized, bed was pretty comfortable.  Grounds were kept nice, and pool was nice.   The only major gripe I have was in the laundry room there were 6 washers and 6 dryers but only 2 of the washers were functional so it was a fight every day to try to get some laundry done.   Spent 3 nights after disneyland

our group of 6 adults stayed at this resort the first week in October of 2008.  The location was excellent.  We decided not to rent a car, and we purchased Orange County bus passes on line.  The trip from the airport was a little over an hour and quite easily made.  Check in was quick and efficient.  The room was spacious, clean, and well stocked with towels and other items.  The furniture was fine.  The pool and hot tub and activities were wonderful.  There were upscale, moderate and fast food restaurants within walking distance.  We were able to use the bus system to go to Hollywood, Venice Beach, Huntington Beach, Newport Beach and downtown LA, and didn't really miss a car at all.  All in all, the negative reviews about this place are quite difficult to fathom.  This resort

Stayed here courtesy of my mother  :)  thanks mom.  Close to disneyland, but still took the shuttle.  It's a LONG walk after all day at Disneyland.    rooms were clean and orderly.  Staff was very nice in all dealings with them.  Was surprised there was no washer/dryer in the rooms (I was in a one king bedroom) and no BBQ on the patio.

This resort was an Rci exchange for us. We felt the amount of points exchanged were a bit high for the facility. LOW POINTS - Resort is older and needs to be updated. Airconditioning units are noisy and smell musty and leak water outside the glass doors.The sofa is outdated and very uncomfortable, along with the side chair.The acitivities are limited and are small (3 holes for the putt putt).HIGH POINTS- Resort is well maintained, even though it is older. It is very clean and well tended to (gardens). The grounds are beautiful and the service exceptional.The staff is very friendly and always attentive to your needs. The pool is clean and perfect for chilling.The locatin of the resort is prime. You can walk to Disney Downtown or take the 5 minute ride. We drove to L.A. frequently

I have a timeshare with worldmark and was really looking forward to staying at dolphins cove for the disneyland 1/2 marathon event. I had booked six rooms for all my family that were coming from out of town to attend the event. At check in the front desk was very helpful and courteous we were checked in quickly. We all got to our rooms to unpack. In my room there was  an old wall  ac unit that when turned on smelled like it was burning. The front desk was called and matenance came and said we just had to run for a bit and the  smell would go away. The smell never went away and the room never cooled down the room was 90 plus degrees. all the other rooms were fine except this room. I spent all day calling the front desk regarding the ac unit I was finally given another room to

Summary Heading: Not much to write home about
Summary: We stayed at a 2 bedroom, 2 bath, 2nd floor suite. We had a balcony with a courtyard view that was much more enjoyable than the parking lot or street view of many of the other units. Both bedrooms had windows and the master bedroom had a king size bed, a walk in closet, a ceiling fan in the vaulted ceiling. The master bath was unattached so it really served as a second hall bathroom. The 2nd bedroom had 2 twin beds. There was a large TV in the master bedroom and a smaller one in the living room.  This was an older unit with updated furniture. The walls and trim were all white; however, there was color in the granite kitchen counter tops. The dishwasher is awful…only one source of water at the base of the machine. Be sure to “wash” your dishes before you put them in. The kitchen
Great location, not a lot a thrills, don't walk outside the gates especially at night, great place to take 5 teenagers for summer vacation. Not too far from the beaches.

We (couple in our 20's) stayed at Dolphin's Cove for a week in June '08, using timeshare points my parents were unable to use this year.   We were skeptical and our expectations were quite low after reading reviews. Our stay however was pretty good and we didn't run into any of the issues others have had. Our 1 BR unit was quite large and spacious for the two of us. Rooms and bathroom were clean and we had no issues with the housekeeping/cleaning staff. Pool was a good place to relax. (If you don't have kids with you, it's best to visit mid-morning when the pool isn't so crowded with kids.)  Overal we got what we expected and maybe more since our expectations were so low.

Still mid stay and having some issues.  We have a 2 room unit for my parents, us and our child.  I may be spoiled, by previous stays at Fairfield/ Wyndham Resorts, but compared to the other resorts, this is a big disappointment.  The unit was smaller then we were use to an only had one bathroom for the 5 of us.  There were ants in the main bed room, a TV in the living room that whined terribly when powered on, and a leaky A/C unit.  There is actually rust stains on the wall where the A/C unit leaks water, down to the carpet (which is not completely fitted to the room so there is a half inch gap between the carpet and wall).   Because of the moisture there is mold or something growing in the  corner of the room.  There is no vent in the bathroom so again, there is an awful

If you are looking for a resort that is close to the Disneyland Resort, but in the nieghborhood The Dolphin's Cove is the right place. We book with our timeshare due to location and the amenities it offered. It is walking distance to local restaurants and the Disneyland Park, but you would need a car for grocery shopping or if too tired.  Our unit was a 1 bedroom deluxe with a balcony, but on the first floor. The room was clean and somewhat nicely decorated, yet needed some remodeling.  The property was kept clean, landscape trimmed, lobby, pool, workout unit and laundry room were on site and clean as well. A very peaceful resort. Would return again with family.

Summary Heading: Anaheim's Dolphin Cove Resort poor experience
Summary: We booked a week at Dolphin Cover Resort to take our grand daughter to Disneyland.  The resort pool was shut down for 3 days for emergency maintenance.  Hot water for showers was non existant on some days.  "Out of Order" signs were on washers, dryers, ice machines, computers, and more.  The only service was a change of towels and garbage removed twice in a week.  The fold out bed was old and very uncomfortable for my daughter and grand daughter to sleep on.  The room had fans that barely stayed attached to the ceilings.   The resort, room and pool area were not very clean.  Although quiet time was listed there was a party outside in the courtyard that was loud and lasted until well after midnight. second time we have stayed there , 1st time couldnt fault it we had a suite this time we were given a studio and in comparison was really dissappointed  with it . Beds were uncomfortable and dishes were not really clean . The cost of the internet service was very expensive seeing we had stayed in Super 8 few days earlier and internet was free.

Every time we've stayed at one of the Fairfield/Wyndham Resorts we've received an email survey to complete - except for our last trip which was to Dolphin's Cove in Anaheim, CA. Could that be because they don't want to hear any complaints? We've been Fairfield (now Wyndham) owners since 2001 and have come to expect the very highest of standards and comforts when we use our timeshare but were very disappointed with Dolphin's Cove. The staff was helpful and friendly but the rooms were dingy, dismal and in great need of major renovation. The grounds were lovely - pretty trees and vegetation - but the overall condition of the buildings was less than appealing. We started out with a room on the ground floor which we had to change because we were infested with ants in the bathroom and

Great timeshare experience. Resort staff was friendly and helpful with any questions we had about the area. Great activities planned for children, two free continental breakfasts as well as great coffee available at all times. Fun to watch the fireworks from Disneyland from our resort's steps. Kitchen was stocked better than any resort I've stayed at. People didn't bother you with wanting you to attend a timeshare presentation. Only thing bad I could say was the pool towels were way too small and they needed to work on their equipment in the fitness center but being right after the holidays maybe they will take care of that soon. Great restaurants around.

Perfect for families! We traded our RCI timeshare for the Dolphin Cove.  Having stayed at various timeshares I tend to not get my hopes up too much.  This one was a pleasant surprise.  Very clean and spacious.  This is a great place for a family to stay!  We loved it.  We really enjoyed having the bedroom to seperate us from the kiddies.  The kithchen was great with granite counter tops and all.  The bathroom was clean and large with the vanity and sinks seperate from the toilet and shower.  We stayed int the one bedroom but they have 2 and 3 bedroom units too.  I also liked the security gate for parking...we felt very safe!  Interestingly it doesn't look like much from the parking area but once inside the complex it is beautiful...they obviously try to keep it up.

My family and I went on vacation to Disneyland and Stayed at Dolphn's Cove. We had  3 rooms!    I would NEVER stay there again!  We had money stolen from our room. We were gone for the day and came back that night!   With money stolen from our room. NO one broke in !  Even my brother wallet was there and no credit cards taken or lap top.   But don't try to hide cash!  Funny thing is.. House keeping came that day!

We recently stayed at Dolphin Cove in Anaheim for 3 nights.  Rooms were clean, well stocked with little bottles of toiletries (Bath and Body Works!), generous size (we stayed in a 2 bedroom two nights and a 1 bedroom one night).  We were quite skeptical after some of the other reviews we read but it was very nice.  There were tons of activities planned so we took advantage of the Friday night BBQ, free continental breakfast on Friday morning, and Wine and cheese night on Saturday night.  All served right by the pool with plenty of seating.  Gave the kids a chance to swim and wind down from the Disney parks.    Grounds are beautiful and quiet.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Couldn't ask for more. I think this property really gave us that resort feel for our vacation. We can't

My Husb. Daughter and 3 Grandchildren just returned from a week at Dolphins Cove. I was getting pretty apprehensive about this resort after reading all the reviews but my family was quite pleased. Yes, you can find other "5 star" resorts that might be nicer but Dolphins Cove is what it is advertised. We had a 3 bedroom very roomy, nice accomedations. We had one complaint when we got to our room which was the air conditioner in the master bedroom was not cooling. Within 15 mins. of our call, maint. was there and fixed it. Everyone was very pleasant and helpful. Altho we were gone alot (Disneyland - Knotts) the one day we did stay in the gkids loved the pool area and the game room. The childrens staff played with and offered lots of things for the kids to do. The resort was quite

My family (me, spouse, 10-year-old and 7-year-old boys) stayed a week at the Dolphin's Cove resort in Anaheim July 21-28, 2007.   I can see, after staying there, how it wouldn't suit everyone's needs. But it hit ours pretty much spot on. The resort is a Wyndham (formerly Fairfield) time share. We do not own a timeshare, but purchased a 6-night stay from a member on Craigslist for $700. At $116 a night, we definitely got our money's worth.   The facility is located about 12 blocks south of the Disney main gate. An Anaheim resort shuttle stop is about 100 yards from Dolphin's Cove, and will take you to and from the park for $3 for an all-day pass for adults, kids under 10 free; they run every 20 minutes. I recommend this, as parking at Disney is just as far.  There is more than

I was pleasantly pleased with our stay at the Dolphin's Cove.  The building is old but the maintanence is well kepted up.  The pool was big and nice enough for the kids to relax and play.  The staff were all friendly and we had no problems with getting around the area.  Best feature is that its close to Disney, which is what we wanted.  We will definitely stay here again.

This is not as posh as some resorts I have stayed at, but for a visit to Disneyland, it is perfect.  As for another reviewer, it was with great trepidation that I approached the door of our suite since I had read some awful reviews.  How delighted I was to find the suite clean, well furnished and well appointed. I had a ground floor suite that opened to a little patio and the beautiful grounds.   The grounds have many varieties of flowers and easy to travel paths.  The pool is easily accessible, there are lots of activities for the children, and there is a good collection of DVDs for rent.  The people who work poolside are especially accommodating.  Yes, they did shut the water off for two days while I was here, but it didn't bother me as we were out from 10-5.  Besides, that

Summary Heading: O.K. Place, but not the usual Fairfield location
Summary: I have read countless reviews about this property. My Father in Law owns Fairfield points, and we often travel with him to various Fairfield properties. When we arrived at the property, we could tell it was old and had some problems. The staff was very friendly, and welcomed us nicely. Check in was fast and painless. One feature we did like was the security gate, which requires a card key to operate. When we entered our unit, we noticed dirty, stained carpet and old, dirty furniture. The place was spacious, and had basic furnishings. There is a TV, VCR/DVD unit in the living area, as well as a stereo with a built in cd player. The kitchen is adequate, and has a refigerator with ice trays. I would have thought they would have provided a fridge with at least an icemaker. Air

Summary Heading: Dolphins Cove is like the Miami Dolphins....mediocre
Summary: First off my Mother in Law booked this place thru her time share program which is RCI I believe. We came to California from the Boston, Mass area. The first 3 nights of our week in Disney area we stayed at the 4 Points Sheraton in Fullerton and you can read my review over there. On Saturday April 14th we moved to Dolphins Cove for the last 4 days of our week. The place is close to Disney...you take a right out of DCove and a right on Harbor and then your 2nd left is Downtown Disney (best place to eat your meals and snacks with 3 hours free parking and 2 extra hours validated if you buy something) and the 3rd left is the Disney Parks. This resort was an OK place to stay. The mattress on the hide-a-bed was the worst ever! The staff was very helpful.......until the day of our checkout. We weren't leaving California until the following day, however we had to give up the room because all rooms were going to be filling up. There were 4 of us, 2 adults and our 2 kids. Summary Heading: Good Resort that got a bad rap!
Summary: This is the first review I have ever written. I just got back from Dolphin's Cove yesterday and felt it was important to write one, since some of the reviews I read on this site scared the heck out of me. They all seemed to be written from people who stayed at the resort in the same time frame. I think they just hit an off week and got unlucky with the renovations. There were still some room renovations going on, but we were warned by Fairfield one month prior to the trip and they did not affect us at all. The resort is a two story complex with very nicely landscaped courtyards. It reminds me a lot of Beaches in Jamaica, which I stayed at last year. We had a one bedroom which was not fancy, but was a good size and was very clean. At first I was disappointed with the patio since

Our experience was not pleasant in the least.  We were assigned a one bedroom unit.  We found our unit disgusting!  It had not been cleaned for months.  Spider webs, dirty moldy taps and bathtub.  Piles of sludgy dirt in every corner , in room airconditioner and heating system that DID not work.  Dirty and blood stained bedding. The sofa bed was terrible...springs sticking out of it so bad no one could sleep on it.  When we asked to be moved.. we checked out four other units and after pulling out the sofa beds...they were all the same!  BROKEN....stained and dirty.  We could not believe it!  We

We've stayed here in the past a few times, but this time was different. Upon arriving and unpacking, the toilet was used and overflowed, with the water rushing into the bedroom, I quickly went to turn the water power off on the toilet. Second Day, we get a notice on our door that the phones will be out of service for who knows how long (ended up off our entire stay). Third Day, our plastic key (card) would not open our door, which we tried for a full fifteen minutes before it finally did. Fourth Day, we get another notice on our door that morning that the water service will be off until 5:00 that day. HMMMMM!!!!!  Talk about inconvenience. Summary Heading: As An Owner: Absolute Dissapointment 2 Stars Best
Summary: To put it simply, Dolphins Cove is a substandard, hole-in-wall renovated rundown apartment complex that does not come near to deserving the Silver Crown resort of distinction rating by RCI and is not even in the same league of Time Share as other WorldMark/Trendwest resorts.  I am still clueless as to why we even own such a dreadful location other than its geographic location to Disneyland.  It took all my powers to reserve time there (3 rooms - 2 x 2 bedrooms and 1 x 1 bedroom) for my family Christmas vacation in 2006.  How despicable it was...  Let's start off with location: Pros: Close to Disneyland Cons: It’s quietly nestled between Denny's and a rat-hole apartment complex. We stayed at "Dolphins Cove as part of our month long family holiday.    The resort was clean and tidy and had everything that we needed.  Location great - short 2 minute to corner of road to catch the "Aneheim Transit Buses".    Staff - Not that friendly or helpful.  Had to work out our own way of getting to  Universal Studios - They had no idea!!!

This was our first stay at the Dolphin's Cove Resort.  We have extended family in California and so are always trying to find the best places to stay at.  We found the Dolphin's Cove and it was very close to the family we were visiting.  We had no issues making reservations or getting checked in.  It is great that they have the property gated (you have to first check in to get a pass key to get into the property).  That was a plus!  The unit, a two bedroom with two bathrooms plus a living area with a sofa bed, was in good and clean condition.  Nothing fabulous but nothing outrageously nasty either.  The unit was perfect for us, as we have a toddler with us.  It was very nice to have our child stay in one of the bedrooms while we stayed in the other, unlike most hotel rooms where

We have stayed at other Fairfield resorts and this place is a real disappointment. We won't be back. One other couple from WorldMark left the first day of check-in. They said it was the most discusting place they had ever been in. We wanted information about getting a tour bus to go to a dinner theater. They couldn't help us. They said call the venue, we did. They said book through your hotel. We rented a car. Not very helpful in my opinion. We have stayed  in only one place that was worse and that was WorldMark Palm Springs! It was BAD!

This place has turned into a FILTHY, DISGUSTING and COMPLETELY RUN DOWN DUMP! The staff is BEYOND RUDE and UNPROFESSIONAL.  We are timeshare owners and have been staying at Dolphin's Cove for nearly 10 years. It has been 3 years since we've stayed there and boy has this place changed!  First, our reservation was for a 2 bedroom 2 bath. Even with confirmation in hand, the staff insisted and even argued that I was only confirmed for a 2 bedroom 1 bath. I figured it was not worth starting our vacation out on a negative note, so I accepted the 1 bath. My husband had a last minute business commitment and had to stay home, so I figured a 1 bath would be just fine for myself, my 10 year old and 1 year old twins.  I had 2 different 2 bedroom/1 bath  units and both of them were

We have found our new SoCal Home Away from Home!  We were SO, SO pleased with this place. We had a 1 bedroom suite with kitchen.  We stayed 8 days and we were very comfortable here. The rooms are clean and spacious, also enjoyed the view balcony. The pool and rec room provided entertainment for the kids on our "down days".   We did  Disney, Legoland and SeaWorld.  This made the perfect home base and we have paid more $ for a smaller hotel room with fewer amentities in the past, but never again. The decor was crisp, clean and looked new. We liked the security cards and felt very safe in the area. The staff was on top of everything and requests were handled immediately, they were also knowledable about the area and beyond.  We had groceries delivered which was really handy. We had

My husband and I stayed here in September 2005 as we were visiting Disneyland as part of our honeymoon. We found it to be very well presented, very clean, the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room itself was wonderful, complete with kitchen and dining table, two tvs, comfortable bed and a very clean bathroom. We also found the location to be exceptional. The shuttle bus stop to Disneyland was just around the corner, we even walked to Disneyland and it took us about 15 minutes. The only bad thing was that we only stayed here 2 days we would have been more than happy to stay longer.

Positives: * Good sized rooms - we had a one bedroom and easily fit 4 people inside. * Secure environment - the resort required card access to the parking lot area and inside the resort. * Lots of resort activities - if you need a break from all the theme parks, you can easily find something to do at the resort.  Negative: * Long walk to Disneyland - it's about a 30 minute walk to Disneyland.  It's not bad when you walk to Disneyland, but you'll be looking for a shuttle at the end of the day. * Design of room - In order to get to the bathroom, you have to go through the bedroom.  If you have a couple people sleeping on the sofa bed in the living room, it might be a problem.  Overall, we had a good experience.  The game room was nice and the variety of events held at the resort

Arrived at the Dolphins Cove, Sunday AM, and our room was ready for us. We dropped off our stuff and headed over to Disneyland. We were in a 1 bdrm condo, that worked out perfectly for our family of four.  The front office staff was very helpful and nice.  The room was on the 2nd floor, and faced the parking lot. We liked how the vanity was outside the toilet/bath room, so our teenage girls could use the mirror and sink, and we could still shower, etc. We were in my inlaws unit and it was a little different than ours, so they are not all the same.  In our condo, you had to enter the bedroom to get to the bathroom, but in my inlaws' they had a separate hallway and entrance.  Two TV's in the condo, full kitchen with everything you need. Husband smoked out on the deck, where there

We stayed here for one week for New Years and we had a great time!  We had a two bedroom suite which was fine except that the second bedroom had two twin beds instead of one double bed which was odd becuase the room was HUGE!  Other than that we really enjoyed the resort.  The pool was kept very clean, as was the area around it.  The hot tub was excellent (also clean) and we used it quite often.  The pool area closed at 11pm which was fine.  They also had internet access for a good price but we had some problems connecting and had to get the staff to sort things out.  Everyone was very friendly and at the front desk they had fresh coffee and free fruit every day.  There was also the option to have a paper delivered to your door every morning.  The rooms were clean and large and

We stayed at Dolphin’s Cove in Jan. 2006.  It was great.  The room was just and I loved the garden and patio.  Short drive to Disney.  Awesome pool and hot tub.    It would be nice if there was a washer/dryer in the room, but I knew the room did not have it ahead of time.  There was a very nice FREE laundry mat in the resort.

I didn't know this website existed but I stayed at this resort back in the first week of May, 2004.  It was recently taken over at the time by Fairfield Resorts and I had no trouble getting a reservation, however, more people are finding out how good it is there goes the availability!  I would reccommend the one bedroom deluxe over the standard one bedroon, you'll get slightly larger size unit and a great view, I had just the standard one bedroom, everything in the unit was brand, I mean brand NEW and the picture in the Fairfield member book completely resembled everythin in the unit right down to the place setting at the dining room table.  I highly reccommend this resort, very close for families to bring their kids to Disneyland.  That had a great wine and cheese social too.

Summary Heading: Small room but decent resort with some amenities
Summary: Our experience was similar to what others have recently reported.  The staff were very friendly and accomodating.  We arrived in late morning and our room was already prepared.  We had four adults in a 1-bedroom (2 on the pull-out in the living room, 2 in the bedroom) and it was very tight.  The unit itself was not large and you had to go through the bedroom to get to the bathroom (good thing we're all friends ;-)  But for what we needed (a place to sleep and a kitchen) it worked great and we had more privacy and space than we would have had in a hotel room.  The breakfast ($4) was plain but good (all you can eat) and the facilities were well-maintained.  We did have some problems with getting things brought to the room.  We went down to reception to get extra pillows and the

We just got back from 8 days at the Dolphin's Cove Resort and I can't say enough good things about it!  Firstly, we arrived 4 hours prior to check in and our rooms were ready.  We had a one bedroom and a two bedroom and both were spotless, very roomy and had the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in!  Huge fluffy pillows on the king sized bed were the best I'd ever used and the room had everything from DVD player and VCR, stereo,  full kitchen, vacuum cleaner, all the dishes and kitchen accessories you could use.  Our units were near the back of the resort away from the pool area and so they were very quiet and peaceful.  We had three kids with us and when we weren't at Disneyland or other attractions there was plenty for everyone to do at the resort.  The pool was beautiful,

We stayed a week in mid April, 2005.  After staying at many highly rated resorts, we were uncertain with what we might experience. We found Dolphins Cove a great place to stay.  We had grandchildren ages 4 & 6 with us and they particulary enjoyed their time.  The resort has activities each day for the kids and some days had additional activities for the grownups.  The swimming pool was 3 1/2 to 4 1/2 feet deep.  Just the right depth for children to pay in.  The resort itself is a little dated, however, they do a good job of making it attractive.  There were plenty of linens, and other household items for our use.  We could have walked to Disneyland; we were that close.  It was probably about a mile away.  My grandchildren usually stay at California Adventure Hotel, however, they

After reading past reviews I had resolved myself to the fact that the resort would not be of quality standard.  Boy, was I surprised.  This resort was great.  We booked two units, a 2 bedroom and a 3 bedroom for our family vacation.  The ambiance was great.  The floral garden look was wonderful and fragrant.  Our units looked newly painted, new carpet, comfortable beds, new stove with new overhead microwaves.  The grandchildren had a wonderful time with all of the great children's activities and the pool was real nice.  As a matter of fact it was closed for 1-1/2 days for redoing the area around the pool.  The air conditioning/heating units are window units and not central air but they worked great and served their purpose well.  My only disappointment was handicap

I read many reviews for this property, many bad or poor, so I just was prepared for the worst and what I found was Very Good and Excellent.  I traveled with my wife and kids (4yo and 1yo).  The attention from all the staff was excellent always, they also talked Spanish well.  There is no restaurant in the complex but beside it there is a Denny's and not so far away a McDonald's, Taco Bell and another Denny's.  Once we even walked to Disneyland (around 2 or 3 blocks).  A Vons supermarket is like 2 blocks away so you can purchase all the groceries you need for yourself and family.  The resort is very well located you can find almost anything within 2 to 4 blocks from the resort.  Anaheim Resort Transportation Services (ARTS) provide the best transportation from and to the Disney

Dolphins cove was beautiful, the rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff were very helpful and polite, the hotel is approx 15 min walk from Disneyland and 2 minutes from bus stop. I enjoyed my experience very much!

I must say upfront that this is not a 5 star resort.  One thing that I would have liked to see would be central AC instead of wall units.  But I knew it was not 5 star going in. Everything else was great!  We stayed in October '04 in a 3 bedroom unit which was very clean, had a full kitchen, and even had three TV's and a TV/DVD combo player in the living room.  It was especially great for the kids.  There was a playground with sand box area, nice pool, spa, and the clubhouse was excellent!  There was a gym, bigscreen TV, internet, as well as pool table, air hockey, video games, as well as puzzles, coloring books, board games, and also scheduled activities for the kids.  The grounds were very well kept, and the staff was spectacular!  It is a little bit of a walk to Disneyland

Hey all  This review's probably not the most current in my mind, considering I stayed there for a week waaaaay back in december 2002. That being said, i do recall that we were quite pleased with the resort. The good: We stayed in a 1-bedroom suite and it was very clean and spacious. It was pretty evident that the room was recently renovated, as it was pretty modern for a 2.5 star resort. There was a TV in each room, very convenient considering my GF and I never agree on what to watch. The pool was decent, if small and the gym was in good repair. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. The bad: this hotel IS walking distance to disneyland, so long as you don't mind a 15-20 minute walk to the front gates. trust me, it's a hike. This is a great family resort, and a good value if you

Summary Heading: recommended for convenient location, good facilities & helpful staff
Summary: My wife, 2 boys & I stayed here using our timeshare week from Dec. 4 - 10 & we are satisfied. All the staff are friendly & helpful. We had 2 units to choose from when we checked-in around 7 pm & it was up to us to select the ground floor unit next to the pool. The other unit was on the upper floor but faced the main road which could have been noisy.  The unit we chose was up to our expectations - all facilities available as advertised, everything in working order, clean. The laundry room is a short walk away from our room & within the compound. Denny's is right next door & Baker's Square is across the road, so getting a bite to eat is not a problem. There are other restaurants as well. The ART (shuttle to take people to Disneyland) is just around the corner & this is recommended

My family and i just returned from a 7 day stay at the dolphins cove resort. It is very kid freindly and the staff were all very polite and helpful. No it is not  a ritzy place, but it is nice enough. It was just like any ordinary hotel, but with a kitchen and a extra bedroom and bathroom. lol There was a small air conditioning unit in the living room and ceiling fans in every room. The "resort" itself was gated off, but the outside surroundings were not great. The hot tub was actually hot and the heated pool was awesome. It was like swimming in warm bath water. Most places these days do not live up too those expectaations. I would stay there again, but not using my fairfield points.. I didn't know that it was open to the public as it was supposed to be just for fairfeild

WATCH OUT! We went to a condo presentation there, and it took over 21/2 hours while we were promised 90 minutes. Also, we were not given ANY gifts for attending. We were promised 100 disney dollars, and we were not given ANYTHING for our time! DONT ATTEND THE PRESENTATION!

Summary Heading: We Enjoyed Our Stay at Dolphin's Cove
Summary: We just returned from a weeklong stay at Dolphin's Cove Resort (July24-August 1) and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Bear in mind that we were staying gratis courtesy of a friends whose "points" were expiring and they were unable to get away to use them. I would not have felt cheated had I been paying. Yes, the resort once used to be an apartment complex but it has been maintained very well. Each day something was being trimmed or painted or otherwise maintained. Our unit (#621) was clean, well stocked and perfect for our needs. Other reviewers have made mention that the units do not have central AC but a single unit that cools the living room, dining area and kitchen. The master beedroom was a bit warmer but is equipped with a ceiling fan. The unit also had a portable room fan

Fairfield should be ashamed! We are VIP level owners with Fairfield and have always loved our vacations and their resorts. But Fairfield should be ashamed to call this place a 'resort' and to have it as a property. Wish we had seen these reviews before arriving in this apartment complex. Problems, besides not being up to usual Fairfield standards: No central air, no air at all in master bedroom, kids room had no TV!!, ugly big table took up most of room, very small twin beds , no closets, no washer/dryer, no view, long congested drive to any beach, why is it 'dolphin cove'??, bedsheets were stained, mattress had big hole in it..why do we pay high maintenance costs for thos??, lousy game room, toilets didnt flush and I could go on but would rather not...We will contact Fairfield

Summary Heading: Nice Resort, Great Location for Disneyland
Summary: We recently completed a week-long stay at this resort.  The units had all recently been renovated and were nice and clean.  The resort was wel-maintained.  We did not have a single bug in the unit.  I would not hesitate to stay there again if I was going to spend a lot of time at Disneyland.  The downside (at least for some people) is that it is located in a rather congested area, so if you are used to other top resorts with more land, you might be disappointed.  As noted, it has a converted apartment feel to it, but the resort is well-run.  Employees were very courteous.

Summary Heading: To Miss Disney with the bad review of Dolphins Cove Resort
Summary: This is in response to the person who worked for Disney and claims she had this terrible experience at Dolphins Cove.  First of all, it is not in a bad neighborhood, because if it is, then guess what so is Disneyland because the shuttle took us less than 5 minutes to reach Disneyland, with stop lights.  Second of all, it may have been an apartment complex, which they told us, but it was extremely remodeled and extremely clean.  Our rooms, yes, I am a witness to more than one room, were extremely clean, well stocked with everything we needed from the kitchen to the bedrooms, living room and bathrooms. The pool was heated, they had a continental breakfast set up each morning in the courtyard for visitors, plus the clubhouse was a very nice size and available for use.  Oh, and did

What can I say nice other than decent proximity (but not walking distance) to Disney and nice greenery. I can't pull any punches folks .... This place is a dump. It was a old (low end) apt complex. They say they just did this major renovation to all the units. If that is true, I hate to see what it looked like before. 2 Bdrm apt - only one bathroom, 2 TV's (of which one did not work), sofa & chair that was so hard you may as well been sitting on a bench. No central heating or a/c. The units hung out the windows which were loud as well as defective. Laundry room seemed a mile away from the room. Not a comfortable stay at all. I do not recommend this to those who are used to staying in posh timeshares such as Marriott, Hilton, or Hyatt.

Summary Heading: Good Staff, Not a high end timeshare, good for Kids
Summary: The staff is nice and helpful. Free Childcare!!! as long as the parents stay at the property, they are over 2(?) and are fully potty trained.  The common area and pool are updated and nice, the game room is nice, The hot tub stays at 104 degrees which I think is too hot, and I like hot. The heated pool is very warm and nice. The (apartments are basically like the lower middle class type somebody else stated in another review. They have that apertment smell. I would guess they were built in the late 70's to early 80's Spacious enough though. It worked for us. We were never approached by the timeshare sales person.  Housekeeping cleans and makes bed one time during a 7 day stay and delivers towels 2 times. Dennys is next door, a quick mart is across the street. The hot water in

Went to a Fairfield presentation while on vacation in lake Tahoe. They showed us a model of "new" 5 star resort which was located in Anaheim.  They told us in was in the back lot of disney near frontierland. They didnt realize that I worked for disney. Furthermore, the resort itslef is located on the very fringe of the main hotel strip and we spotted many criminal activites taking place on Orangewood Ave. outside the resort. Also, the walls on the units are paper thin, as to not block the loud outside noise at all. Stayed in Dolphin's Cove in the beginning of Dec 03. Really enjoyed ourselves there. We've stayed at some nice hotels in LV (Luxor) and LA (Doubletree) before coming over to Dolphin's Cove, but the other hotels do not offer a memorable stay. In Dolphin's Cove (DC), they have a Kid's Cove whereby they organise activities for kids while mom and dad can relax in the heated pool.  The one-bedroom is very clean and neat...still bearing the smell of fresh paint! The layout of the room is very well thought out and it feels like we are actually staying at a service apartment. The fully-equipped kitchen is really a plus point especially when you wanna do you own cooking for a change. In any case, if you are hungry, Denny's is located just outside the hotel.

Dolphin Cove is excellently located within walking distance to Disneyland. The pool area and small kids area was fine for our three year-old. The resort had a kids movie night which my son loved. The two biggest problems I had were: there is only one heater/air-conditioner in the 1 bedroom unit and it is in the living room. It was also very, very loud. The other is the ants. My son ran out of the bathroom saying that there were ants everywhere. I went in expecting one or two ants only to find 50 - 100 ants marching in the sink and on the countertop.  The resort must know about the problem because there was a can of ant spray under the kitchen cabinet. Spraying kept them away that night but the next morning they were back and I had to spray again. Overall it was a good vacation

Summary Heading: Just a low-rent apartment in disguise
Summary: I was startled to arrive at the Dolphin's Cove 'resort' only to find that it is a lower-middle-class apartment building trying to pass as something more. The rooms were comfortable enough, and the grounds were okay, but after the hype of what it would be, I was letdown to say the least. The pool was nice, but the complimentary breakfast was skimpy and of poor quality. The children's playground was a small swingset.  There were ants in the bathroom. There's a coffee-maker in the apartment, but you have to pay a buck for any coffee packet after the first one. There is no housekeeping done beyond a change of towels. The parking stalls were dismal.
